channel.title: Stuff You Should Know on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in Stuff You Should Know on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Selects: Star Wars Holiday Spectacular | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Long ago, in a galaxy not so far away, George Lucas allowed the Star Wars Holiday Special to be made. What happened on the night of November 17, 1978 can never be fully explained, but we make our best effort in our annual special edition of SYSK. May the force be with us all. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Dictators Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are many types of dictators, from so called "benevolent" ones to the kind who rule with an iron fist. There are also many ways they can come into power, and they don't all include violence. Learn all about dictators past and present in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: What was the Skeleton Army? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Skeleton Army was a rowdy group of folks in England who battled, sometimes violently, with the Salvation Army - largely against their efforts to keep people from drinking and having a rowdy good time. Listen in today! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Pickles | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh loves pickles but hates cucumbers. Chuck loves cucumbers but hates pickles. WHO WILL WIN? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Matewan Massacre | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Matewan Massacre was a pivotal moment for the US mining industry and the labor movement as a whole. Learn about what happened in this sleepy West Virginia town today. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: What were the Freedom Schools? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Freedom Schools were set up in Mississippi in the heart of the Civil Rights Movement, with the aim of giving young black school children agency and a future. They remain one of the more inspiring and progressive programs in American History, yet so few know about them. We're hoping to change that. Learn all about them in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Murder of John Lennon | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On December 8th, 1980, John Lennon was shot and killed outside his apartment building in New York City, by Mark David Chapman. Music history was altered forever. Listen in to this tragic story. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Boba Tea | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Boba tea is bubble tea. But what are the bubbles? Tapioca pearls! Listen in today to learn about the disputed history of this trendy beverage. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Life and Works of J.D. Salinger | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description J.D. Salinger was a complicated and problematic human who stopped publishing soon after creating one of the great works of literature. Listen in today to learn the good, bad and ugly sides of the man who got famous, then dropped out. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Beavers: Tail Slapping Fun | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Beavers are in fact, very busy. They're builders and solid family members, husbands and wives. Learn all about N America's largest rodent in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: You Down With OED? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The story of the Oxford English Dictionary is really something. From its origin to its crowd-sourced literary quotations. Dive in today to learn all about the best dictionary. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Zipper Merge | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When you switch lanes on the highway after noticing that the lane you’re in is ending up ahead, you are literally ruining the world. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Plate Tectonics Are What Makes Earth Inhabitable | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s time to get jazzed about Earth science again. It’s only been 60 or so years since we’ve known the continents move around and we’re still figuring out exactly how they do. But one thing is for sure, that super-slow movement is super important. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: NYC Water: An Engineering Marvel | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Getting the rain and melted snow from upstate NY into the taps of every NYC resident and business is one of the great feats of engineering. Does it taste great and make perfect bagels and pizza crust? Sources say yes! Learn all about it in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Wreck of the Costa Concordia | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s astounding that with the exceptional navigational equipment aboard a cruise ship can run aground in the 21st century, and 32 passengers and crew can lose their lives within a thousand feet of land. Such is the power of incompetence and cowardice. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Magnetic Pole Switcheroo | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone once in a while, say a few hundred thousand years or so, the north and south poles of Earth’s magnetic field switch places. The result: Dogs and cats living together. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Legs! Legs! Legs! (The Periodic Table) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever wanted to listen to two totally untrained, non-chemists who are fully unqualified to explain how the periodic table works nervously explain how the periodic table works, then this episode is for you. Chemistry majors, be warned. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: E.T.: Is It Really the Worst Video Game of All Time? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you play video games you probably have an easy answer to worst game of all time: ET. But it turns out there are no easy answers, especially when you’re talking about a game so terrible it’s blamed for bringing the entire video game industry with it. Find out more in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Diners: The Most American Establishment? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Diners may just be the most American establishment there is. They were born in the USA, thanks to European immigrants, and they only exist in the USA, unless it's a kitschy homage. So break open that 12-page menu and order up. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Liberty Bell | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The story of the Liberty Bell is far more confusing than we imagined. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Diners: The Most American Establishment? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Diners may just be the most American establishment there is. They were born in the USA, thanks to European immigrants, and they only exist in the USA, unless it's a kitschy homage. So break open that 12-page menu and order up. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Tragic Death of Natalie Wood | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Natalie Wood was Hollywood royalty who tragically drowned after a long night of partying with her husband, Robert Wagner, and actor Christopher Walken. Over the last 40 plus years, stories have changed and the investigation has moved from closed to open. Listen in to learn this tragic story. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Who were the Buffalo Soldiers? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck dive into history in this classic episode to tell the story of the Buffalo Soldiers. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Scuba Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a good, old fashioned how it works episode where we break down all of the nuts and bolts and threats to safety that make scuba diving such a unique and thrilling hobby. Dive in feet first with Josh and Chuck on the undersea adventure of a lifetime! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Petrified Wood | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Petrified wood isn't just hard wood. Listen in today to learn all about this unique process. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Things We Believed Before the Scientific Method | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s easy to think of people in the distant past as kinda dumb for believing things like that mice could spontaneously generate from old grain. But if you look a little deeper, you’ll find there was a sensibility to the odd beliefs that came before science. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Are Election Laws Designed to Suppress Voting? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Are laws that are meant to protect the sanctity of the polling place in reality designed to make it harder for groups that traditionally vote Democrat to cast their ballots? Find out in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Harlem Globetrotters: American Treasures | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Harlem Globetrotters are an American entertainment institution. Their story may not be quite what you think either. Hint, they didn't originate in Harlem. Tune in now to learn their fun, fascinating story. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: White Dog Poop | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you grew up from the 70s to the 90s you know white dog poop. It’s the old, crusty – yes, white – phase that dog poop goes through as it ages on a lawn. Or it used to. Where has all the white poop gone? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The 14th Annual Halloween Spooktacular! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As per tradition, today Josh and Chuck perform a spooky Halloween story reading to delight, amuse and FRIGHTEN YOU TO YOUR CORE. Will Meagle show up? Tune in to find out! Thanks to guest producer Ben Hackett for all the great sound effects. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Mummies Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A mummy is a human being whose soft tissue has been preserved after death, and there are mummies around the world -- including natural mummies, as well as corpses that have been intentionally embalmed. Listen to this classic episode with Chuck and Josh to learn more. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Naked Mole Rats: A Face Only a Mother Could Love | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Naked mole rats are funny looking to be sure, but neither moles nor rats. So what are they? You'll have to tune in to find out. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Bed Sheet Ghosts | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The simple bed sheet has provided countless kids and adults with an easy go-to Halloween costume. But why do we associate white sheets with ghosts anyway? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Compton Cafeteria Riot | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Three years before the riots at Stonewall, the LGBTQ community of San Francisco's Tenderloin rose up. And the story was almost lost to time. Learn how and why today. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Where Did Trick-Or-Treating Come From? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We aren’t exactly sure who invented trick-or-treating – kids who realized they could extort adults for candy, or adults who bought off kids in exchange for laying off pranks? The bigger question is: Will trick-or-treating survive the 21st century? Learn more in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Kindness: Do It | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the tradition of our episodes on forgiveness and revenge, comes the third installment in the Emotional Roller Coaster trilogy. Kindness, it turns out, really does make the world go round. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Candy Corn | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Is it vile? Is it delicious? It seems to be both! Hear all about the history of candy corn, how it’s made, and who likes it in this pre-Halloween episode! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Criminal Father of Criminology | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Eugene Francois Vidocq is without a doubt one of the most interesting figures in modern history. He’s a former criminal turned undercover informant who went on to found the French national police force and the world’s first private detective agency. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Pain Scales: Yeeeow! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pain is subjective; it is whatever the person experiencing it says it is. But to effectively treat pain, it helps to quantify it, which is why medicine came up with pain scales. Learn all about them in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Intellectual Property Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Intellectual property sounds as dry as can be, but it’s actually very interesting. It’s at the heart of the global economy and the center of a dispute over what should belong to the people who create things, from poetry to pharmaceuticals. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Longyou Caves | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What’s better than discovering a mysterious cavern? Discovering five! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Parasocial Relationships: That Podcaster is Your Friend! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Parasocial relationships are fascinating and it turns out Chuck knows what it's like from both sides. Listen in today to your old friends. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Motion Sickness Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Motion sickness is the worst and hits about 25 to 40 percent of humans when they ride in cars, boats, or simply watch the wrong 3-D movie. Join us as we break down the science behind this nausea-inducing affliction in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Andy Warhol Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know Andy Warhol from his quip on being famous for 15 minutes and paintings of soup cans, but even as far as artists go he was an eccentric and misunderstood person. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Rhodium | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rhodium is one of the most valuable precious metals on Earth, though it has dropped in value by about 80% in the last year. Learn why by clicking play. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Night of the Grizzlies | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Grizzly bears had never killed a person in Glacier National Park until the night of August 12, 1967. That's when everything changed for National Parks moving forward. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Social Security Numbers: Less Boring Than You'd Think | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know that up until July 2011 an ambitious hacker with a good software program could deduce your social security number based on your date and place of birth? In this classic episode, the boys examine some of the lesser-known details of the Social Security system in the U.S. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Revenge: Bitter, Not Sweet | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Someone cuts you off in traffic or makes fun of your friend and all you can think of is how to get back at them and then some. But wait! Research has found that taking revenge actually makes you feel worse in the long run. Learn about what to do instead. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Dakota | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Dakota is one of New York City's great buildings. And its backstory is pretty great to boot. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Amazing Life of Christine Granville | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Christine Granville was about as James Bond as it gets. Stories of her life as a spy during World War II are legendary. Today we'll tell her story. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Cockney Rhyming Slang: Beautiful Gibberish | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What is Cockney Rhyming Slang? It's complicated and its origins are unclear. Learn everything we know about it today in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Kombucha: Fizzy Goodness | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Kombucha is pretty popular right now. But what is it exactly and where did it come from? The answers await you! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Origin of Math Signs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever stopped mid-pencil mark and realized to your astonishment where the plus sign came from? Then this one’s for you. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: 10ish Worst Business Decisions Ever | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s easy (and kind of fun) to laugh at the misfortune of CEOs and other high up business types when they bring it on themselves – so let’s do that now. Herein lies some of the worst business decisions ever made, hindsight being 20/20, of course. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Floods Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Floods happen when more water is introduced to an area than can be quickly removed. That's about it, but there's more to floods, what causes them and the havoc they can wreak. Join Josh and Chuck in this super-saturated classic episode of Stuff You Should Know. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Hyatt Regency Skywalk Disaster | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1981 America suffered the worst accidental structural collapse in its history. Listen in today to the tragic story of the fast-tracked building disaster that stills haunts Kansas City. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Why Spilling Salt is Unlucky | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Face it, when you spill salt your life goes totally off the rails, maybe even forever. Fortunately, we humans stumbled upon the one reliable way to counteract that bad luck by tossing some over our left shoulder. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Axolotls: The Smiling Salamander from Mexico | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a listener request! Axolotls are one of the more amazing animals roaming the planet right now – they can regenerate parts of their brains, can fight off tumors, are found in the wild only in one single lake? And did we mention they smile all the time? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Space Stations Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It seems like we largely take it for granted these days, but the fact that we have humans living in space is the realization of a scientific dream a century old. Visit the space stations orbiting Earth past, present and future in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Native American Reservations | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today we dive into the history and current state of Native American reservations. This serves as a nice follow-up to the Trail of Tears double-ep from 2017. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: History of OK | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Is OK the best word? It's certainly one of the most versatile. Check the interesting history of this weird contraction. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Made-up Disease of Syndrome K | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In WWII, Italy went through its own Jewish Holocaust, terrible at first then horrific as the Nazis took over the country. In Rome, a group of doctors hid Jewish refugees in plain sight in their hospital by giving them a highly contagious, highly fictitious disease. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Body Odor: You Stink | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh end up making reduxes of past episodes on things like sweating and deodorant in this all-new episode on the science beneath what makes people smell. Learn all about your odor in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Laurens Hammond: The Non-Musical Genius Who Changed Popular Music | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Laurens Hammond invented the Hammond organ and in the process changed music history. But he was much more than that. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Evil Eye | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You've seen the evil eye. Many Middle Eastern cultures have a long history with it. Learn how to thwart this curse today. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Fordlandia: Brazil Isn't Michigan | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Henry Ford tried to build a Midwestern American town in the Amazon rainforest in the 1920s. It's true. And yes, Chuck will say this should be a movie. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Toy Testing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It's every kid's dream - a job playing with toys that pays in toys. It's a real thing and has been around for a long time. Then there's the other side of the testing process, companies who ensure that toys are safe. It takes both of these testing techniques to successfully bring a toy to market these days. Dive into the ball pit with us today and learn all about toy testing in this classic episode.

item.title: Plant Migration | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Climate change is having sweeping effects on our climate and this is changing the world, not just for humans and other animals, but plants too. Will the Earth’s flora manage to find safe refuge in time? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Saturn's Rings | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Friends, treasure Saturn’s rings while they are young. They won’t be around forever. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Farmer's Almanac: Literature to Poop To | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Farmer's Almanac has a long rich history that is more than just moon phases and long-term weather patterns. Tune in to learn all about it. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Music Sampling Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today music sampling is a common practice, especially in electronic or hip-hop music. But how does it work? After all, other artists made the original music, and most of them would presumably like to be paid. Tune in to this classic episode to learn more about music sampling. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Mysterious Disappearance of the Franklin Expedition | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the great Arctic mysteries was the disappearance of the ill-fated Franklin Expedition in search of a northwest passage between the Atlantic and Pacific. Not one man survived the trip, and they left precious little behind in the way of clues. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Edward Mordake | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 19th century news spread of an unfortunate man who was born with an evil second face on the back of his head that spoke to him. The real story is that people keep falling for it. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How We’re Learning to Talk to Animals | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If we could talk with the animals, grunt and squeak and squawk with the animals, what would we say? We’d better start thinking of something good because researchers are learning to speak sperm whale, prairie dog, and a bunch of other species' languages. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Magnets Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You can stick them to the fridge or use them to transpose sound to tape, whatever they are used for magnets are surprisingly interesting. And knowing just exactly how and why magnets work will make you more interesting, which is why you should listen to this classic episode of SYSK. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Xenobiotics | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Science is just realizing the extent of the tiny pollutants that have entered ecosystems across Earth and inside all humans. We call them xenobiotics – substances foreign to our bodies – and what effects they have on us we’re only starting to learn. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: History of English | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who spoke English first and what was it like? Nothing like it is today. Listen in to learn all about it. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Dear Diary... | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Diaries have been around for a long time. There are many famous ones, and tens of millions that will never see the light of day. Learn about the history and benefits of journaling today. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Rainbows: Delighting humanity since forever | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rainbows seem to defy nature, but they're really pretty simple when it comes down to it. Turns out it's just light reacting to water droplets in the air. But they sure do look cool. Learn all about how rainbows are formed in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Last Meal Ritual | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The last meal of the executed is a longstanding tradition. Listen in today to learn about the dark history and modern practice of this culinary curiosity. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: NATO Alphabet | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Alpha, Bravo, Charlie. This is the NATO alphabet. But where did it come from? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: BPD: The Worst Disorder or Not a Disorder at All? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Borderline Personality Disorder has been described as emotional “third degree burns over ninety percent of your body.” It’s as close to a curse as a personality disorder can be: deep fear of being abandoned creates behaviors that end up driving people off. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: What's the deal with Stradivarius violins? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Strad violin is noted for its tonal qualities and superior craftsmanship. And for its price tag. There are many theories why the Strad sounds so great, from the wood to the lacquer, to the simple fact that Antonio Stradivari was really good at what he did. Rosin up your bow and take a listen to this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: MAD Magazine: A Tribute | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh grew up on MAD Magazine and we hope you did too. What started out as a comic book that spoofed comic books grew into the foundation of American satire and cultivated a healthy skepticism in generations of kids. Hail to the clods at MAD! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Blue Highway Signs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the US those ubiquitous blue highway signs that tell you which direction you’ll find a Burger King have an interesting backstory. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Learning a Foreign Language | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today, Chuck and Josh dive into the ins and outs of language learning. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Nirvana: Not The Band | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Hinduism and Buddhism are closely related in a number of ways, including their vision of what comes after we exit this mortal coil. Learn about the religions' interesting interpretation of the state of existence outside space-time, in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Magic Eye Illusions | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What became the Magic Eye illusion fad of the 1990s was born by way of the stereogram of the 1950s (and even before that). It's a winding story that you'll love! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Pie-In-The-Face Gag | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Throwing a pie in someone’s face was groundbreaking comedy once upon a time. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Insomnia: Why you can't sleep | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Insomnia is rough stuff. Listen in and learn all about why you can't fall asleep and what you can do about that. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Police Lineups Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Police lineups are something most people have never had any firsthand experience with. What you see on TV and in movies isn't so far off though. Learn about how these tropes work for real in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How PCP Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is probably no drug more mythologized than PCP. It drives users insane and has the unfortunate side effect of bestowing superhuman strength thus sending them on a rampage. But does it though? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Père-Lachaise Cemetery | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The most famous cemetery in Paris has some of the most famous people in the world buried there. And it's quite lovely. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Birth Order: So nice, we did it twice | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description This is a very special episode, the first one we've ever fully recorded a second time and decided to release. Why? item.title: Selects: How Bats Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They are creepy, sure, but they are also useful, cute and in great danger of extinction. Get a new lease on life from a new view of bats in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: James Beard: Food Legend | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description James Beard is well-known now for the annual awards named in his honor. But he used to be the most famous chef in America, and set the standard for what makes a celebrity chef. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Hollywood Sign | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Hollywood sign is an iconic landmark that started out as a real estate billboard. Can you believe it? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Trucking Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If truckers suddenly vanished the global economy would come to a grinding halt in a couple days. But as important as they are these highway heroes (mostly) are, they’re systematically mistreated by their industry. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: What Makes Lead So Poisonous? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The people of Flint, MI were horrified to find their drinking water was poisoned with lead. As we learn more about lead's effects and realize how persistent it is, the more worrying it becomes. What makes lead so toxic? Find out in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Butterflies: Caterpillars with Wings! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you thought caterpillars were awesome, just wait until you see them with colorful, iridescent wings! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Fahrenheit or Celsius | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Fahrenheit or Celsius? Why not both? If they can agree - exactly at -40 degrees - then it seems like we should all be able to agree they're both great as well. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Caterpillars: Nature's Magicians | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Caterpillars are simply the best. Don't think so? Well listen in and you'll soon agree See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Ocean Currents Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It's easy to overlook the importance of ocean currents - they move along out at sea, while we stay mostly on land. But we are globally affected by them every day. Currents form the base of the food chain, drive weather and keep life as we know it going. Explore them with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Afrofuturism Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Black sci-fi writers were shut out of their genre in the 20th century so they created their own vision of the future. That sentiment spread to music and film and today it’s so engrained in pop culture it doesn't need its own label. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Chia Pet | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It has arrived, the most important podcast episode in the history of the world. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Large Language Models and You | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a good chance that in March of 2023, humans crossed a threshold into a transformative new era when a new, smarter type of AI was let loose in the wild and an AI arms race began. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: SYSK Live: Back When Ford Pintos Were Flaming Deathtraps | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For this special live benefit episode recorded in Atlanta, Josh and Chuck go back to the 70s and look at the decidedly ungroovy course of events that led to Ford recalling its Pinto after people started burning up in them. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Alumin(i)um Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Humans made it through the Bronze Age and Iron Age, then we dabbled in steel, and now we are living in the Aluminum Age. The metal is so ubiquitous it seems like it’s been around forever, but we’ve only been really using it since the 20th century. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Suicide Forest | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The suicide forest in Japan is a beautiful place with a checkered reputation. Trigger Warning: This episode features a discussion of suicide. If you or anyone you know needs help, please call 988. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Stinky History of Human Hygiene | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever wondered when and why people started caring about body odors and cleanliness? Well look no further than today's episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Audience Testing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know some of our most beloved movies originally had different, sometimes better, endings? That is until they were tested in front of focus groups. Learn all about the how, what, and why of audience testing in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Is Reality Real? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Philosophers have been wondering whether we experience reality as it is for millennia now. They’ve pretty much settled on no, no we don’t. Now science has taken up the investigation and it’s proving the philosophers correct. So what is reality then? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: DNA Data Storage | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the more futuristic things around right now on Earth is research into encoding data into strings of genetic code. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Why Manners? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Keeping your elbows off the table, keeping your fingers out of the gravy boat – at some point these became very important rules of etiquette. But what purpose do manners serve? It turns out they just may be the glue that prevents society from unraveling. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Pterosaurs: Not Flying Dinosaurs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Almost everything you know about pterosaurs is wrong. They weren't birds, they weren't flying dinosaurs and they weren't all pterodactyls. Which makes this classic episode a great one for you to learn some new and amazing stuff about terrifying prehistoric beasts! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with intermittent fasting? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Could eating at only certain times of the day lead to weight loss? Possibly! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Rube Goldberg | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone knows what a Rube Goldberg machine is, but what do you know about the cartoonist who they're named after? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Saga of Milli Vanilli | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For a moment Milli Vanilli was the hottest musical act in the world. Then came the news that it was just that, an act, and the fall came swiftly and humiliatingly. Now, 30 years on, a look back yields not so much a cautionary tale as a very sad story. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Color Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Science doesn't have a good explanation for why we sense color, yet it is everywhere and affecting us all the time. But why should minutely different wavelengths of light have such an impact on our moods and motivations? Explore these questions and more with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Semi-Recent History of Exercise | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Humans exercising for better health has not been around that long. Today we dive into this fun history as we cover why and when we started this now commonplace pastime. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Pollen Count | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you watch the news and hear the pollen count is high for some particular type of plant then it’s high time you learned how they do that. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: What is the Bechdel Test? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Bechdel Test is a is a measure of the representation of women in film. You'd be surprised how many movies fail. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Dog Shows Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know those shows where people wearing sensible shoes jog dogs around in circles? They actually represent the pinnacle of a long and complex path to glory for dogs and their owners. Join Chuck and Josh as they peek inside the American dog show in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How Juries Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s totally bonkers that in the US and other countries, the job of determining the guilt or innocence of an accused criminal – whose life may be at stake – is left not to experts in law but to a group of random citizens. Even crazier, it generally works! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Mood Rings | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Mood Rings were all the rage in the 1970s. Then they went away, and fast. What's your color today? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Inflammation Theory of Disease | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Not too long ago we thought that germs were the cause of most diseases, leading to germ theory. But when we look at maladies from heart disease to Alzheimer’s one commonality stands out: inflammation. Could it be we’ve found the root cause of all diseases? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Slinky Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It has been called a "glorified spring", but Slinky is one of the best selling toys of all time. From accidental origins to an unlikely resurrection, Slinky has a pretty great back story. Learn all about it in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How TV Weathercasters Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description TV weather people can seem corny and maybe a little nerdy, but beneath that toothsome exterior lies the heart of a lonely warrior of science, one who is often overlooked as the hardest working member of the news team. Learn all about these unsung heroes. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Frances Kelsey: Hero of the FDA | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who is Frances Kelsey? Well, she's a semi-unsung hero of the FDA whose work helped save a lot of kids from congenital disorders and even death. Listen and learn! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Colosseum | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It's funny how similar The Colosseum in Rome is to modern day arenas. They really had it figured out. Tune in today to learn all about this early entertainment venue. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Does the body replace itself? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Does the human body really replace itself every few years? The answer is yes, but different parts of the body do so at different rates. Learn all about which parts of your body are the speediest, and which take the longest to regenerate, in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Introducing Smell-O-Vision! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Smell-O-Vision was a post-war movie theater gimmick that delivered well-timed scents to the noses of audiences to align with the movie. Did it work? Sort of. Did it ultimately fail? Yes. Does that mean it has gone away forever? No. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Dunbar's Number | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a theory that all of us have a maximum number of friendships that we can maintain – 150, to be exact. Suspiciously exact, really, if you think about it. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Nerf! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Another classic toys edition is at your collective feet. Today, we dive into the soft, padded world of NERF! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Manhunts Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When a suspect or prisoner goes on the lam there are plenty of ways to hide: in plain sight, in the mountains, in another country. There are as many types of ways law enforcement uses to track wanted people as their are ways to go on the lam, but there are some founding principles to carrying out a successful manhunt and they actually include you. Learn about how the fuzz tracks down fugitives and how it's evolving in the age of social media in this classic episode.

item.title: Carbon Monoxide: Please Just Listen Anyway | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It might not be the sexiest topic we’ve ever covered (and by “might”, we mean “definitely”), but there are some things you just need to learn about and this deadly and undetectable gas that’s part of our everyday lives is one of them. So buck up. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Botox Brain | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Botox can chase away the lines on your face, apparently it can chase away your depression, borderline personality disorder, and anxiety too. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Why does everyone love Dolly Parton? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today we dive in to celebrate the international treasure that is Dolly Parton. Why is she nearly universally loved? Listen in to find out. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Was There A Real Robin Hood? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Is it true that Robin Hood hung out in Sherwood Forest and stole from the rich to give to the poor? No. No, it’s not. Find out the real story in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: METI: Existential Threat? Probably Yes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We've wanted to contact extraterrestrials for as long as we've suspected they're out there. But as we get better and locating potentially inhabited planets, beaming messages their way is suddenly posing a threat. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Routines | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Routines are a key part of a successful life. Ask anybody about theirs and they'll be happy to share! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Should Rich Countries Cancel Poor Countries’ Debt? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It sounds controversial, but there are persuasive arguments for the wealthy Global North to write off the debts lower-income nations have accrued. Some say the US and Europe actually owe it to them. This is one of those boring ones you shouldn’t skip. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Coffins Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure, you've probably laid in one at the store or a funeral home, but how much do you know about receptacles used to bury the dead? We'll bet you'll learn plenty - like the difference between a coffin and a casket - in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: John Brinkley: The Quackiest Quack in History? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description John Brinkley was perhaps the biggest quack who ever claimed to be practicing medicine. Learn all about this not so good guy today! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Red Snow | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Thanks to green algae, there's such a thing as red snow. And we've recently found it can accelerate global warming. Look out! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description At 13,000 feet the ground is nothing but far-away squares of land, and you can even see some clouds below you. item.title: Selects: Some Nutso Fan Theories | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It turns out that the characters in your favorite TV shows and the like are actually dead, dreaming, dying or don't exist. Explore some strange fan theories with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Playing Cards? You Got That Right! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you've ever wanted to learn more about playing cards, now is your big chance. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Beethoven’s DNA | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It's been all over the news, Beethoven's DNA has revealed some interesting things about his health. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: What Caused the Late Bronze Age Collapse? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Humans’ first attempt at civilization went pretty well for the first thousand years. Important stuff like the wheel, writing, math, art, and diplomacy came out of it. But then, in the blink of an historical eye, it all mysteriously failed. What happened? See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Jet Lag Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It was only since 1958 that the Jet Age began, and jet lag became a real condition. Also known as desynchronosis, jet lag can lead to all manner of ailments, from sleeplessness to irritability to diabetes and cancer. In this classic episode, learn about how the body's natural clock runs normally and what happens when it gets out of whack when we cross time zones quickly. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: What's the deal with dowsing? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Dowsing, aka water-witching has been around a long time. And you might be surprised that's still a thing. We get into all the nitty gritty of this pseudo-science today. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Theme Park Cremations | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a little-discussed trend you might run into at your favorite theme park – people scattering the ashes of a loved one on rides. Here's hoping you don't literally run into it. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The First Road Trip | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back when cars were a brand new thing, before people even knew they'd stick around, two men and a dog drove from San Francisco to New York. This is their story. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Is The Uncanny Valley Real? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1970, roboticist Masahiro Mori wrote an essay that said the closer robots come to lifelike, the more they unsettle humans. His theory became the Uncanny Valley, and science has been evaluating it – and what makes something creepy - in recent years. Learn all about it with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: An Interesting, Vastly Incomplete Look at Baseball Cards | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the all-stars of the hobby world is collecting baseball cards. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Semantic Satiation | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know when you read a word over and over it starts to lose its meaning? There’s a term for that and why it happens is fascinating. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Floyd Collins was a natural-born caver who met a terrible fate, becoming stuck underground where no one could get him loose. item.title: Selects: Do People Really Run Off to Join the French Foreign Legion? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Anyone who knows anything about Jean-Claude Van Damme knows he played a French legionnaire in the movies. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh were around during the Golden Age of the arcade. And look how they turned out! Join them on a trip down memory lane. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description John Cage was a unique artist to say the least. Learn all about this avant-garde composer today. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Amaro is a delicious traditional liqueur, usually from Italy, that has delighted diners and drinkers for centuries. Tune in to learn all about this wonderful digestif. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description During World War II, Nazis invaded the United States with saboteurs bent on fomenting chaos. Three times. Learn all about it in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description You may have heard your parents or – gasp – grandparents prattle on about how amazing the original 1969 Woodstock Festival was. item.title: Short Stuff: Paprika | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Paprika is more than a smoky Hungarian spice. Actually, that's not true, that's exactly what it is. But it sure is delicious! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Noncompete Agreements, Come On | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A noncompete agreement, a pledge not to work for a competitor for a set amount of time, makes sense – when the worker is well compensated and privy to company secrets. But that doesn’t describe the vast majority of workers who’ve signed noncompetes. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Live From San Francisco: How Malls Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this classic show recorded live on January 5, 2017 at San Francisco’s Castro Theatre, Josh and Chuck delve into the history and the heyday of the church of consumerism and what it means for local communities and our capitalist society at large when malls die. item.title: Crosswords episode, perhaps? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Crossword puzzles have an interesting history and are a lot of fun to do. Dive in today to learn about Chuck's latest obsession. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: La Pascualita | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In a bridal shop in Chihuahua, Mexico a mannequin has been standing in the window since the 1930s that’s so lifelike some say it’s actually a corpse. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Awe-Inspiring, Absolutely Crucial Amazon | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever thought, “What’s the Amazon rainforest ever done for me? Nothin, that’s what,” then you’re dead wrong, friend. It covers 1 percent of the Earth’s surface but houses perhaps 30 percent of its species and it’s invaluable to all life on Earth. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Who Committed the 1912 Villisca Ax Murders? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In a small town in Iowa in 1912 eight people were murdered in the grisliest of ways while they slept. Local reputations were ruined when accusations flew, but could a drifting serial killer working across the Midwest have been behind it? Learn all about it with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Naps: Chuck's Secret Talent | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Naps are great if you can manage to find the space to take them. The trick is to do it for the right amount of time. We get into all in the ins and outs of Chuck's favorite time of day. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Sleeping On It | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s pretty well known that if you wait to make a big decision until after you get some sleep, you’re likelier to make a good one. But why should that be? Why, we’ll explain if only you’d listen. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Mystery of the Lost Amber Room | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh turn into the Hardy Boys for one of the great unsolved mysteries of WWII, a work of art worth a king’s ransom that went missing in 1945. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: The Max Headroom Affair | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1987, a very strange broadcast intrusion occurred in the city of Chicago. For just a couple of minutes, the odd TV character Max Headroom appeared onscreen in the middle of an episode of Dr. Who. He spoke in garbled tones, brandished a marital aid, and was spanked on the rear with a fly swatter by a person dressed in Annie Oakley garb. If this sounds weird, it is.

item.title: The Beverly Hills Supper Club Fire | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The fire at the Beverly Hills Supper Club was not in Los Angeles, but Kentucky. Which happened to be Las Vegas before Vegas was Vegas. Confused? Listen in and all will be clear. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Beulah Mae Donald | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1981 a Mobile mother of six was forced into the role of civil rights activist when the Klan murdered her son and she was moved to fight back. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Glorious Flamingo | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Flamingos are much more than just pretty pink birds. They are in fact, quite remarkable! Listen and learn… See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Cave Diving: Totally Nuts | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are extreme sports and then there is cave diving, the most extreme activity a person can engage in without leaving Earth. Cave divers stay underwater swimming miles into – that’s right – caves, where no human has ever been before. It’s pretty cool. Wade in with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: How (O)possums Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck take a listener’s suggestion – many, many suggestions – and learn that possums are pretty great and very much misunderstood. By the end of this episode you will too! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: No Shirt, No Shoes, WTF | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You can thank your parents and grandparents for the longstanding ban against dining shirtless and shoeless. While the concept was around, it mushroomed when hippies came along. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Honey: Nature's Wonder Sugar | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Honey is an amazing thing. Just ask any bee. They make a ton of it. So much that humans get what bees can't use and that's a lot of honey. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Easy Bake Ovens Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Easy Bake Ovens are as iconic as a toy can get, as American as apple pie or baseball. Learn all about these light bulb cooking, working ovens that endanger children to this day, in this classic episode. See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: The Largely Equine History of Veterinary Medicine | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Vets have been around for a long time, but mainly to care for horses. When horse travel went away, guess who saved the profession? Dogs! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Bird Migration | Stuff You Should Know

item.description: Podcast Description The exciting conclusion of Ants Part 2! Transcript

item.title: Selects: Southerners Aren't Lazy and Dumb, They Just Had Hookworm | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There was a time when the lower classes of the American South were considered lazy and dimwitted, a stereotype that still somewhat survives today. But this stereotype was rooted in fact. Hookworms, it turns out, were sapping Southerners’ life force. Find out all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How the Magna Carta Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1215 at Runnymede (doo dah, doo dah) the nobles and the king agreed to end a rebellion against the power of the English throne. While the treaty that emerged contained all sorts of arcane Medieval details, it also contained the seeds of Western liberty and civil rights. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Chameleons | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In today’s short stuff, we bust a few myths about cute little chameleons. Transcript

item.title: The Creepy Legacy of the Hotel Cecil | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Hotel Cecil in downtown Los Angeles has had no less than 16 unnatural deaths, from suicides to murders and everything in between. Listen in to the history of this decidedly creepy hotel. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Temper Tantrums Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When your kid boils over in the grocery store, it can be tough to stay calm and ignore it, but that’s precisely what experts prescribe parents do to deal with temper tantrums. Learn about the anatomy of a tantrum and the best way to deal in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Criminal Records: No Thanks! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description And you thought our crime and punishment suite was finished. Not yet it isn't! Not before we cover criminal records. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Handwashing vs Dishwashers | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck finally put to rest the age old debate over which is better – and learn a little about themselves along the way. Transcript

item.title: How Trepanation Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the oldest medical procedures in human history is also one of the riskiest. For thousands of years humans carried a type of proto brain surgery where a hole would be cut into the skull. And they were pretty good at it too. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Composting: Nature's Most Interesting Process | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You may think composting is just a bunch of old banana peels rotting away into dirt but, friend, you’re not looking closely enough. Inside that compost pile is a microcosmic universe doing some magical stuff. Learn all about it with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Les Paul & Leo Fender Part II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today we continue the story of Les Paul and Leo Fender, inventors, innovators and rivals. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Jackalopes aren’t real, right? Wouldn’t you like to know, city slicker. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Pet Psychics Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the early 21st century a trend of people who claim to be able to telepathically and clairvoyantly communicate with animals has grown. Today, the concept of visiting a pet psychic to find a lost pet, find out why a pet is behaving badly or even to learn if a pet is ready to be put to sleep is becoming more commonplace, but is there any basis to pet psychics’ abilities?

item.title: Y2K: Much Ado About Something | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Y2K was a special time when we all thought nothing bad would really happen at the stroke of midnight, but secretly worried the world would end. Turns out the mitigation efforts worked and we hardly noticed. Transcript

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Animal Domestication Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s strange to hear, but the transition from hunting-gathering to agriculture, including the domestication of wild animals, is the single biggest thing to ever happen to humanity. You can thank it for everything from kingdoms to Ebola. Learn all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Fireflies and Lightning Bugs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Whether called fireflies, lightning bugs, or glow worms, the tiny, bioluminescent bugs that light up the evening are universally beloved. Which makes their sudden and swift decline very distressing. Listen to find out how you – YOU – can save the firefly. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Humpty Dumpty is not a good nursery rhyme. And what was Humpty anyway? Listen in to find out. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Landslides Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Landslides are a form of mass movement of the Earth, and with the amount of death and destruction they wreak on the people and towns they cover, their toll can be massive. Learn all about landslides with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Every teenager in America knows the transcendentalists were a handful of goofy 19th century philosophers who were into walking in the woods, but they were also so much more. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Calamity Jane is group with the legends of the Wild West. Who was she really? A tough woman who made her way in a tough world from the age of 12. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In the early 1960s, one of the most unethical experiments in psychology’s history was quietly conducted in a state hospital in Michigan. It sought to upend the delusions of the three patients involved, but ultimately disabused the experimenter of his own. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Police Interrogation Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Every year, police across the U.S. get thousands of criminals to confess to their crimes. item.description: Podcast Description Space hurricanes are officially a thing. What does that mean for us here on Earth? Probably not much. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Mars Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure today Mars would kill you with its thin, toxic atmosphere and cold desert temperature swings of 100 degrees,but early on it and Earth were practically twins. item.description: Podcast Description Why exactly do we avoid walking under a ladder? Why is stepping on a crack in the sidewalk such a big deal? item.description: Podcast Description If you’re even passingly interested in mobsters you’ve heard of the RICO Act, but most people don’t know how it actually works. Make your Goodfellas fandom more well-rounded with this explainer episode. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description If you grew up in the 1980s, you thought you had a 50% chance of getting kidnapped every time you left your house. But like with the Satanic Panic and other 80s hysteria, it was much ado about (almost) nothing. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Ketchup Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Little-known fact: Ketchup, possibly the most all-American of condiments, evolved from fermented fish sauce people in Southeast Asia have been making for more than a thousand years. Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Reverse Osmosis Will Save the World | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Can we save the future of the human race with some thin membranes riddled with ultra-tiny holes? Science says yes! Thanks to reverse osmosis filtration, we can turn saltwater to fresh and finally say, Water, water everywhere so let’s all have a drink! Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description The words “hanged, drawn and quartered” are an accurate description of the grizzly execution process. They’re just not in the right order. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description The Radium Girls painted watched with glow-in-the-dark radium in the 1920s and ’30s. Most got sick, many died. This is their story. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Historic Districts Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A fascinating thing about Americans is that we can disagree on anything. item.title: SYSK Live: Koko, the Gorilla Who Talked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Recorded live before the pandemic in January 2020 at the Castro Theatre for San Francisco Sketchfest, Josh and Chuck explore the 70s movement that attempted to teach apes human language and the Ape Language Wars that erupted from it. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Sulfanilamide Disaster | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 1920s, before the era of consumer protection, a poison entered the medicine supply and killed more than 100 people before the public health disaster could be stopped. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck take a virtual walk through country music’s legendary music venue. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Faraday cages are one of those peculiar miracles of nature that we can actually explain – not to mention, they save us from potentially fatal electrocutions and electronic eavesdropping which are bonuses. item.description: Podcast Description Were chastity belts real? Sort of. But not in the way you might think. Tune in to hear the real story. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In World War II, a secret department of British ‘corkscrew thinkers’ hatched a plan to use the cadaver of an unclaimed homeless man to turn the tide of the war in the Allies’ favor. It worked. Learn all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Venus is so hot lead would melt on the planet’s surface. It spins backwards. Its year is shorter than its day. Venus is amazingly awesome. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description What is the Mojave Megaphone? Well, nobody really knows. Listen in today to learn about this desert mystery. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Today, Chuck and Josh go down a 90s rabbit hole with another in their classic toy series. This time, they tackle the odd sensation that was POGs. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever wandered past what looked like a pile of dog barf on a log during a hike in the woods, you’d just seen slime mold - one of the most perplexing organisms on Earth. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Listen in to today’s short stuff to learn if a runner’s high is really a thing. Transcript

Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Cave Dwellers Work | Stuff You Should Know

item.title: How Corporate Taxes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are lots of reasons to tax corporations: as a check on their power, to help pay for infrastructure, as a wealth tax. item.description: Podcast Description Join us today as we dive into the story of the first female self-made millionaire, Madam C.J. Walker. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Chuck loves palindromes. So much that his very name is one. Oh wait… Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Step into today’s short stuff to learn all about the armless wonder! Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Listen in and learn all about the fascinating history of everybody’s favorite pastime… karaoke! Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Dragons are like mermaids in that they’re not real. And that’s about where the comparison ends. Learn all about dragons today. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Mermaids: Not a real thing | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Mermaids aren’t real. That much we know. But the history and lore of these magical and sometimes menacing creatures of the sea is pretty interesting stuff. Learn all about these half women/half fish in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Why is the Equal Rights Amendment still not ratified? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The United States is one of only 28 countries in the world that doesn’t have equal protection for women under the law enshrined in its constitution. There was a moment in the 70s where it came very close, but then the conservative movement was born. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Dog Suicide Bridge | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A bridge at the town of Dumbarton in Scotland has a terrible reputation as a site where dogs inexplicably leap to their death on the rocks 50 feet below. There is no shortage of theories why, but none fully explain it. Transcript
