item.title: Is the Free Radical Theory of Aging Wrong? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 1990s we thought we’d identified the root cause of aging: nasty molecules called free radicals that wreaked havoc on our cells. Even better, we’d figured out how to counteract them with loads of antioxidants. Then science started raising questions. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Bridges: Nature Abhors Them | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description From prehistoric logs across streams to the 102-mile Kunshan Grand Bridge, nature works ceaselessly to take down spans. In this classic episode, learn about the fascinating ins and outs of bridge design and building and the mind-boggling challenges structural engineers face. Transcript

item.title: How Bruce Lee Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Bruce Lee may have introduced more Westerners to Asian culture than any person in history. And, because he died young just as he became an international superstar, he’s become a legend. Josh and Chuck try to uncover the man underneath. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Body in the Cylinder | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1945, residents of a Liverpool neighborhood found a desiccated body in a long cylinder they’d been using for years using as a bench. It launched a mystery that’s still alive today. Transcript

item.title: What Will Farming 4.0 Look Like? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The human population is expected to increase by a couple billion people in the next 30 years and those who are paying attention are wondering exactly how we’ll feed all those extra mouths. Will going high tech or getting back to nature save us? Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Chili Peppers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Born and raised in South America, chilis were the earliest crop domesticated in the continent and among the first items brought back to Europe by Columbus. Today people are really, really into them. Find out all about ’em in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Blue Holes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Geologists and biologists have recently realized that the planet’s oceans and coasts are littered with a unique type of ecosystem called blue holes, submerged sinkholes that were once dry caves. They are turning out to be weird and amazing places. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Freedom House Ambulance Services | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As part of Black History Month, we wanted to share the little known story of the Freedom House Ambulance Service. Listen in to learn all about this seminal group of EMTs. Transcript

item.title: The Disappearance of Lars Mittank | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 2014, a young German man walked into an airport in Bulgaria with a flight booked, then suddenly ran out leaving all his posessions behind, never to be heard from again. This is the story of Lars Mittank. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Why Are So Many Disembodied Feet Washing Ashore In British Columbia? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Between 2007 and 2016, 17 disembodied feet - still wearing shoes - have washed ashore between Washington and British Columbia. What’s behind the sudden influx of Vancouver’s mystery feet? Find out in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Housing Discrimination Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Owning a home in the US is a way to pass wealth down from one generation to the next and lift families into a comfortable life down the road. But there have been barriers to buying homes that Black Americans have faced from the time of slavery to today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: How California Got Its Name | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description California is a pretty cool name. And the story about where it came from is even cooler. Transcript

item.title: Sacagawea: Impressive Teen | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sacagawea was only 16 when she joined the Corps of Discovery. That is one seriously impressive teenager. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Earwax: Live With It | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Despite tons of people using cotton swabs each day to clean the earwax from their ears, cerumen (as earwax is clinically known) is actually quite beneficial to the health of your ears - and even kind of ingenious as your body’s defense goes. Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The NAACP | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The NAACP has long been one of the most robust and effective non-profits in the USA. And while it has faded a bit from its glory days, it still remains a vital cog in the battle for equality. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Balloonfest | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1986 Cleveland released more than a million helium balloons at once! It didn’t go at all according to plan! Transcript

item.title: How Groundhog Day Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know Groundhog Day – the holiday on February 2 when you wake up and have to go through the same day over and over again. It turns out the holiday has deep roots in a pagan past, and has survived in a surprisingly similar form. Transcript

item.title: Selects: Maggots: Good For Healing Wounds, Turns Out | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Cultures around the world over the years have been inspired by, then repulsed, then inspired by maggots’ ability to heal persistent wounds. We are in an inspired-by phase right now. Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Hydropower Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Humans have been stealing energy from flowing water for at least two thousand years. It wasn’t until the advent of electricity that things really got cookin’. All we need to do now is to work out the harmful environmental impacts of this green energy. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Vantablack | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description How black is vantablack? About as black as you could imagine. Transcript

item.title: The KKK: Loathsome Cosplay Rednecks | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The history of the KKK is rooted in hatred and racism, and it still is today. Learn all about these loathsome rednecks today. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Blimps Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After newsreels captured the Hindenburg erupting in fire in 1937, the promising development of airship aviation was cut short. Today companies and militaries are taking another look at blimps and the unique qualities that may revive them. Learn all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Finding the Fenn Treasure | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 2010 an eccentric art dealer hid a treasure chest with $2 million in valuables somewhere in the Rocky Mountains and published a poem with clues on where to find it. Hence began the most famous treasure hunt in modern times. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Necco | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you think Necco Wafers are the most disgusting candy on the planet, you are not alone. But it turns out there’s a rich history behind those chalky discs that make them fascinating, if horrible. Transcript

item.title: What does a tire company know about food? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Michelin Guide is an institution. But why does the famous tire manufacturer even put this restaurant guide out? Listen in to find out. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: What Was the Deal With the Hatfields and McCoys? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It was America’s most famous family feud, but the history of the Hatfields vs the McCoys is fraught with bias and inaccuracies. Dig into a disagreement in 19th-century Appalachia that became a very big deal around the world, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Science of Cute | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you took our advice and looked up baby beavers a few episodes back, you probably found them sooooo cute you couldn’t stand it. Or you just wanted to eat them up, which is weird if you think about it. Friend, prepare for the science on that! Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Silverfish | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Should you be afraid of these creepy little creatures you find in your basement? Only one way to find out. Transcript

item.title: Hell! Hell! Hell! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What is Hell? It's complicated and depends on which religion you're talking about. We dive into this fiery mess and do our best to explain it. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Skateboarding Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Skateboarding started out as something bored surfers did when the waves weren’t breaking, but after a few improvements to the design, it took off like a rocket to become its own cultural phenomenon. Come gleam the cube with Josh and Chuck as you ollie over this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Wright Brothers | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Orville and Wilbur Wright were not trained professionals, but they were rigorous experimenters who ended up changing the world. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Is It Theater or Theatre? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever noticed sometimes theaters – we mean, theatres – oh, forget it – places where you see movies or plays – are sometimes spelled two different ways? You can thank Noah Webster, author of the first American dictionary, for that. Transcript

item.title: Space Weather - What's That?! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know space has weather? It’s true! In our solar system, tons – literal tons – of highly charged gas and magnetized particles spew from the surface constantly, causing all sorts of weird stuff here on Earth. So far, nothing too bad has happened. Transcript

item.title: Selects: How Auto-Tune Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What began as a challenge to an oil engineer to make a terrible singer into a pitch-perfect one, Auto-Tune has become a ubiquitous (and, to many, obnoxious) part of the musical soundscape. Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: La Dame de Fer (Eiffel Tower) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Eiffel Tower is one of the top destinations on Planet Earth. It turns out to be a pretty cool feat of engineering as well. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Ig-pay Atin-lay (Sorry) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Turns out we have little kids from the 19th century, the Three Stooges, and an odd musical composer named Arthur Fields to thank for pig latin. Transcript

item.title: Theremins: World's First Electronic Music | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1919 a brilliant Russian scientist accidentally stumbled onto the first electronic musical instrument in history – the theremin – which you play not by strings, keys, or even percussion, but by moving your hand in the air around it. Prepare to science! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Sugar: It Powers the Earth | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since sugar spread from Polynesia a few thousand years ago, the world has been crazy for it. Insanely high prices, wars and even slavery couldn’t undo world’s need for a sugar fix. Today that fix is responsible for the obesity epidemic facing the West. Learn all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The SYSK 2020 Holly Jolly Extravaganza! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s here again! Our annual ad-free holiday spectacular. So pour up a hot toddy, throw a log on the fire and listen with the whole family! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Chinese Food on Christmas | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What started out as a tradition among Jewish people on the Lower East Side at the turn of the last century has become a full-blown American holiday custom. Transcript

item.title: How Buffets Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Buffets are every kid’s dream – until they grow up enough to realize how gross communal spreads of food shared with strangers actually are. Then the dream is dashed, for most of us at least. Learn about the golden age of buffets and more right here! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: The Star Wars Holiday Special of 1978 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Long ago, in a galaxy not so far away, George Lucas allowed the Star Wars Holiday Special to be made. What happened on the night of November 17, 1978 can never be fully explained, but we make our best effort in our annual special edition of SYSK. May the force be with us all. Transcript

item.title: Aspirin: The Wonder Drug | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Humans have been using a form of aspirin for pain relief since at least the Sumerians. But in recent years we’ve come to learn the wonder drug is indeed awe-inspiring, from preventing heart attacks to possibly protecting humans from cancer. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Modern Funerals | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The way we deal with our dead has changed a lot over the past 50 years. Learn all about it in 12-15 minutes right here. Transcript

item.title: Joseph Merrick, aka "The Elephant Man" | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Joseph Merrick was known as The Elephant Man because of his suffering from what we now know was Proteus Synrome. Learn all about this brave man in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What is a hangover, really? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After a night of heavy boozing, many partygoers find themselves the victim of a hangover. But what exactly is a hangover, and what causes it? Join Chuck and Josh as they break down the science behind hangovers – and how to avoid them, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Taliesin Massacre | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone knows who Frank Lloyd Wright is, but did you know there was a grisly massacre at his home in 1914? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Cramming | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Cramming is no way to study. Learn why in today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: How Class Action Lawsuits Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Class action lawsuits seem a little odd – a bunch of people get together for a sue-fest against somebody – but in the legal world they’re a practical way of handing huge wrongs. And! They keep justice just in their way. Learn all about them today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Chaos Theory Changed the Universe | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since the age of Descartes, science has put all of its eggs in the basket of determinism, the idea that with accurate enough measurements any aspect of the universe could be predicted. But the universe, it turns out, is not so tidy. Explore the final frontier with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: John Lennon and the FBI | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that Richard Nixon had a FBI case file open on Beatle John Lennon? Well he did! Why? Listen in to find out. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Pimento Cheese! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pimento cheese was originally nothing like it is now: It was mass produced, it was made from cream cheese and it was conceived in New York. Today it’s something much better, thanks to the South! Transcript

item.title: Cabbage Patch Kids: Must-Have Toy of the Century | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Surprisingly, Cabbage Patch Kids have turned up on SYSK almost as much as the Nazis or Seinfeld. It’s finally time to dive all the way into CPKs, from their controversial origins to the Christmas craze of ‘83 to their alter egos, Garbage Pail Kids. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Tea Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Legend has it that tea was discovered by a curious Chinese emperor after leaves blew into his boiled water. Now tea is the second only to water in popularity worldwide. And despite the varieties of tea, they all come from a single species of plant. Learn all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Gobble Gobble: Turkeys! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Turkeys are a very interesting bird as it turns out. Which may be why many people are leaving it off their Thanksgiving table this year. Learn all about them right now! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: How Eyes In a Painting Follow You | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever noticed how eyes in a painting sometimes follow you around the room? It’s weird! But it’s also fully explainable and Josh and Chuck do just that here. Transcript

item.title: Patty Hearst: Brainwashed or Bandit? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Patty Hearst was a young heiress living a quiet life studying art history at college when one Monday evening her home was invaded, she was kidnapped, and her life took a totally unforeseen turn that she would have trouble explaining for years to come. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Whatever happened to acid rain? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Along with the hole in the ozone layer, acid rain was one of the first international environmental threats. It’s fallen to the wayside in the face of climate change, but we have yet to lick it. Join Chuck and Josh as they revive the 80s drumbeat in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Great War of the Worlds Panic Myth | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On Halloween 1938 young radio star Orson Welles scared the pants off of America with a fictional news bulletin claiming Martians had landed and were destroying the country. People across the nation ran wild with panic in the streets – or did they? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Squirrel Nuts | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We know squirrels hide nuts. But it’s actually more complex a system than you think. Transcript

item.title: How Pain Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In recent decades we’ve come to understand that there’s a lot more to pain than: touch hot stove/feel burning hand. Pain is a far more sophisticated experience and, unfortunately, a system that can often go haywire, with terrible effects. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Who Gets to Name Continents? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description America is named after Amerigo Vespucci, right? Maybe not. And who named Australia? Find out the unusually uncertain origins of the continents and other interesting stuff in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Macy's Thanksgiving Parade Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For almost a century, Macy’s department store has kicked off the holidays in America with a grand parade. And when you march thousands of clowns, lip synching celebrities, bands, and giant balloons through New York things get remarkable. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Plastic Pink Flamingos | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Plastic flamingos started out as innocent yard art, transformed into folk art, and have become a (kind of mean) symbol of high campiness. There’s a lot to this particular plastic yard art. Transcript

item.title: The Bay of Pigs Disaster | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Bay of Pigs is one of the blackest of eyes on American foreign policy. Learn all about this dark spot of American history today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Geysers: Nature's Innuendo | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The spectacular eruptions of steam and water we call geysers are only the tip of the proverbial iceberg, the result of thousands of years of specific natural conditions and physical processes. Learn the Stuff You Should Know about geysers in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: All the Gold In Fort Knox: Meh | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When Fort Knox was built in the 1930s to house America’s gold supply, it was billed as an impenetrable, impregnable, don’t-even-think-of-trying vault. But as the world has moved further away from gold, the stockpile’s lost a bit of its luster. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Fruit Flies, Why? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever wondered why we do so much scientific testing on fruit flies? Turns out they make better models for humans than you’d think. Transcript

item.title: The Amazing Roberto Clemente | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Roberto Clemente was what’s called a “complete” baseball player – he could hit, run and, man could he throw, so it’s no surprise he was made a Hall of Famer. But he was also a humanitarian, a civil rights icon, and a fiercely proud son of Puerto Rico. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Ghosts Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description According to a 2009 poll, more Americans believe in ghosts than don’t. But what are ghosts exactly? If they do exist, what are they made of and why are they hanging around? In this classic episode airing for Halloween, Josh and Chuck explore both sides of the divide between belief and skepticism on the topic of ghosts and look at some pretty cool explanations for hauntings. Transcript

item.title: SYSK’s Scare Your Pants Off (and Back On) Halloween Spooktacular | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s that time of year again! So turn down the lights, pull the sheets over your eyes and prepare to be thrilled and frightened with two great Halloween stories from Philip K. Dick and M.R. James. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Poe Toaster | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For at least sixty years a mysterious person (or persons) showed up at Edgar Allen Poe’s grave to toast the master on his birthday. No one ever found out who this legendary figure was. Transcript

item.title: A History of Nursing Homes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In America, we’ve treated our senior citizens in very different ways over the years. Tune in to hear about how we’ve tackled compassionate care. Transcript

item.title: Chuck Bryant On The Why I’m Voting Podcast | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to change, preserve, or build a better America, there’s one easy way to make your voice heard: Vote. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Book Banning Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to control the masses, control what they read. After all, books are seeds that germinate new points of view. As a result, the struggle against banning books is contentious and continual. Learn more about banning books in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Beavers: Tail Slapping Fun | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Beavers are in fact, very busy. They’re builders and solid family members, husbands and wives. Learn all about N America’s largest rodent today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Haunted Real Estate | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have to disclose the notion that your house may be haunted upon sale? Listen in to find out. Transcript

item.title: 10 Voter Suppression Methods | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Voter suppression in the USA is as old as voting itself. Listen in to hear about 10 ways we stifle the vote. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Sushi Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sushi grew out of a way to ferment fish a couple thousand years ago and in the late 20th century began to take the world by storm. What began as traditional, rigid food has come to evolve with new delicious innovations being added to the original canon. Learn all about it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Porcupines: Little Stabby Cutie Pies | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We love animals. A lot. Especially underrated ones like the darling porcupine. Listen in today to learn all about these stabby little boogers. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: What is Latinx anyway? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We love to keep up with the current terminology for groups of people. Learn about the origin of Latinx today. Transcript

item.title: Wind Tunnels: More Important Than You Realize | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Without wind tunnels we may not have airplanes right now. Early aviationists built them to puzzle out how to get and stay airborne. But wind tunnels are used for so much more than flight – from microchips to wind turbines. Enjoy this breezy episode. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Bigfoot Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For centuries North American tribes have told stories of a hairy wild giant in the wilderness, and once Europeans arrived they claimed to see it, too. Chuck and Josh examine the claims of believers and the rebuttals of skeptics in this evenhanded episode from the SYSK archives. Transcript

item.title: Printing press? Big deal! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Was the printing press a big deal? You bet it was. One of the biggest. Learn all about the early history of printing today. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Lying in State | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After RBG passed away she had the honor of lying in state. Who decides this? Listen and you’ll know. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with swing states? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Swing states are all the rage once again this election season, but the makeup has changed a bit. Learn all about what makes a swing state a swing state right now. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Electoral College Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When you vote in an American presidential election, you’re not voting for your candidate - you’re voting for a group of people you hope will in turn vote for your candidate. Listen in to learn more about the strange process for electing the president, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Fallout Shelters: Probably Useless (Let’s Never Find Out) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The advent of nuclear weapons and the Cold War kicked off a craze in the US for building rec rooms with foot-thick reinforced walls and outfitted with survival rations and board games. Would they work? Probably not. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: That's A Head Scratcher | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s actually really strange that scratching your head is a widely understood sign that you’re puzzling over something. No one’s exactly sure why we do that, so interesting theories abound! Transcript

item.title: Conjugal Visits: Not exactly what you think | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After reaching their peak, conjugal prison visits are all but gone in the U.S. Learn all about these frisky visits in today's episode. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Rabies Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rabies may have gotten a lot of attention in the U.S. in the 70s and 80s, but it’s still an issue in developing countries. Learn all about this nasty virus in this classic episode. And stay away from raccoons and bats. Transcript

item.title: At Long Last: Hawaiian Overthrow Episode | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description By longstanding listener request, we look at how Hawaii was basically stolen by the United States in the 19th century. Rather than reverse this bit of geopolitical fraud, the US ended up making Hawaii a state instead. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Petticoat Rulers | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Petticoat rulers were women who ran the show long before anyone thought they could. We’re talking mayors and entire city councils comprised of women in the Old West. What happened since then? Listen to find out. Transcript

item.title: How Sweepstakes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sweepstakes were invented as marketing tools to drum up interest for a product or sales. But winning them can be fun and as they’ve proliferated an entire subculture of people who enter hundreds of them a day. Enter the fascinating world of sweepstakes today! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How White-collar Crime Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description White-collar crime often involves fraud and other nonviolent acts. For most people, the term “white-collar crime” conjures up images of CEOs conniving their way to fortune. But what is it, really? Listen in as Josh and Chuck break down the facts in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Election Polling Works and Doesn't Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Election polling had a pretty good rep until 2016. But it turns out they weren’t far off even then. It’s really the media driving the narrative. Learn all about how election polling works today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Black Cowboys | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Most people don’t realize that around a quarter of the cowboys found in the Old West during the golden age cattle driving were African American. Let’s meet some of them, shall we? Transcript

item.title: Origami: Folding Goodness | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Origami is an amazing art that consists of making folds in paper to create something beautiful. Learn all about it today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Porta-Potties Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Despite our lengthy history of evacuating our bowels and bladders, it wasn’t until the relatively recent 1940s that we began to construct portable, self-contained toilets to accept our waste. Dive into the world of porta-potties in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Wetlands! Wetlands! Wetlands! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s time to get jazzed up for some Earth science of the waterlogged variety. Join Chuck and Josh as they tour some of the most interesting ecosystems on the planet and learn why we need to stop destroying them post haste. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Streisand Effect | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What does Barbra Streisand have to do with the internet? Listen and learn! Transcript

item.title: Frances Perkins: Influential and Unknown | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Frances Perkins was an incredibly influential American yet is virtually unknown. What did she do? A lot! For instance, Social Security was her brainchild. And that’s just the tip of the old iceberg. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Police Chases Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Entire TV shows are dedicated to them and Americans love to watch a live one, but police chases aren’t as routine as they seem. While police assert chases are important tools, critics say cops engage in chases too often and too easily. Learn all about the what, how, and why in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Disturbing Disappearance of Tara Calico | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When Tara Calico mysteriously vanished in 1988, suspected to be the victim of foul play, her case may have gotten lost with the countless other missing person cases in the US, were it not for the discovery of an alarming Polaroid photo in a parking lot 1500 miles away. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: More Phrase Origins | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’re back with another handful of phrase origins. Transcript

item.title: How the Escape from Alcatraz Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1962, three ordinary criminals transcended into folk heroes when they crawled out of their cells in Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary took to the water in a homemade raft and were never heard from again. Could they have possibly survived? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Polyamory: When two just won't do | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this classic episode of Stuff You Should Know, Josh and Chuck dive into the world of polyamory. Turns out polyamorists aren’t aren’t weirdos and deviants, they’re just regular folks looking for love from more than one person. Learn all you ever needed to know about this unique, but not so modern arrangement. Transcript

item.title: Blacksmiths? You got that right! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Blacksmiths? You got that right. Learn all about this age old occupation in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Carrots and Your Eyes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join Chuck and Josh as they learn that one of the great childhood truths – that carrots help you see better in the dark was totally made up! Transcript

item.title: How Sneezing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Unless you have an arcane disorder from a lesion on a very specific spot on our medulla, the chances are you sneeze. Turns out most animals do it, even lizards! Learn the whys and hows of this most interesting involuntary reflex. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Panic Attacks Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Almost three percent of Americans suffer from a debilitating disorder that causes them to suffer intense fear seemingly without reason and science hasn’t yet figured out what causes it. Join Josh and Chuck in this classic episode as they get to the bottom of panic attacks. Transcript

item.title: 1-800-PODCAST | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh dive into the wacky world of 800 and 900 phone numbers. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Great American Coin Shortage of 2020 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In addition to all the lousy things that’s come out of the Coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. is also experiencing a coin shortage thanks to a stalled-out economic system that normally circulates coins. Transcript

item.title: How Anti-Dieting Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a movement afoot that says we should all stop thinking about our weight and just enjoy food. No, it doesn’t help you lose weight…No, it’s not a diet…No, - just listen to the episode, okay? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How The Human Microbiome Project Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If it was possible to take a full scan of all of the DNA of every cell in and on your body the results would be startling: Only 1 percent would be human. The other 99 percent comprises all of the bacteria, fungi, viruses and other microbes you literally cannot live without. Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Olympic Torches: Remember Those? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in the pre-pandemic days we had a sporting event called The Olympic Games. And at those games there was an opening ceremony that featured the lighting of a cauldron from a torch. Let’s chat about that, eh? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Return of Bill Gates! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Our old pal Bill Gates is back for a very special short stuff where we talk all about Covid vaccines and therapeutics. Transcript

item.title: Pirate Radio: Mavericks on the High Seas | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pirate radio started out in England as a way to sidestep the regulations of Big Radio. While outlawed, it still exists today in the UK and America. Learn all about it today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How The Moonwalk Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When Michael Jackson debuted the moonwalk in 1983 the world was enrapt. The dance goes back farther, to the 1930s, and pops up again in the 50s, before reappearing via mimes and West Coast poppers in the 70s. Follow the circuitous route of an iconic move in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Miniature Golf Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Playing miniature golf is a very fun thing to do and, you’re about to find, learning about its origin and history is very fun as well. Join Josh and Chuck as they tee off on the mini golf story! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Jigsaw Puzzles | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who doesn’t love a good puzzle? Tune in to learn a few facts and figures about jigsaw puzzles right now. Transcript

item.title: Wasps: Not as cute as bees | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Wasps have a bad rap. Because their sting really hurts and they don’t make honey like their cousins. But they are super cool and you shouldn’t kill them. Listen and learn! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Rosetta Stone Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes providence smiles on historians. Thus is the case with the Rosetta stone, an ancient Egyptian tablet that served as the key for unlocking hieroglyphics, lost to time for a millennia. In this classic episode, learn about the international intrigue, rivalry to translate it and the luck that led to the founding of Egyptology. Transcript

item.title: How Soap Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Soap is a miraculous substance – and mysterious too: we have no idea how humans first figured out to make it. We lived with soap for millennia before we thought to use it to wash ourselves with it, but once we did a love affair with cleanliness was born. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Habsburg Jaw | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Habsburg Jaw is the result of inbreeding. But what is it? Click play and learn! Transcript

item.title: How Hurricanes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Hurricanes are perhaps the most destructive force of nature we have to deal with here on Earth. When a mind-boggling number of factors all fall into place just right, the outcome can be an enormous system of storms that is as awesome as it is powerful. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Lobbying Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Lobbying is an entrenched part of American politics and one that many people think is breaking government. But petitioning the government is protected in the Constitution. How can this system be fixed? join Josh and Chuck as they explore the topic in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Mobile Phones | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today we deep dive on mobile phones, wonders of the modern world! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Death of Billy the Kid | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure, together Young Guns and Young Guns II form an exhaustive biography of Billy the Kid’s life. But did you know they also contain misleading information? Billy the Kid may not have lived to 100 under an alias after all! Transcript

item.title: How We Almost Got Rid of Polio | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For more than half of the 20th century parents in the industrialized world were freaked out by an unseen waster of youth, the poliovirus. It spread easily and could paralyze children for life or even kill them. Its effects were so horrible that humanity set about ridding if from the Earth. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How a Flea Circus Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever seen a flea circus, then count yourself among the few. It’s a dying art, but back in the day they thrilled and delighted young and old alike. Learn all about the tiny big tops in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Robber Barons! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The robber barons were not a group of evil super villains. OR WERE THEY? Learn all about these titans of industry from the Gilded Age in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Centralia Coal Fire | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description An old coal mine in Pennsylvania caught fire one day in the 60s and it’s been burning ever since. What’s crazy is this happens all the time. Transcript

item.title: Flagpole Sitting: A Real Fad | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The 1920s were just absolutely nuts. People got into weird fads really intensely and one of the strangest of all was flagpole sitting. It’s just what it sounds like – sitting on top of a flagpole for as long as you can. One man sat above them all. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Landfills Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Well-planned landfills have only recently come into widespread use. Recently, waste managers have found that they work a little too well and now the landfill is being reinvented. Transcript

item.title: Essential Oils: Nature's Cure? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Essential oils are from plants and they can help the human body in a lot of ways. There are also many false medical claims. Learn all the ins and outs today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The @ Symbol | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know the at symbol? This thing: @? There’s a name for it, just not in English. We just call it the at symbol. But other countries – stand back! Transcript

item.title: What was the KGB? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The KGB was the notorious strong arm of the Kremlin. Run afoul and you died. Learn all about them today. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: All We Know About Guessing | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Guessing is a weird thing. For millennia, it could have meant the difference between life and death. Now it’s not as vital, but we still do it every day, whether behind the wheel of a car, or judging what another person might be feeling. In this classic episode, learn everything we know about the brain and how it manages this odd, very human act. Transcript

item.title: Oh Yes, How Soil Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is maybe nothing that sounds more boring than hearing two people talk about soil, but friend, prepare to be amazed at the details of what makes this amazing substance the life blood of Earth itself! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Science of Funny Words | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Why are some words funnier than others? Well, one man has sought to figure that out. We’ll tell you all about him and his project in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Bruxism: Grinding Your Teeth Is the Pits | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Researchers have noticed that as incidence of anger increases so too has teeth grinding, known clinically as bruxism. That’s a problem because when people grind their teeth, especially when they’re sleeping, they can wear them down to nubs. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Juggling: What the Heck | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a lot – A LOT – to juggling and Chuck and Josh go over the lion’s share of it in this classic episode. Delve into the deep history, physics, how-tos and different types of juggling in this surprisingly sweeping look at a putatively innocuous pastime. Transcript

item.title: Matcha: That Ain't Just Tea | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Matcha is something else, healthy and delicious and all the rage. Learn all about this trendy beverage today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Nouns of assemblage... assemble! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A gaggle of geese. A murder of crows. Nouns of assemblage are awesome and we talk about them for about 12 minutes in today’s Short Stuff installment. Transcript

item.title: How Ultrasound Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure you know all about ultrasound. You can see pictures of little babies right there cozy in the womb just by waving a magic plastic stick over the mom’s tummy. And magic is basically right. Believe us. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Research tips from SYSK | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description People often ask us how we do our research. We’re not going to disclose all of our secrets, but we’ll give you some tips on how to root out the bad studies from the good ones. Learn all about shady studies and reporting in this classic episode! Transcript

item.title: The Manhattan Grid | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Manhattan is well known for its unyielding and kind of boring layout. Turns out it was the “work” of three men. Learn all about their decidedly unambitious design in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Haint Blue | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Haint Blue is a kind of robin’s egg color that you might commonly find on porches of the low country of the Southeastern United States. But what does it have to do with ghouls and ghosts? Listen and learn! Transcript

item.title: The War on Fat: The Seven Countries Study | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Seven Countries Study was a fairly impressive, long-term study on the effects of fat in our diet, among other things. But it was very flawed and launched the misguided “War on fat.” Learn all about today, then make up your own mind. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Flamethrowers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who first decided that it would be a great idea to shoot flame at other people from a distance? Josh and Chuck talk about the (very) early origins, history and technology of the flamethrower in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Can You Eat A Tapeworm To Lose Weight? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a persistent insistence that you can ingest a tapeworm and as the parasite hijacks a lot of the calories you eat, the pounds will fall right off. In theory this could be true, but it’s also extremely dangerous. And has anyone ever really done it? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Foie Gras | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Foie gras means “fatty liver” in French, which makes sense because it’s made from the overripe livers of force-fed ducks and geese. Transcript

item.title: How Project Star Gate Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In yet another testament to how amazingly great the 70s were, in 1975 the US started a program that tried to harness the powers of clairvoyance to remotely spy on the Soviet Union. Since clairvoyance doesn’t seem to exist, it wasn’t super successful. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How The Black Panther Party Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Black Panther Party was a complex political movement that was unfairly painted as a militant group who hated white people. Far from it, they were actually men and women trying to affect change in their community. Their history is one of the more interesting American stories, from the early stages of policing the police to their community service efforts to their inevitable fall. Learn all about the Black Panther Party in this classic episode.

item.title: The Massacre at Tiananmen Square | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tank Man. An indelible image burned in our brains. But what led to this extraordinary event? Chuck and Josh walk you through the days and weeks leading up to the massacre at Tiananmen Square, which is more of a cautionary tale than we realized. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Disappearing Dirty Dancing Lake | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The lake from one of the all-time great movies (search your feelings, you’ll find that it’s true) is turning into a dried up mudhole. Turns out it has some unusual features. Transcript

item.title: Heroin: The Drug | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve covered a lot of drugs in our history, and today we tackle heroin, one of the most dangerous of all. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Jackhammers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s likely that without the invention of the pneumatic jackhammer, the Industrial Revolution wouldn’t have hummed along quite so smoothly. Certainly a lot more trains would go around mountains than through them. Learn about this essential tool in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Narcolepsy Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Narcolepsy is one of those amazing rare disorders that everyone thinks they understand – people just fall asleep at random times, even in the middle of doing something. But there’s a lot more to it and – even better – we actually may be able to explain it. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Lawn Darts | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There was a time when kids had to look out for flying darts that could pierce their skulls when they played in the backyard. Transcript

item.title: Hummingbirds: Ornery Helicopters of the Animal Kingdom | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you didn’t already know how amazing hummingbirds are, prepare to learn. Not only do they count among their numbers the smallest bird species, they are also lightning fast and have the endurance of a marathoner and a telethoner put together. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How The Enlightenment Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Enlightenment stands as the moment the West withdrew from superstition and found its faith in reason. Did it shift too far? In this classic episode, learn about this massive shift in thinking which we are still sorting through and coming to understand today. Transcript

item.title: Josh Clark's Speech from Commencement: Speeches for the Class of 2020 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode of Commencement: Speeches for the Class of 2020, Josh Clark, co-host of the Stuff You Should Know podcast, divulges secrets to graduates that their parents and teachers may have neglected to tell them. Transcript

item.title: How Bras Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Bras are loved and hated, sometimes at the same time. But as difficult and restrictive as they can be, they rescued women from a much cruel contraption: corsets. The question remains, though, do women need bras at all? Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Mary Had A Little Lamb | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know the little nursery rhyme is controversial? It’s true: Two towns in New England can barely stand to see one another on the map (kind of). Transcript

item.title: How Spiritualism Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Something spooky was born on the American frontier in the mid-19th century: the idea that people’s personalities survive death and that some gifted individuals can communicate with them. It developed into a religion that some still practice today. Transcript

item.title: Chuck Bryant's Speech from Commencement: Speeches for the Class of 2020 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode of Commencement: Speeches for the Class of 2020, Chuck Bryant, co-host of the Stuff You Should Know podcast, reminds graduates to not let this season define them, reminding them the world believes in their ability to craft a better future for themselves. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Fire Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Creating fire was possibly the most important human discovery, but it’s easy to take for granted. But. Josh and Chuck get to the bottom of the chemistry of fire in their quest to explain everything in the universe, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Peanut Butter Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description No food is more all-American than peanut butter – 80 percent of homes in the country have a jar of it in the pantry right now. And while the rest of the world might find peanut butter peculiar, maybe even gross, the rest of the world is wrong. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Charley Horse | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know those terrible leg cramps that come out of nowhere? They may be named after a drunken baseball pitcher. Transcript

item.title: How Herd Immunity Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Herd immunity is an epidemiological concept that if enough people are inoculated against a disease the rest of us won’t get it. It’s been useful in holding back diseases like polio and measles, but we have vaccines for them. We don’t have one for Covid-19. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Caving Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Entrances to the underworld have been places of wonder for eons, and humans have ventured into caves to sleep, hunt, create art and explore. Thanks to the hobby of caving, that tradition continues today. Get all this plus Chuck discussing his caving experience, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Zippers: Humans’ Greatest Invention? No, But Still Good | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The zipper may be the most unsung invention we humans have ever come up with. Prior to zippers, everyone walked around like idiots with nothing but buttons to hold their clothes together. The zipper changed all that. The zipper changed everything. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Gibtown: Sideshow Central | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There was a glorious time in American history when circus sideshow performers lived together in a small town in Florida. Learn about the fascinating history of Gibtown today! Transcript

item.title: I'm Spartacus! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Spartacus was a real dude. He led a slave revolt, and was pretty successful to boot. I’m Spartacus. You’re Spartacus. We are all Spartacus. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How do dogs perceive time? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A dog that knows exactly when its owners will arrive home every day seems to have a human perception of time, but in fact, they perceive time very differently than we do. Find out more about how dogs view time in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Agatha Christie: Queen of the Murder Mystery | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Agatha Christie was a great writer of murder mystery novels and is probably the best selling author of all time. Listen in today to learn her story. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Mullets: 'Nuff Said | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Business in the front, you know the rest. Listen in as we discuss the lifestyle choice that is the mullet. Transcript

item.title: How Existential Risks Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description An existential risk is a special kind of threat that are different from other types of risks in that if one of them ever befalls us, it would spell the permanent end of humanity. It just so happens we seem to be headed for just such a kind of catastrophe. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the U.S. Postal Service Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back when this episode aired, the USPS was teetering on the edge of going under and there were a lot of plans on the table to save it. With the USPS again at risk now for different reasons, join Chuck and Josh as they explore the history and future of the postal service in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How the Voyager Golden Records Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As part of a super 70s push to get Earth to a seat at the table of the Galactic Federation (in case there is, in fact, such a thing), astronomer Carl Sagan oversaw an ambitious project to launch a compilation of Earth’s greatest hits into deep space. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The NY Times Crossword | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today Chuck and Josh take a shallow dive in the warm pool that is the NY Times Crossword Puzzle. Transcript

item.title: The Soul Train Episode | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today, Chuck and Josh dive into the funky, cool world of the classic TV show, Sooooooooul Train. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Labor Unions Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Yes, it’s true: Unions have a shady mob-related past and were originally championed by anarchists. Born from medieval trade guilds, these organizations also helped grow the American economy, and not only protected but established workers’ rights. Transcript

item.title: How Wastewater Treatment Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description All that gross stuff we humans put in the water that gets flushed down the sewers has to be taken back out before that water is reintroduced to the environment. That’s the ideal, and it’s essential to staving off the imbalance people bring to the planet. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Turning Down the Radio When You're Lost | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a typical human reaction: When you’re driving and you realize that you’re lost, you turn down the radio. On its face it makes no sense – or does it? (It does.) Transcript

item.title: Bidets: Now More Than Ever | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We all know the benefits of bidets. But with toilet paper in short supply, they’re more important than ever before. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Dissociative Identity Disorder Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Dissociative Identity Disorder was known as multiple personality disorder until a case of mass hysteria brought on by the movie-mad public and unscrupulous psychiatrists led to a stigma over the term. Now psychiatry has gotten serious about the condition. Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Dr. Elizabeth Blackwell, Feminist Physician | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Becoming the first licensed woman physician in America was tough, convincing male surgeons to wash their hands between patients was even tougher. Today Josh and Chuck pay tribute to a genuine pioneer in medicine and society. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: AAirpass | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the go-go 80s and 90s, American Airlines offered the AAirpass, a lifetime pass for unlimited first class travel. It was an amazing deal, but AA didn’t predict just how much some travelers would use it. They played with fire, they got burned. Transcript

item.title: The Legends of Lost Nazi Gold | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As if being murdering SOBs weren’t enough, the Nazis were also thieving rats. During WWII, they stole billons in gold from countries they overran and moved it to Germany. But at the end of the war, only part of it was recovered. Where’s the rest? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Deep Web Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Perhaps you didn’t realize that when you search the web you’re only skimming the surface. In fact, the types of web pages that turn up in your search engine results represent only a mere fraction of the total web. Immerse yourself in the Deep web and its dark corners in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Student Loans: UGH! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Student loans can be pretty complicated. Luckily Chuck and Josh are here to wade through the financial muck for you. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: 666 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today, Chuck and Josh dive into that scary number…666. Transcript

item.title: How Dog Training Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh explore the age-old question: Should you train your dog by treating it like a living, feeling being or should you beat them up and break their spirit? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Can Nuclear Fusion Reactors Save The World? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The world’s energy consumption is ruining the planet but for decades physicists have been working on what could solve the world’s energy and climate change woes for centuries to come – nuclear fusion. Learn about building stars on Earth in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How COVID-19 Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’re in the middle of an odd, tense time and Josh and Chuck are here to explain what’s going on and how to stay safe. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Dagen H | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One day in 1967, Sweden changed what side of the road its citizens drive on. It went surprisingly well, considering. Transcript

item.title: Could A Robot Tax Win the War on Poverty? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description An old idea – giving every resident of a country a set amount of money every month with no strings attached – became a hot item in Silicon Valley and on the 2020 campaign trail. Could it alleviate the impending job loss coming from automation? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Virus Talk with Josh and Chuck | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Viruses are big jerks that invade regular cells and hold them hostage, making you sick while they’re doing it. Learn everything you ever needed to know about viruses, including how the common cold works, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: How Jim Henson Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve already recorded an episode on The Muppets, but Jim Henson was such a neat guy we delved into him even further. Learn all about the man behind the Muppets who was so much more than just a master puppeteer in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: SYSK Live: How Bars Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join Josh and Chuck live from Vancouver as they dive in to the ins and outs of one of the oldest businesses in the world – the bar! Learn about the history of bars, cocktails and the good people who put them together in new and amazing ways. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: How Grass Works? Yes, How Grass Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s nothing more boring than watching grass grow, which is why Josh and Chuck aren’t asking you to do that. Instead, you can learn about all sorts of neat things about grass - like how American became obsessed with perfect lawns - in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: How Terraforming Will Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A lot of great thinkers are warning that if humans are to survive as a species we are going to have to find another planet to live on. Terraforming, or engineering a planet to maintain all of the ingredients to sustain life, seems to be the answer. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: How Rogue Waves Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rogue waves come out of nowhere and tower as much as 100 feet over hapless ships they encounter, breaking across the boat and frequently breaking the boat and its inhabitants. Investigate the mystery of rouge waves in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: Was there a real King Arthur? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The legend of King Arthur is very old and very established. By the time the king who saved Britain and united it was first written about, his story was already hundreds of years old. And while many of the details of his life and adventures, from the Lady of the Lake to Merlin the Magician, seem fictional some archaeologists believe that Arthur – and much of his life – was real.

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: The Amazing History of Soda | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The soda we get instantly mixed at a fast-food joint owes a lot to a rich history going back to the Roman baths, that features drugs, diseases and explosions. Learn all about soda and soda fountains in this surprisingly interesting episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: How Rodney Dangerfield Worked, Live From LA | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Other comedians cry on the inside, but Rodney Dangerfield built his entire act around his sad life. Get to know this legendary comic who was nearing 50 when he got his break. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: How Pinball Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pinball was actually illegal until the 1970s in NY and other cities, hidden in the backs of pornography shops. The game was finally legalized, thanks to a Babe Ruth-style shot by the best player in the world. Learn all about it with Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Distraction Playlist: Sugar: It Powers the Earth | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since sugar spread from Polynesia a few thousand years ago, the world has been crazy for it. Insanely high prices, wars and even slavery couldn’t undo world’s need for a sugar fix. Today that fix is responsible for the obesity epidemic facing the West. Transcript

item.title: What was the Falkland Islands War all about anyway? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The battle between Britain and Argentina over the rocky, cold Falkland Islands is one of the weirder wars in history. Learn all about it today! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Pledge of Allegiance | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The American Pledge of Allegiance is much more interesting than you might think. Give us 12 minutes and we’ll fill you in. Transcript

item.title: Chopsticks > Forks | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today Chuck and Josh sit and converse on the simple, elegant chopstick. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Monopoly Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since more than 1 billion people have played it, you’re probably familiar with the board game Monopoly, but we bet you don’t know its secret origins as a left-wing socialist teaching tool. Join Josh and Chuck as they chase it down in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Ice Climbing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A few decades ago, some people who liked to climb mountains decided they wanted to make it even harder and ice climbing was born. If you think rock climbing is difficult, put on your base layer and join Josh and Chuck on the glacier. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Teresita Basa | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the annals of American justice there is a 1977 case where the police were tipped off to the identity of a murderer by a woman who said she was possessed by the victim. Transcript

item.title: How Coyotes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The coyote truly is wily. Even after a century-long attempt to drive them to extinction, this close relative of domesticated dogs not only hung onto survival, but actually doubled its range and expanded its population. Coyotes are here to stay. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Gold Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As of early 2013, only 161,00 metric tons of gold had been mined in the entire history of the world. Considering about 85 percent of it is recycled, decent chance your jewelry may once have been part of an Incan headdress or Mycenaean face mask. Dive in to gold in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Mardi Gras! One month late | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In true SYSK fashion, Josh and Chuck are late to the game. But never fear, they will still detail Mardi Gras in all its colorful glory. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Exclamation Points! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We all use them! But did we always? NO!! Learn all about everyone’s favorite punctuation mark today! Transcript

item.title: How Morphic Fields Work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Biologist and science historian Rupert Sheldrake is known as a heretic of science, mostly for his deeply strange ideas about what connects all living things. But his pokes at science help keep the field from growing dogmatic and for that we salute him. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Your limb is torn off - now what? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Were you to be the unfortunate victim of a limb removal of any sort, you could take hope. Here in the 21st century, doctors have gotten pretty handy at reattaching arms and legs, replacing thumbs with toes, rebuilding breasts, all to great success thanks to microsurgery techniques. Transcript

item.title: Sammy Davis Jr: National Treasure | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today Josh and Chuck sit down and detail the complicated life of the late, great Sammy Davis Jr. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Hawaiian Night Marchers | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Get ready for some Hawaiian folklore, people. Today we discuss the Night Marchers. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with indigo? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Indigo is a color with a rich past. Learn all about it today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Cult Deprogramming Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The fear of cults in the 1970s drove Americans to look the other way on kidnappings, abuse and torture of cult members by deprogrammers – but did it even work? Find out in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Birthmarks: Probably Not the Mark of the Devil | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a pretty safe assumption that people have been born with birthmarks since humanity began, and between then and now we’ve come up with some wacky, even dangerous, explanations for them – even a few that survive still today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Mexican Jumping Beans | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Mexican jumping beans are a real thing and they really do move around. It’s not magic, it’s nature! Transcript

item.title: The Unsolved Indiana Dunes Disappearances | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In July 1966, three women out for a day at the beach waded into the water of Lake Michigan, got onto a boat and were never heard from again. To this day, not a trace of them has ever turned up and theories of what became of them abound. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: A Podcast on Zoot Suits? Yes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Few riots can be attributed to passing fashions, but zoot suits are top among them. After originating among the Harlem Renaissance crowd, the zoot suit came to symbolize political defiance. Find out why it’s still illegal to wear a zoot suit in L.A. in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: 911 Is Not a Joke | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck delve into the world of 911 in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Body Under The Bed | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A couple unknowingly spending the night above a dead body stuffed under their bed is a longstanding urban legend. And a true one. Transcript

item.title: Optogenetics: Controlling Your Genes with Light | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What if a genetic brain disease could be turned off simply by flashing a light in your eyes? What if your depression could be cured that way? Sounds amazingly wonderful, true, but what if your behavior could be controlled that way too? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Bonsai Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For thousands of years people have been taking normal trees and forcing them into miniature. Learn all about the history and art of this strangely engrossing pastime in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Why are Pentecostals growing so rapidly? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pentecostals are seemingly taking over the world. Or at least they’re making up a larger section of Christianity than every before. Why? We’ll dig in on that in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Iowa Caucus | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Iowa Caucus is super important. But not really. Find out why. Transcript

item.title: How AI Facial Recognition Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With the development of increasingly smart artificial intelligence and lots more cameras spread around than ever before, we have reached a critical point in the US and other countries where governments can easily track everyone, everywhere, all the time. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Maglev Trains Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Thanks to the amazing properties of magnets, clever engineers have figured out how to make entire trains levitate above their tracks, letting them move frictionlessly and allowing them to reach incredible speeds. Learn about how maglev trains work and what’s taking so long for us to get aboard in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Who were the Buffalo Soldiers? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck dive into history today to tell the story of the Buffalo Soldiers. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The O.K. Corral | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Listen in as we detail, in short, the legendary shootout at the O.K. Corral. Transcript

item.title: Amazing Animal Stories! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Regular animal stories are wonderful enough, but when animals lead amazing lives the stories become almost unbearably wonderful. You’ve been warned! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Scientific Method Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It evolved over centuries to become the gold standard for conducting scientific inquiry. Yet many people - including some scientists - don’t fully understand it. Learn about the basis of how we explore our world in this classic episode. Transcript
