item.title: Barefoot Running: The Best Podcast Episode in History | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What is barefoot running? I think you know. But we’ll detail all of the ins and outs. Listen and learn! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Byford Dolphin Incident | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1983, what may be the worst diving catastrophe in the history of deep sea oil exploration took place when a pressurized chamber was opened, instantly killing four divers inside. Transcript

item.title: Why Postal Employees Go Postal | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description 1993 was known as the peak of a disturbing trend in America: post office shootings, carried out by postal workers. A stunned country looked for answers and turned up a toxic workplace that seemed to be driving some workers past their breaking point. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Placebo Effect Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For centuries, doctors have prescribed drugs they knew weren’t real – but that still somehow worked. It wasn’t until the 1980s that the placebo effect was studied. Learn all about how an inert substance can have a genuine impact on a patient’s recovery, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Tulsa 'Race Riots' | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In reality, the Tulsa “race riots” of 1921 was more like a massacre. Yet it was almost lost to history until 1997, and still not widely known outside of Oklahoma until HBO’s The Watchmen put it on the cultural map. Learn all about this dark chapter in American history today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Mona Lisa | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Mona Lisa is a captivating work of art. But why? We’ll try and figure it out in today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: Transdermal Implants: Body Art or Nightmare Fuel? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Transdermal implants are just one in a number of procedures under the banner of extreme body modification. We don’t like to yuk yums, so we’ll offer a fairly straightforward look at this niche art form. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Jellyfish - Even Cooler Than Octopi? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Jellyfish are among the most adaptable, competitive organisms on the planet. They can grow back into their juvenile stage when resources are scarce, reproduce in massive groups and kill an adult human, among lots of other neat stuff. Learn all about em in this classic episode! Transcript

item.title: The Disappearance of Flight MH370, Part II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the absence of an official explanation of why flight MH 370 disappeared in 2014, conjecture and conspiracy theories have filled the vacuum. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Corduroy | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Learn 12 minutes worth of stuff about corduroy today! Transcript

item.title: The Disappearance of Flight MH370, Part I | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 2014, a Boeing 777 airliner disappeared. Despite two full years of searching an area of ocean covering more than 120,000 square kilometers, it has never been found. It is the only unexplained missing vessel in modern aviation history. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Will Computers Replace Doctors? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With savvy and health-conscious people taking control of their wellbeing through apps and sites, technology is meeting the desire for individuals’ responsibility for their health. But is the day coming soon when doctors will be obsolete, replaced by computers that read our health-related data to treat us? We explore these questions and more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Safecracking Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Burglars have come up with a whole range of ways to get into a safe. There’s lock manipulation – methodically testing the dial to coax the combination from it – and if that fails you can always blow it open with nitroglycerin. Both count as safecracking. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Why Does Time Speed Up As You Age? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s not just you – time really does seem to pass faster for people as we age. But exactly why remains a mystery, though some of the theories for why life passes by so quickly are make a lot of sense. Transcript

item.title: Are broken arrows a problem? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Are broken arrows are a problem? After all, they are incidents and accidents involving nuclear warheads. Like, sometimes they go missing. But it hasn’t happened much since the 50s and 60s. OR HAS IT? Learn all about them today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Wine Fraud Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Wine fraud may be a case of rich con artists tricking wealthy people into parting with money, but it’s still a crime. Learn all about this weird, widespread practice in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Live: Andre the Giant | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Andre the Giant was a giant both figuratively and literally. Sure he was a wrestler, but more than that he was a human being who left a great legacy behind. Even if you’re not a wrestling fan, you can appreciate his story. Join us for this very special live edition of the story of Andre the Giant. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Santa Claus Association | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If a con man manages to make needy Christmas wishes come true is he still a con man? (Also, Merry Christmas!) Transcript

item.title: The SYSK Holiday Spectacular | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s an annual treat, folks. Our holiday special is back and better than ever, and as always, brought to you ad-free. It’s the least we can do. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: The Star Wars Holiday Special of 1978 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Long ago, in a galaxy not so far away, George Lucas allowed the Star Wars Holiday Special to be made. What happened on the night of November 17, 1978 can never be fully explained, but we make our best effort in a very special edition of SYSK. May the force be with us all. Transcript

item.title: Cave Diving: Totally Nuts | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are extreme sports and then there is cave diving, the most extreme activity a person can engage in without leaving Earth. Cave divers stay underwater swimming miles into – that’s right – caves, where no human has ever been before. It’s pretty cool. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Obituaries | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Learn everything we know about obituaries in 12 minutes! Transcript

item.title: MC Escher and His Trippy Art | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We love us some MC Escher. Turns out his story is pretty fascinating too. Tune in today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Currency Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Even if you entirely eschew the concept of money, we’ll bet you’d be hard pressed not to trade in some form of currency. Learn how everything from cows to cacao beans to tiny shells from Maldives have served as currency at some time or another. Transcript

item.title: How Anorexia and Bulimia Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Anorexia and bulimia - those twin eating disorders that seem so common and maybe even just a phase for a teenage girl – are actually the deadliest mental illnesses in America. Cultivating an eating disorder can create issues that can last a lifetime. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Whisky or Bourbon? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What’s the difference between whisky and bourbon? We’ll tell you if you care to listen. Transcript

item.title: Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Gin | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If there’s one thing we’ve learned about Chuck over the years it’s that he loves his gin. And he loves it even more now that understands it. Pour yourself a martini and cozy up to the gin-cast. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Amnesia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Those movies where someone gets hit on the head and can’t remember who they are anymore? They’re actually not too far off from the reality of amnesia. Learn everything about this bizarre and life-robbing condition with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: What's a gap year anyway? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck thought a gap year was post college. Turns out, it’s a post high school year off from academics, where you travel the world, help others, and find yourself. Should you do it? We say “yes!” If you can afford it that is. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Macadamia Nuts | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Macadamia nuts aren’t nuts! They’re seeds! And they are delicious. And good for you in the right amount. Learn all about them today. Transcript

item.title: Did Climate Cause the Collapse of the Maya? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After millennia of development, the Maya culture suddenly collapsed at its peak. Why is one of the biggest mysteries of history. One theory says catastrophic climate change was the cause. And it may have happened to other cultures too. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Fractals - Whoa | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 1980s, IBM mathematician Benoit Mandelbrot gazed for the first time upon his famous fractal. What resulted was a revolution in math and geometry and our understanding of the infinite, not to mention how we see Star Trek II. Get blown away by fractals in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Conversion Therapy Doesn't Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Conversion therapy is a misguided attempt by religious zealots to convert people from gay to straight. News flash - it doesn’t work. Learn all about this abhorrent practice today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Niagara Falls Dewatered | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1969, the Army Corps of Engineers turned off one of the main waterfalls at Niagara Falls to see what could be done to preserve it. They found two corpses, one carcass and lots of pennies. Transcript

item.title: How Carbon-14 Dating Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Some of the carbon dioxide in your body is radioactive! Don’t worry, it won’t harm you (not sure why we used an exclamation point there). Instead, it might someday be detected by future archaeologists to determine how long ago you walked the Earth. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Have all the good ideas already been discovered? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s no secret that human beings have an obsession with innovation – but has our species already found every good idea? As Josh and Chuck break down the continuing search for the next great idea, they touch on everything from hand tools to cancer cures. Transcript

item.title: What Makes a Must-Have Christmas Toy? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever since Cabbage Patch Kids came along in 1983, there’s been an annual holiday frenzy around one particular toy – the must-have Christmas toy of the year. But what makes a toy a must-have toy? Josh and Chuck investigate (and kick off the holidays). Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Backyard Burials | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Time was that you’d bury a deceased relative in your yard; now it’s just weird. But it’s still legal – and if you want to do it, here’s how! Transcript

item.title: The Murder Mystery of Ötzi the Iceman | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description About 5,300 years ago a Copper Age shepherd was murdered. He just happened to die in a place where his body was so well preserved that gave researchers an actual shot at determining the course of his final day on Earth. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Salt Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A Roman senator once said, “Mankind can live without gold, but not without salt.” Right he was. The human body needs salt so much we have developed a taste for it specifically. But too much salt can be toxic. Learn about salt’s role in human history and how we get it from the Earth in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: NYC Water: An Engineering Marvel | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Getting the rain and melted snow from upstate NY into the taps of every NYC resident and business is one of the great feats of engineering. Does it taste great and make perfect bagels and pizza crust? Sources say yes! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Conch Republic | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in 1982, Key West seceded from the United States. Don’t believe us? It’s true! Just listen to the episode, will you? Transcript

item.title: Augmented Reality: Coming Soon? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Augmented reality adds a digital layer over the real world and soon it will revolutionize how we live. Ultra-tailored information will be everywhere we look, creating a richer, more personalized experience in everything from surgery to walking down the street. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Can you Treat Mental Illness with Psychedelics? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Hallucinogenic drugs are currently illegal, but they were once commonly used in psychological treatment. In this classic episode, Josh and Chuck discuss the rise and fall of psychedelics in treating mood disorders – and why they’re starting to gain favor again. Transcript

item.title: Cockney Rhyming Slang: Beautiful Gibberish | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What is Cockney Rhyming Slang? It’s complicated and its origins are unclear. Learn everything we know about it today. Transcript

item.title: How Ironman Triathlons Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure, you could train for months to finish a marathon, but why not make things interesting? Ironman triathlons add a 2-mile swim and a 118-mile bike race before the marathon leg. It’s as grueling as it sounds. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The History of Paternity Testing | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Paternity testing. It wasn’t science for many years, yet they still tried to do it. Learn all about it in 12 minutes. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Halitosis - Worst Smell Ever? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Occasional bad breath is one thing, halitosis is another. Or is it? From its odd origins as a marketing ploy to modern weight loss diets that can induce this embarrassing condition, you can learn all about bad breath in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK’s Scare Your Socks Off Halloween Spooktacular 2019 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck chose a truly unsettling story by one of the greatest science fiction authors of all time – Philip K Dick. Join the boys as they read “The Hanging Stranger,” complete with scary sound effects by the Extraordinary Jeri! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Our Shortie Halloween Spooktacular | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join us today as we read three short horror selections from Ambrose Bierce. Transcript

item.title: Where Did Trick-Or-Treating Come From? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We aren’t exactly sure who invented trick-or-treating – kids who realized they could extort adults for candy, or adults who bought off kids in exchange for laying off pranks? The bigger question is: Will trick-or-treating survive the 21st century? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Haunted House Attractions Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever since the Egyptians, humans have been evolving toward haunted house attractions. The level of sophistication in the scares and gore effects continues to rise over time, but the purpose remains the same: to scare the pants off you. Transcript

item.title: How Historic Districts Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A fascinating thing about Americans is that we can disagree on anything. Such is the case with historic districts – areas of historic importance protected by local laws. Seems innocuous, but are they also to blame for the affordable housing crisis? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Toxic Death of Gloria Ramirez | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1994 the body of a woman who died in a California ER somehow became toxic and sickened 24 people. To this day, no one is sure what happened. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with subpoenas? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Subpoenas are all the rage. But what do they even mean if someone can just ignore it? Learn this and a lot more in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: The 'Satanic Panic' of the 1980s | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the late 1980s, the United States experienced a “Satanic Panic,” leading parents to fear for the safety of their children. But were there any real examples of Satanic ritual abuse? Find out this and more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Project Blue Book Worked, Pt II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A rash of UFO sightings kicks off a new spike in America’s UFO fever and new headaches for the Air Force, which continues to reluctantly investigate. After becoming a laughingstock for its limp explanations, the Air Force looks for an exit from the UFO biz. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Disappearance of Ambrose Bierce | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ambrose Bierce was a journalist and writer of short stories. He also disappeared rather mysteriously. Listen in and learn of the various theories on what happened to him. Transcript

item.title: How Project Blue Book Worked, Pt I | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In June of 1947, a flying saucer was sighted by a pilot in Washington. That first report opened the floodgates and a UFO hysteria set in. Were they aliens? Time travelers? Russians? The Air Force began an investigation that lasted for decades. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Black Boxes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Black boxes are designed to be the only survivor of plane crashes so they can live to tell the tale of what went wrong to prevent future accidents. Sit in with Josh and Chuck and learn about how these grim devices are made, how they’re tested and the tales they’ve told, in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: The Ins and Outs of Beekeeping | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who wants fresh honey? We do! Learn all about the ancient art of beekeeping today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Devil's Den | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Devil’s Den is the sight of one of the bloodiest battles of the Civil War. Is it haunted? Nope. But still creepy. Transcript

item.title: How Environmental Psychology Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 60s, psychology expanded from exploring inside the mind to exploring the inside of buildings. Environmental psychology looks at how our spaces affect us – from how a busy mall can create a panic attack to how looking at nature can speed recovery from surgery. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Pez Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description PEZ began in Vienna as a mint meant to help people quit smoking. But once American kids got ahold of it, the candy took off and a symbol of childhood - and healthy secondary market among collectors - was born. Explore Pez history and culture with Josh and Chuck in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: What were the Freedom Schools? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Freedom Schools were set up in Mississippi in the heart of the Civil Rights Movement, with the aim of giving young black school children agency and a future. They remain one of the more inspiring and progressive programs in American History, yet so few know about them. We’re hoping to change that. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Fish n' Chips | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description How did these two wonderful strangers meet up and become best friends? The answers lie within today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: Guardian Angels: Behind the Red Beret | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you grew up in the 1980s, then you know who the Guardian Angels are. If you don’t then you’re in for quite a story. Listen in! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What Happened at Kent State? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On May 4, 1970, four days of anti-war protests at Kent State University in Ohio culminated in the unthinkable when Ohio guardsmen opened fire on protesters, killing four students. How could this tragedy take place? Learn more in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: What are paraphilias? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck dive into the world of paraphilias so you can get the skinny in 45 minutes or less. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Dare Stones | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What happened to the Lost Colonists who disappeared from Roanoke Island in the 1580s remains a mystery to this day. But it’s possible a carved stone a man vacationing in North Carolina found in the 1930s may have solved it – if the stone isn’t a hoax. Transcript

item.title: We Are Running Out of Sand and That Actually Matters | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sand, we’re beginning to realize, is a non-renewable resource - and we are consuming it at a voracious pace. We use it in every construction project around the world and to create new land. And we’re wrecking the ecosystems we mine sand from. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Could You Live Without a Refrigerator? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know that hulking refrigerator in your kitchen emits CO2 thanks to the electricity it uses each year? It’s a comparatively small amount, in truth, but enough that some people have foresworn their fridge and adopted a life without one. See how they do it in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How the US Interstate System Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Wait! This is actually a good episode! It turns out that America’s 48,000 miles of superhighways – possibly the largest civil works project in the history of humanity – may have also ruined what made America a cool place. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Scurvy | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Scurvy seems like a terrible way to go: Your gums swell so you can’t eat, your teeth fall out and your brain and/or heart hemorrhages. Fortunately, all you need is an orange to cure you. Or some – blech – broccoli. Transcript

item.title: The Skinny on Lyme Disease | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you live in the Northeastern U.S. then you may know someone who has had Lyme disease. But it’s spreading all over the country and parts of the world. Learn all about this tick-borne disease today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Wills Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Whether it’s oral, scrawled in blood or signed on a deathbed everyone should have a will. But how do they actually work? Join Chuck and Josh as they explain that “of sound mind” thing in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: Special Effects: A Short History | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Special effects have been around since the first movies. In fact, the techniques the earliest filmmakers created are still around today, we just use computers to do them faster and cheaper. Put on your beret and get ready for SYSK film class. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Papasan Chairs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Oh, the papasan. What a chair! But where did it come from? And what does the name mean? The answers lie within. Transcript

item.title: How Government Shutdowns Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Every year Congress decides how the federal government will spend money. Simple enough, but in practice politics tend to mess it up. Sometimes it gets so messy the budget doesn’t get passed and parts of the government shut down. Then the hurting begins. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Ouija Boards Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Although most people who’ve used Ouija boards don’t think they’re communicating with the beyond, there is something mysterious about how it works. Learn the ins and outs of the popular parlor game that sprang directly from the 19th-century spiritualism movement in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with MSG? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description MSG got a bad rap in the 70s and 80s. But what is it exactly and how bad is it for you? The answers to those questions lie within. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Barbed Wire | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Barbed wire changed the Western US as much as the railroad and the six-shooter. Before barbed wire arrived, the West was free and open; after, the West became concentrated in the hands of a few big ranchers. No wonder it was called “devil’s rope.” Transcript

item.title: Ed Gein: The Serial Killer's Serial Killer | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Any movie featuring a deranged killer who’s perversely devoted to his mother and makes things out of human skin has a real-life person named Ed Gein to thank for inspiration. He was Buffalo Bill, Norman Bates, and Leatherface all rolled into one. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Icebergs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Icebergs: floating chunks of ice. True, but whoa there. Scientists are learning that there’s a lot more to icebergs. Appropriately enough, we’ve only come to understand the tip of the iceberg and recent research shows there’s plenty more to uncover. Transcript

item.title: The Rubik's Cube Episode | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rubik’s Cubes. Ronald Reagan. Jerry Falwell. Just Say No. One of these things was awesome. Take a guess and hop on board the 80s train. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Dead Bodies and Airline Codes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know there are airline codes for pilots and flight attendants? And some of them have to do with dead bodies on board? Learn all about it today! Transcript

item.title: A Brief Overview of Punk Rock | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Punk rock really needs about 10 episodes to do it justice, but we’ll try and tackle anyway. Learn all about this movement right now. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Sleepwalking Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sleep behaviors are pretty fascinating. Some people snore, some grind their teeth – and some take a little stroll, or perhaps a drive. In this classic episode, Josh and Chuck investigate how sleepwalking, or somnambulism, works. Transcript

item.title: How Ventriloquism Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ventriloquism – where a skilled performer “throws” their voice, making it seem like a dummy on their knee is talking – has taken a long, circuitous road from early prophets, to witches, then finally to the stage. Get to the bottom of this uncanny trick. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Horseshoe Crab Blood | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Perhaps the most expensive liquid on the planet is the blue blood that comes from horseshoe crabs. Researchers realized that horseshoe crab blood could indicate the presence of pathogens and the massive, ongoing horseshoe crab harvest began. Transcript

item.title: Nuclear Semiotics: How to Talk to Future Humans | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The nuclear waste we produce will be dangerous for a very long time. We’ve figured out how to safely store it in the earth until it’s no longer a biohazard. Now we just have to figure out how to warn humans 10,000 years in the future to stay away from it. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Are We in a Cyberwar? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a secret war going on around us, and it’s happening on a daily basis. The Air Force has a unit specifically designed to carry out and defend against cyberwar. Go deep into this alarming type of war in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Peyote Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck have tackled a lot of drugs on the show, but peyote has loomed like a bad Jim Morrison poem. Learn all about this plant today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Petrichor | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know that amazing smell when it rains? Kind of clean, kind of earthy, one of a kind? It turns out that a miracle of nature produces it. Transcript

item.title: Solar Power: The Future or What? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve been promised solar energy for a while now – where is it? Turns out, it’s been quietly and steadily growing across the world. And with a few breakthroughs, we just may be able to say goodbye to fossil fuels. Learn about sun-based energy in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What Is a Shotgun House? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Shotgun houses are iconic pieces of American architecture: they’re long, narrow, and filled with artistic flourishes. But where did they come from? Join Chuck and Josh and explore the mysterious origins of shotgun houses. Transcript

item.title: Iran-Contra Affair: Shady in the 80s, Part 2 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As the operation expands it also begins to unravel. Word starts to leak out of the illegal stuff the Reagan administration was up to, Congress and the press investigate and people start to point fingers. Spoiler alert – they all got off scot free. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Time Zones | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Time zones are a pain. Let’s get rid of them! Can we? Sure! Transcript

item.title: Iran-Contra Affair: Shady in the 80s, Part 1 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When Ronald Reagan was president, America got involved in some deeply shady stuff, not the least of which was the Iran-Contra scandal – a convoluted operation that managed to combine an illegal covert war in Nicaragua with secretly selling arms to Iran. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Black Death Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Black Death was gruesome: Symptoms included tumors, purple splotches, fevers and vomiting. But how did this disease manage to spread from the Gobi desert and kill approximately one-third of the population of 14th-century Europe? Find out in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: What Were the BONE WARS? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A pair of old timey fossil hunters had a rootin’ tootin’ rivalry that spilled from academic journals into the American Wild West - where fossils were dynamited and employees turned double agent. Learn about the two-fisted origins of American paleontology. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Man Who Didn’t Eat for a Year | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1965, a 456-pound man walked into a hospital in Scotland and asked for help with a fast. That was the last day he ate for more than a year. Learn about the medical marvel that was Angus Barbieri. Transcript

item.title: Will Deepfakes Ruin the World? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Very recently, thanks to a new type of AI, it’s gotten much easier to create convincingly realistic videos of people saying and doing things they’ve never said or done. Will fake videos undermine our shared sense of reality and lead to the death of truth? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Human Cannonballs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s no question that human cannonballs are daredevils. They pack themselves into the confines of huge cannons, which shoot them into the air. But how does it work? Join Josh and Chuck to learn more about the bizarre performances of human cannonballs. Transcript

item.title: How Eyewitness Testimony Works(?) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Few things are more compelling than a witness pointing out a defendant in the courtroom as the perpetrator. But few things are also more unreliable than eyewitness testimony. Our memories can be pretty terrible, which matters when you’re facing death row. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Aristides de Sousa Mendes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description This week we highlight another little known historical hero. In this case, a Portuguese diplomat who rescued people from Nazi Germany, at his own peril. Dig in and spread the word of Aristides de Sousa Mendes. Transcript

item.title: MOVE: Or When the Philly Police Dropped a Bomb on a Residential Neighborhood | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Believe it or not, in 1985 the Philadelphia Police Department dropped a bomb from a helicopter onto a residential building in an African-American neighborhood. The fact that this story isn’t more widely known says it all. Listen and learn about MOVE today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Crack Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in the mid-1980s a new and extremely potent drug hit the scene: crack cocaine. In short order, America was in the grip of both a sweeping addiction and a state of hysteria over use of the drug and the social consequences of crack, like crack babies. Let’s take a look back at the receding wave of the crack epidemic and its lasting legacy on America in this classic episode.

item.title: Sand Dunes: They Are What You Think They Are | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sand dunes are exactly what you think they are. But still pretty interesting. Learn all about them right now! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Yellow Rain | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After the Vietnam War, the Hmong people told the world a toxic weapon was being used on them. Thus began a mystery that still remains today, which might have been solved when it was chalked up to bee poop. Transcript

item.title: How Going to the Moon Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Fifty years ago, the first humans stepped onto the moon. After going back a few more times, humanity lost its taste for moon travel. But it’s being revived again. NASA is planning to send humans back to the moon by 2024 and build a moon base by 2028. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Duels - A Guide to Throwing Down the Gauntlet | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pretty much everything you know about duels is true - it’s a challenge to violence to defend honor. But did you know the U.S. Navy used to publish detailed guidelines in its midshipmen’s handbook? Learn all there is to know about dueling in this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How Sloths Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone knows sloths are super slow, but do you know they’re slow because their bodies produce an astoundingly small amount of energy? And did you know that might be an adaptation that protects them from predators? Sloths are awesome and we prove it. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Coconut Cult | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Why we love short stuff - because we can tell stories like this one. A man goes to an island to start a commune of sorts that subsists entirely on coconuts. It didn’t go well. Transcript

item.title: Cleopatra: Ms. Understood | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the great misunderstood figures in history was the last pharaoh of Egypt. Cleopatra’s story is almost always told along with the men in her life, and from the view of the Romans who were threatened by her. Unsurprisingly, there was lot more to her. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What Makes us Yawn? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What is it that makes us suddenly draw in a deep breath through a wide-open mouth? The beautiful thing about yawning is that researchers really don’t know. Whether the answer is physical, mental or even contagious there is pretty much no chance you won’t yawn during this classic episode. Transcript

item.title: How the Fairness Doctrine Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in the day, broadcasters were bound by law to provide contrasting opinions on political matters. Why? Because of the Fairness Doctrine. What happened to it? Listen in and find out. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Mitsuye Endo | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In today’s short stuff, we look at another amazing woman who has all but been ignored by history. The story of Mitsuye Endo. Transcript

item.title: Is photographic memory a real thing? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Photographic memory is the stuff of movies and TV, but is it real? Sort of. But not really. But kind of. It's a little bit a matter of semantics. Listen in and this will all make sense. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What Makes a One-hit Wonder? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The term “one-hit wonder” gets thrown around a lot, and - yes - you probably are using it correctly, but Chuck Bryant went to the trouble to really define what makes a one-hit wonder in the article this classic episode is based on. Join him and Josh as they get to the bottom of this disparaging term. Transcript

item.title: What is the Civil Air Patrol? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Civil Air Patrol is a civilian group of pilots and plane enthusiasts who do a lot of things, namely help out in search and rescue missions. But their history is a bit more colorful. Listen in today! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Prison Food | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Prison food is kind of a joke, like airplane food. But there are real consequences involved. Let’s get into it in today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: Planned Obsolescence: Engine of the Consumer Economy | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever heard an old timer gripe that things aren’t built like they used to be, that old timer was right! Learn about the nefarious, possibly mythical, mechanism that’s responsible for the cruddy products and waste our consumer society is based on. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Donner Party Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did they or didn’t they? There is plenty of written evidence that the ill-fated Donner Party resorted to cannibalism - except there are no bones. Learn the details of one of the worst disasters of the early West in this classic episode of Stuff You Should Know. Transcript

item.title: What happened to the Neanderthals? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As recently as 40,000 years ago we lived among humans from an entirely different species – Neanderthals. About the same time our species showed up, Neanderthals suddenly vanished. Just what happened to the other guys? Did our ancestors do something … bad? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Emperor Norton | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After a San Francisco real estate mogul went bankrupt, he reinvented himself as the Emperor of the United States – and became the city’s most celebrated resident. Transcript

item.title: How the Hygiene Hypothesis Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the early 90s, a new study that found that kids who are exposed to more germs early in life are less likely to develop allergies later. With the West in the grip of a full-blown immunity crisis (still going on today), this was an interesting thought. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What's the Deal with Crop Circles? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For a while in the 1980s, people were fascinated and confused about what exactly crop circles were. Now we know that they aren’t signs left from aliens, but art made by humans. Learn all about these stunning, large form art installations in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Area 51 Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The secret military base Area 51 is inextricably linked to every secret, shady project the US government is rumored to be involved in – from reverse-engineering alien technology to coordinating a one-world government. The truth is much more mundane. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Smoke Signals | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Were smoke signals real or a Hollywood invention? Turns out, they were indeed a thing and invented by the Chinese, even. Transcript

item.title: What's the gig economy? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The gig economy is not new, but it’s bigger than ever. Is that a good thing? We’ll discuss that today! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Capgras Syndrome Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is an extremely rare condition where the sufferer is convinced that everyone around him is an impostor posing as their friends and family. Learn about the neurology behind this strange and sad mental disorder in this episode. Transcript

item.title: What is perfect pitch? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Perfect pitch, or absolute pitch, is when you can sing a note with no reference from other notes, perfectly on key. Is it an asset? Chuck says yes. Learn all about this musical rarity today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Robert Johnson and the Devil | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did the legendary blues singer really sell his soul to the devil in exchange for amazing musical skills? Probably not! But there’s still an interesting story there and it features the Coen Brothers. Transcript

item.title: How Barcodes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Barcodes are everywhere. Those little lines and numbers that make up one of the most recognizable barcodes, the UPC, was designed to make going to the grocery a lot less miserable. It ended up becoming the central symbol of the global economy. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How TV Ratings Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever wonder why some great shows go off the air after a season or less? Blame it on the Nielsen company, which has for more than 60 years been the almost exclusive decider of what goes and what stays on TV. Transcript

item.title: The Tylenol Murders, Part II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The panic that began in Chicago spreads and begins to change the world. The investigation into the murders turns up leads and suspects, but still no one has ever been charged with the murders. It remains unsolved to this day. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Look-Alike Old Couples | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know how some older married couples (sorry, senior adult married couples) start to look alike over time? That’s a really weird phenomenon if you think about it. So science has looked into it and they think they kind of have it figured out. Transcript

item.title: The Tylenol Murders, Part I | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On one terrible day in Chicago in 1982, seven people died suddenly and mysteriously. In just a matter of hours, it becomes clear, someone has poisoned bottles of Extra-Strength Tylenol, one of the most trusted and widely-used products in America. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Acne Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Over the course of our lives, 80 percent of us will experience acne. Ultimately, acne comes down to one thing, a blockage in the sebaceous gland. Learn what makes a blackhead black, and everything else about zits, in this pus-filled episode of SYSK. Transcript

item.title: What was Tin Pan Alley? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tin Pan Alley was an area of New York around the beginning of the 20th Century that served as ground zero for the earliest iterations of the music publishing industry. Learn all about this unique place and time right now. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: James Polk, Disinterred | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that former president James Polk had his final resting place moved twice? It’s true! And almost a third time even. Let’s go listen to some short stuff. Transcript

item.title: How Crystals Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In a new age shop or on display at the Smithsonian, there are varying interpretations of what crystals can be used for. But at their base, they are a thumb in the eye to entropy, a perfectly ordered piece of matter. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Dying Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh have covered just about every aspect of death except dying itself. Here, they fulfill the death suite of podcasts with an in-depth look at just how people die, what happens to the body during the dying process and how people accept death – and what they regret not having done while they lived. Transcript

item.title: 10ish Cases of Really Bad Luck | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Some guys have all the luck, some guys have all the pain. So said Rod Stewart. And if this list is any indication, “guys” is gender neutral. Listen to this episode as Chuck and Josh cover some instances of amazingly bad fortune, most of it true! Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Honorary Degrees | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Honorary degrees are not real degrees. They are marketing opportunities for universities. They make us mad, but we want one. Learn all about them in the next 12-15 minutes. Transcript

item.title: How Trampolines Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The world’s loved trampolines since they were invented by a pair of acrobats in Iowa in the 30s – so much so, trampolining is now an Olympic event. What people don’t love about trampolines is their propensity to cause paralysis, brain injuries and death. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Lie Detectors Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Instead of actually detecting lies, polygraph machines sense physiological variations, ostensibly brought on by guilt. The results are subject to interpretation, and therefore controversial. Join Josh and Chuck as they investigate the polygraph. Transcript

item.title: Do Dietary Supplements Work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The world takes $40 billion of dietary supplements – from vitamin A to yohimbe bark – every year. Yet, the jury is still out on whether most of them work. In America, the FDA isn’t allowed to approve supplements, and no one can say what is in your pills. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Nicknames | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What’s in a nickname? Sometimes they make sense, sometimes they don’t. Let’s get our shorty on and find out the deal. Transcript

item.title: Remembering Live Aid | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Live Aid was a revolutionary concert event in two countries in 1985 that spanned the world via satellite. The brainchild of musician Bob Geldof, it really did help change the world in many ways, but its direct impact on Ethiopian famine relief remains in question. Listen and learn today! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Does a Diving Bell Work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description About 2,400 years ago Aristotle mentions the use of diving bells, apparatuses that convey divers to the bottom of the sea – or at least below the surface of the water – and allows them to breathe – at least until the air runs out. Learn about the physics of this clever and ancient invention and how it’s been used to sabotage enemy boats and build the Brooklyn Bridge.

item.title: What Happens When the Government Thinks You're Dead? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s bad enough when the government knows you’re alive – there are taxes to pay, laws to be followed, all sorts of boring and unpleasant things. But each year, thousands of Americans find out life is far, far worse when the government thinks you are dead. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Number 23 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are people out there who believe that there’s something special about the number 23. Exactly what? Who knows. Exactly why? Because it pops up a lot. But does it? Who knows. Transcript

item.title: Michael Dillon: Trans Pioneer | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Michael Dillon was a lot of things - author, doctor, and most importantly, trans pioneer. Learn all about his story in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Zero Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Few numbers have as storied a past as zero. Even fewer have had as great an impact on our ability to understand our universe. Yet zero is a relatively recent arrival in math. Find out all about this surprisingly fascinating number with Chuck and Josh. Transcript

item.title: What Were Human Zoos? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the off-putting byproducts of 19th century European colonialism were human zoos, living dioramas of people from far-away places made to be gawked at. Listen in to what the deeper meaning of humans zoos held people on both sides of the glass. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Fear of Public Speaking | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Speaking in public is frequently cited as people’s number one fear, even more fearful than death. Most people go through life avoiding public speaking, but it turns out that only makes things worse. The best medicine? Public speaking. Transcript

item.title: Is birth order important? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There have been a lot of studies over the years regarding birth order. Some conclude that it’s a big deal, while others more or less discount its importance. Learn all about it today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Marijuana Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For millennia people used marijuana for fun and medicine. Not until the 20th century that was it vilified, unfairly say many. Weed has done lots of good things, from alleviating cancer symptoms to unlocking secrets of the brain. Learn all about pot here. Transcript

item.title: How the Hoover Dam Works, Part II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description And now for something completely different. Just kidding – tune in to hear the thrilling conclusion of America’s most amazing public works project in the 20th century. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Emu Wars | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did Australians really wage war on a group of emus? YES. Learn all about it in today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: How the Hoover Dam Works, Part I | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s one of America’s biggest accomplishments in the 20th century, a slab of concrete holding back one of the country’s most finicky rivers, providing water and electricity to a swath of majors cities that otherwise couldn’t exist. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Yo-Yos Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You may have played with a yo-yo before – perhaps you’ve even walked the dog – but do you know about the physics behind what makes a yo-yo sleep and wake up? Learn all about inertia, angular momentum and the history of the yo-yo in this episode of SYSK. Transcript

item.title: How the Electric Chair Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The electric chair is an all-American invention. It spread almost nowhere else in the world as a capital punishment but worked overtime in the States. Despite the terrible sights and sounds an electrocution produces, it was created out of humaneness. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Lake Peigneur | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1980 something catastrophic happened to the quiet town of New Iberia, Louisiana. Their wide, shallow lake grew much deeper after it underwent an apocalyptic transformation. Transcript

item.title: How Free Range Parenting Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Free range parenting is all about giving your child the freedom to play and explore life on their own. Are there benefits? Sure. Do some people hate the concept? Yes! Listen and learn right here. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Pollen Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For about 375 million years, plants have been using pollen (aka plant sperm) to propagate their species. And the technique has stuck around because it works. Join Chuck and Josh for a cozy look at the ins and outs of plant reproduction. Transcript

item.title: Were Nazis Drug-Fueled Crankheads? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Nazis were bad people. And it turns out a lot of them were high as kites on speed. Was this a recipe for disaster? Yes it was. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Unspent Campaign Money | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever wondered what happens to all those campaign donations when a political campaign goes belly up? Or, even worse, is in debt! Wonder no more! Transcript

item.title: How Rape Kits Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rape kits are simple forensic evidence collection kits used when someone is sexually assaulted. But the story is deeper than this. Learn all about rape kits, the sad backlog problem, and what you can do to help, in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Immigration Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Immigration systems regulate the flow of foreign immigrants into any given country. But why is immigration such a controversial topic, especially in the United States? In this episode, Josh and Chuck delve into the details and debate behind immigration. Transcript

item.title: Etch A Sketch! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Etch A Sketch is yet another classic toy that Josh and Chuck love and respect. Learn all about this Hall of Fame entry today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: When Elvis Met Nixon | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Elvis really did meet with Richard Nixon. Because Elvis wanted to help fight the drug trade. True story. Hear about it in today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: How Druids Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Anyone who likes Led Zeppelin, plays Dungeons & Dragons, or worships the rising sun at Stonehenge on the vernal equinox can tell you druids are cool. But archaeologists will tell you we can’t even be certain druids existed. Buckle in for a history mystery! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Sign Language Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It wasn’t until the was developed and despite its co-existence alongside English, a user would be hard-pressed to sign with a British person. Find out about the independent evolution of sign language in the U.S. and how intuitively sensible it is. Transcript

item.title: How Disgust Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Disgust is an odd thing. It makes sense that we would feel a sense of revulsion at the thought of putting rotten meat in our mouths – that’s pure evolution. But why would we feel the same emotion at the thought of weird sex or from hearing a racist rant? Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Sandman | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Mr. Sandman, bring me a dream! But who is the sandman? We’ll tell you in today’s edition of short stuff. Transcript

item.title: Desert Survival: Josh and Chuck Save Your Tookus | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The chances are pretty low that you’ll find yourself lost in the desert, but on the off chance you do you’ll thank yourself that you listened to this episode, where we guide you to safety. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Was Atlantis A Real Place? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description While the search for Atlantis has been pushed to the fringes since the 19th century, archaeologists have quietly pursued cities that may have inspired Plato to fabricate the mythical city. It looks like a team in Greece has found it. Transcript

item.title: The Great Stink: The Stench So Bad They Gave It A Name | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the summer of 1858, a heatwave dried up the Thames River to a trickle in London. As centuries’ worth of human waste, animal carcasses and other nasty things cooked in the sun, a stench arose that was so horrific it got its own name: The Great Stink. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Bedbugs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We eradicated bedbugs so thoroughly in the 50s that generations who came later suspected they weren’t anymore real than jackalopes and snipes. But since we banned DDT, the pesticide that kills bedbugs best, they’re back again. And they’re terrible. Transcript

item.title: The Case of Sacco and Vanzetti | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The trial of Sacco and Vanzetti, two anarchists accused of murder, was one of the first “crimes of the century.” But did they do it? To this day there is speculation that they did not. Learn all about this famous case in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Wildfires Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Wildfires consume an annual average of 5 million acres in the US. But what causes wildfires? How do they become so powerful? More importantly, how do we fight them? Join Josh and Chuck as they take you to the frontlines of the fight against wildfires. Transcript

item.title: How Dyslexia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For a learning disability that everyone seems to know about, dyslexia is maybe the most commonly misunderstood and controversial cognitive difficulty there is. Some people think it’s a gift, some people think it doesn’t even exist. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Wigs in English Court | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What’s the deal with the wigs in the English court system? Learn all about it in today’s short stuff. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with ASMR? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description ASMR is soothing to some, maddening to others. Learn all about these whisper tones in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Panama Canal Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s on more than one list of the Seven Wonders of the World and for good reason - the Panama Canal is one of the great feats of engineering ever undertaken. First conceived of in the 1580s and finally completed in 1914, the canal has a fascinating history (including a stint where it was considered U.S. soil). Learn all about it on this episode. Transcript

item.title: Tuskegee Airmen: American Heroes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Tuskegee Airmen braved racism and brutally tough training in order to secure their spot in American history as the first African-American military pilots. Listen in today to the story of their determination and heroism. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Black Loyalists | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Black Loyalists were a group of Colonial slaves who fought for their freedom alongside the British. Learn all about this nearly forgotten group in today’s Short Stuff. Transcript

item.title: The Science of Break-Ups | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Breaking up is hard to do. Your brain might even think you’re getting over a cocaine addiction. Learn all about the science behind break-ups today! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Lewis and Clark Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They may be the most famous explorers in U.S. history, but there are plenty of interesting details to the Lewis and Clark expedition that history has allowed to fade. Learn about the origin and the aftermath of America’s first early push Westward in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Galaxies Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the universe things tend to cluster. This means there’s a coherent structure to the universe and learning about clusters of stars – galaxies - helps us figure out what that structure is. Join Chuck and Josh on an amazing space voyage! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Turbulence | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever had a bumpy airplane ride, you know it’s nothing fun. But have you ever noticed that the pilots sometimes tell you ahead of time to buckle in? How do they know turbulence is ahead? Are they some kind of fortune teller? How can anyone see wind? Transcript

item.title: Yeti: The Asian Bigfoot | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve covered Nessie and Bigfoot, so why not tackle the Yeti? Listen in today and Josh and Chuck cover what used to be known as the Abominable Snowman. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Interpol: World Police | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Interpol is an international police agency that helps other law-enforcement agencies track criminals who operate across national borders – but how does it work, exactly? Join the guys as they delve into the world of global law enforcement. Transcript

item.title: Elephants: The Best Animals? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Elephants are pretty much the best. Why? Josh and Chuck will let you know in great detail in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: War of Jenkins' Ear | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 18th century, Spain and England fought each other in the colonies of Georgia and Florida, a war kicked off by an English sea captain who was mad his ear had been perhaps unfairly lopped off. Transcript

item.title: Could There Be A Loch Ness Monster? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description People have believed something strange lives in Loch Ness for at least 3500 years. Thousands of people have sighted the Loch Ness Monster and dozens of expeditions have been launched. But does the fact that nothing’s been found mean it’s not real? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Coral Reefs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Coral reefs are the largest organic structures on Earth, yet they’re created through a symbiotic relationship between creatures about 3 millimeters long. Learn more about the the world’s coral reefs (and how to protect them) in this episode. Transcript

item.title: The True Story of BlacKkKlansman | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 2018, director Spike Lee brought the story of Ron Stallworth to the big screen to great effect. Today, Josh and Chuck discuss the true story behind the Oscar nominated film. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Ellen Richards | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who is Ellen Richards? One of the most unsung scientists of all time, that’s who. Her contribution? Bringing real science into the household and forcing the world to take “home-ec” seriously. We celebrate her today on Short Stuff. Transcript

item.title: The Insidious Abuse of Stalking | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Stalking has only recently been recognized for what it is – a profound form of psychological abuse where the victim’s life is “infected” by the stalker, as one survivor put it. Stalking can go on for years, and in some cases may be the prelude to murder. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Saunas: More Interesting Than You Think! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Although they seem pretty mundane, saunas are surprisingly fascinating inventions. Josh and Chuck break out all sorts of sweaty, sauna-related trivia, from the Finnish affinity for saunas to sauna etiquette, in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Central Park Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Central Park in Manhattan was America’s first landscaped public park, built at a time when New Yorkers’ only option for getting some fresh air was hanging around cemeteries. Get all the info about this beautiful icon and how it’s served as a landscape for class struggles over three centuries. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Johnny Appleseed | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Johnny Appleseed was real! And he was about as amazing as the legend paints him. He really did plant apple trees all over America and if the feds hadn’t chopped them down during Prohibition, they’d still be around. Learn what we mean in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Ping Pong Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description While Asia is well-known for being cuckoo for Ping Pong, the game was actually invented by bored British Victorian aristocrats. Go back and forth about Ping Pong’s place in the world with Chuck and Josh. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Bioluminescence: A Bright and Shiny Fish | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Science has a handle on fireflies and glowworms, but most bioluminescent animals live in the ocean and are tough to study. Today, researchers are still figuring out why some animals produce light. Dive with Josh and Chuck into this illuminating topic. Transcript

item.title: The Legend of Betsy Ross | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Betsy Ross is an American icon to many, the seamstress who sewed the first U.S. flag because of a personal commission from George Washington. But is it true? Sort of. Learn all about this fascinating story today. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Thread Count | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Is thread count all it’s cracked up to be? Listen in and find out in today’s edition of Short Stuff! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Live: The Kellogg Brothers’ Wacky World of Health | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s no way you haven’t had one of their breakfast cereals, but we bet you don’t know the story behind the two brothers who brought the world corn flakes. Buckle in for a lot of talk about poop, religion and masturbation, live from Sydney, Australia. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Lobotomies Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Lobotomies – brain surgeries to relieve psychiatric problems – are rarely performed today, but they were once fairly common. Tune in to learn more about the controversial history and practice of lobotomies.. Transcript

item.title: The July 20th Plot to Assassinate Hitler | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A lot of people in Hitler’s inner circle wanted him dead toward the end of the war. But he proved impossible to kill from within. Listen in today as Josh and Chuck dig into the infamous July 20th plot to blow up Der Führer. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Olestra | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 90s a fat free miracle food came out that promised we could eat all we wanted and not gain weight. But there was a caveat: it could also make your bowels unpleasantly loose. Transcript

item.title: How Airbags Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It turns out that the inflatable bag of air that shoots out of your steering wheel or dashboard is the result of a controlled explosion of solid fuel, just like in a rocket – aimed for your face. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Schizophrenia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Up to 24 million people worldwide have schizophrenia. Despite the vast amounts of research, the disorder remains mysterious. In this episode, Josh and Chuck delve into the nature of schizophrenia, from the history of the disorder to the latest research. Transcript

item.title: The Great Finger in the Wendy’s Chili Caper | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 2005 a woman named Anna Alaya discovered a length of human finger – nail and all – in her Wendy’s chili. Her cries of disgust would set off a media firestorm, a criminal investigation and a prison sentence for her and her husband. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: How Often Do You Need To Change Your Oil? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description First things, first: Take that oil change reminder sticker off your windshield and throw it away forever and never look back! Transcript

item.title: How the Spanish Flu Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Spanish Flu killed anywhere from 20-100 million or more people over 1918/1919. All of this played out with World War I in the foreground, one big reason why the flu spread so far, so fast. Learn all about this devastating pandemic in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Munchausen Syndrome Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Why would someone fake an illness? Here’s an even better question: Why would someone repeatedly make themselves sick? Join Josh and Chuck as they separate the facts from fiction and give you the scoop on Munchausen syndrome. Transcript

item.title: What was the Tunguska event? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1908, the most powerful meteoroid explosion in recorded history happened over a remote area of Siberia. But the weird thing is there was no impact crater and no asteroid to be found – so was it an asteroid? (Yes.) Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Khipu | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Listen in to learn all about the fascinating “language” of the Incan khipu knotted ropes. Transcript

item.title: Rockettes: Still Kicking After All These Years | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tune in today to learn all about the legendary NYC Rockettes, who actually got their start in Missouri. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Fossils Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A fossil is a piece of once-living organic material that has undergone a transition from an organic state to an inorganic state. But what exactly is fossilization? Listen in as Josh and Chuck break down the process of fossilization. Transcript

item.title: Dr. Seuss: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Seuss is loose in this episode about legendary children’s book author Ted Geisel. The funny thing is, he didn’t ever want children of his own, and his past work was a bit problematic. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: The Brain-Bladder Connection | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description How much do you know about the brain-bladder connection? In about 15 minutes, it’ll be a lot more. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Live Christmas Spectacular! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description This year, Josh and Chuck go live for their annual Christmas Spectacular. Recorded from the Center Stage Theater in Atlanta, pour up some eggnog, light a fire and enjoy this live show with the whole family. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: The Star Wars Holiday Special of 1978 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Long ago, in a galaxy not so far away, George Lucas allowed the Star Wars Holiday Special to be made. What happened on the night of November 17, 1978 can never be fully explained, but we make our best effort in a very special edition of SYSK. May the force be with us all. Transcript

item.title: E.T.: Is It Really the Worst Video Game of All Time? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you play video games you probably have an easy answer to worst game of all time: ET. But it turns out there are no easy answers, especially when you’re talking about a game so terrible it’s blamed for bringing the entire video game industry with it. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Unique Snowflakes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Amazingly, it turns out that every snowflake truly is unique. Math backs it up. Transcript

item.title: Geodesic Domes: The Wave of the Future That Wasn't | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes a good idea doesn’t pan out in real life. Take Buckminster Fuller’s geodesic dome: It requires less energy to heat and cool, it’s cheap, and it’s durable enough to withstand a hurricane – but it’s also godawful ugly and that was its undoing. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Igloos Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Igloos were traditionally used by Inuit Indians as temporary shelter while on hunting and fishing trips. In this episode, Josh and Chuck look at the design of igloos, from their impressive heat-catching properties to their ingenious construction. Transcript

item.title: Are good samaritan laws effective? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Good samaritan laws have been around for many years, helping to provide legal protections for people who try to help other people. But do they work? Decide for yourself today! Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Laughing Buddha | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that the friendly, smiling Buddha we all know from bars and restaurants isn’t really Buddha? Transcript

item.title: How Ayahuasca Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One day in the Amazon Basin, a shaman put together a plant containing DMT with a vine that allows the body to absorb DMT. The combination, a foul-tasting, wildly hallucinogenic brew called ayahuasca, has changed cultures throughout the Americas. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: That Dang-old Goat Fell Over | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Due to a condition known as Thomsen’s disease, the muscles of fainting goats tense up whenever the animal is startled. In this episode, Josh and Chuck break down the science behind this bizarre condition. Transcript

item.title: Was the PMRC censorship in disguise? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Parents Music Resource Center in the 1980s was really just censorship in disguise. But it kind of backfired. Learn all about Tipper Gore’s crusade in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Dolphin Detectors | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They don’t actually disarm mines, but navies around the world use dolphins to find and tag sea mines so humans can disarm the mines themselves. But even if it’s safe, is it ethical? Transcript

item.title: How Search and Rescue Dogs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description All dogs are great, but some dogs work harder than others. Or play harder, depending on your view. Learn all about the good boys and girls who find lost people and recover bodies to bring humans peace and closure. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Can Your Grandfather's Diet Shorten Your Life? | Stuff You Should Know
