item.description: Podcast Description Epigenetics is a fascinating field of genetics that studies how the epigenome and environmental, nutritional and social factors affect gene expression. Josh and Chuck explain how epigenetics works in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Adidas v. Puma: A Sibling Rivalry | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join Josh and Chuck today as they go down the sport shoe rabbit hole, detailing the strange tail of the brothers who brought Puma and Adidas to the world. Sibling rivalry, Nazis, shoes - there’s a lot to unpack here. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: iSmell | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Two men once had a dream - to add smell to the internet. And they almost gave it to us. Transcript

item.title: How the Navajo Code Talkers Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In WWII the US Marines devised an unbreakable code-within-a-code made from Navajo, one of the most linguistically difficult languages in the world. A handful of Navajos sent messages on the frontlines in a language they’d been forbidden to speak as school kids. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Black Friday Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On the day after Thanksgiving, Americans go kind of crazy for the deep discount sales that kick off the holiday shopping season in stores. So crazy, in fact, at least four people have lost their lives and as many as 63 others have been injured during Black Friday sales. But as profitable as Black Friday is, some retailers are thinking about discontinuing the tradition to find ways to make even more money.

item.title: Fire twucks! Fire twucks! (sic) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Who doesn’t love fire engines? We certainly do. So much that we geeked out on this one in a big way. Enjoy! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Safety Pins | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Safety pins are so ubiquitous, we take them for granted. But that’s the genius of their design – they work so intuitively they might as well have come from nature. Instead, they were invented by a man who never went to the trouble of patenting them. Transcript

item.title: Finders Keepers: Real Law | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know that heartbreak of the schoolyard – finders keepers, losers weepers? That’s actual law in a great many grown up places. Enter the murky legal world of finding something that belongs to someone else, from buried treasure to a misplaced ring. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Kleptomania Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode of Stuff You Should Know, Josh and Chuck discuss kleptomania, a disorder in which people have an overwhelming impulse to steal unnecessary items. Transcript

item.title: Olive Oil: Mother Nature's Gift | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Olive oil is one of Mother Nature’s greatest gifts to humanity. Learn everything you ever wanted to know about the NUMBER ONE OIL, right here, right now. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Lemonade | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever wonder where lemonade came from? Let’s up the stakes a little, what about pink lemonade? Well wonder no more! Join Josh and Chuck as they (briefly) cover the history of putting lemons together with sugar and water and coming up with something great. Transcript

item.title: Pando: Earth’s Oldest, Hugest Organism Is Trees! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In Utah, lives a 106-acre stand of Quaking Aspen trees that are all genetically identical because they are all growing from the same massive root system. It’s Pando, the most massive, and almost certainly oldest (by far) organism on Earth. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Pizza Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure it’s everywhere and there’s a more-than-90-percent chance you eat it once a month. But we’ll bet you don’t know the full history of that pizza (or tomato pie) you’re about to chow down on. Join Chuck and Josh as they explain it to you, bite by bite. Transcript

item.title: Is yogurt a miracle food? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Yogurt has been touted as a health food, but is it? Maybe. If you eat it every day. We get into the rich and creamy history of this supposed miracle food in today’s episode. Take a listen! Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Vomitoria | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A vomitorium was a place where ancient Romans went to make themselves throw up after gorging themselves at a sumptuous banquet. Everybody knows that. Except that’s not true at all. Learn about what vomitoria were in this episode and impress your friends. Transcript

item.title: What were war masks? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description War masks were made for soldiers in WWI who had horrible accidents that left their faces sometimes unrecognizable. Though it may seem rudimentary today, they went a long way in restoring their dignity. Learn all about them today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Grief Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You can probably name the five stages of grief - from denial to acceptance - they’ve become pretty well known since being proposed in 1969. But later researchers are finding that grief is rarely that cut and dried, and it may not be as widely experienced as we once thought. Join Josh and Chuck as they look at the sad science of grief. Transcript

item.title: How Easy Bake Ovens Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Easy Bake Ovens are as iconic as a toy can get, as American as apple pie or baseball. Learn all about these light bulb cooking, working ovens that endanger children to this day. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Labor Day | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Labor Day, the day when most people in America paradoxically take off work, is actually rooted in some deeply radical and anarchistic thinking. Learn all about this most subversive of American holidays in this episode of Short Stuff. Transcript

item.title: SYSK’s 2018 Super Spooktacular | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Halloween again and Chuck and Josh want to creep you out. Listen to two great classic horror stories, dripping with Jeri’s creeptastic audio stylings. Guaranteed to put you in the holiday spirit. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What's with the Winchester Mystery House? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After her daughter and husband died, heiress Sarah Winchester became obsessed with the idea that spirits haunted her and to appease them she had to have a house continuously built for them. So she did - 24 hours a day for 38 years. Transcript

item.title: How the Amityville Horror Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In early 1975, the world was introduced to George and Kathy Lutz, a couple who had fled their home in Amityville, NY to escape a powerful, evil supernatural presence living there. And this being the 70s, the world went nuts for their story. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Exploding Manholes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you live in a big city in a cold climate, you should keep an eye out for 100-pound cast-iron manhole covers suddenly launching 50 feet into the air. It’s unnervingly common and we’ll tell you why. Transcript

item.title: How Epilepsy Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A seizure is like an electrical overload in the brain – when it gets overwhelmed, it just shuts down and resets itself. But imagine being susceptible to these overloads, where one could come at any time with little or no warning. That is epilepsy. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Aphrodisiacs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For thousands of years humankind has pursued the enhancement of sexual pleasure and performance through a plethora of medicines and practices – but how many aphrodisiacs actually work? Transcript

item.title: Waterbeds: The Sexiest Bed? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Waterbeds came and went pretty quickly in the United States, but despite their marketing as sex beds, they were actually invented to deliver a great night’s sleep. Learn all about these super 70’s beds in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Korean Fan Death | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a commonly-held belief in Korea that if you fall asleep with a fan blowing on your face you may die in your sleep from it. And while this idea is found nowhere else in the world, Korean culture has come up with some interesting explanations. Transcript

item.title: Was There A Real Robin Hood? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Is it true that Robin Hood hung out in Sherwood Forest and stole from the rich to give to the poor? No. No, it’s not. Find out the real story in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Homelessness Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description osh and Chuck take a look at homelessness in the United States, discussing everything from the factors that lead to homelessness to what you can do to help alleviate the situation. Transcript

item.title: When inventions kill! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Few things are more ironic than an invention killing its creator. The stories behind real life cases of death-by-invention are pretty interesting too. Pull up a chair and hear about a few from Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: William King | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that the United States has had one Vice-President who was sworn in on foreign soil? Well it turns out that may be the least interesting part of the story of William Rufus King. Transcript

item.title: How Marathons Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You’d have to be crazy to try to run 26.2 miles in a single stretch, right? Right. But people still try it anyway. And a lot of them even survive! Find out all about the pitfalls of marathons and the obsession they can inspire in this episode. Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.comSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Is lethal injection humane? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since the Supreme Court’s ban on capital punishment was reversed, states have sought a humane method of killing sentenced criminals. Transcript

item.title: Algae: Food, Fuel, What? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Just a couple years ago, algae was touted as the green, plentiful biofuel of the future. But that didn’t pan out. Why? And is algae down for the count? Don’t bet on it. Only a fool would bet against green water. Transcript

item.title: Short Stuff: Grandfather Clocks | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever wondered why a grandfather clock is called a grandfather clock and you have 12 minutes to spare, this is your lucky day. Listen in to the brand new Short Stuff series. It’s everything you want from Josh and Chuck, and less! Transcript

item.title: How the Concorde Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The concorde was a wonderful thing, a super fast commerical airliner that got you across the pond in half the time. But it was small and cramped, noisy and a big money loser. Climb aboard and get ready for Mach 1. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Does the five-second rule work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know when you drop a piece of food and if you pick it up within five seconds it’s still good to eat? Transcript

item.title: Seriously, What Is Dark Matter? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh take on astrophysics again and this time it pans out well. It turns out that there simply isn’t enough matter in the universe to account for its mass. Which is super weird. What is this missing matter? Does it even exist? Transcript

item.title: What is colorblindness? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Being colorblind doesn’t mean you see in black and white, although in severe cases it can look a bit like that. The condition is on a spectrum ranging from dulled colors to shades of grey. Learn all about what colorblindness means in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Was Malthus right about carrying capacity? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Thomas Malthus concluded that humanity is bound to outgrow Earth’s carrying capacity. The prediction was based on humanity’s exponential growth and the linear growth of the food supply – but was he correct? Tune in to this classic episode to find out. Transcript

item.title: How Ranked Choice Voting Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the US, winner-take-all voting has created A LOT of political polarization. But what if rather than voting for one candidate, you could rank all of them so if your first choice doesn’t win, your vote goes to your second choice? So long, polarization! Transcript

item.title: Roundabouts: The Problem Is You | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They’re as American as Washington, DC yet most people in the US are terrified of them, hate them or both. What is it about traffic circles and roundabouts - which do nothing but safely, inexpensively and greenly direct traffic – that America can’t stand? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Commercial Jingles Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You probably can recite five right now. Commercial jingles are designed to hijack your working memory and implant a product or service and they really work. Transcript

item.title: What are think tanks all about? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Think tanks? More like stink tanks! We’re kidding. Think tanks do valuable work, when they operate in a non-partisan way of course. Learn all about the history of these heady institutions today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Live: How Game Shows Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join Josh and Chuck and a whole bunch of great people at the Gothic Theatre in Denver for this live show on game shows and their place in cultures around the world, recorded on June 28, 2018. You just come right on down, why don’t you? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Circumcision Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Circumcision is a common practice in which the foreskin of a male’s penis is removed, typically as a baby. In this classic episode, Josh and Chuck take a look at the origins, practices, and arguments for and against circumcision in this episode. Transcript

item.title: The Lava Lamp: Goes Great With Acid | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What started out as an egg timer at a London pub became a furnishing for bachelor pads before it took its rightful place as the most recognizable icon of psychedelia. The lava lamp became popular with people on LSD not once, but twice, decades apart. Transcript

item.title: How Police Lineups Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Police lineups are something most people have never had any firsthand experience with. What you see on TV and in movies isn’t so far off though. Learn about how these tropes work for real in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Patents Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What was originally designed to encourage innovation by rewarding the people who create technological advances, the U.S. patent system has become a big mess. Transcript

item.title: How Elimination Diets Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Elimination diets are all about whittling down what you eat, then building it back up again in order to identify foods that don’t work for your body. Is it safe? It can be. Learn all about this process in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Why There Aren't So Many Hotel Fires Anymore | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description 1946 was a particularly deadly year for hotel fires in the US. Fires killed hundreds of people in Chicago, Dubuque, Dallas and, in Atlanta, the worst hotel fire in American history broke out. Find out how they made staying in hotels safe. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What's the deal with Voodoo? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Voodoo is a religion found in parts of Africa and Haiti that’s often misunderstood. In this episode, Josh and Chuck separate the faction from the fiction as they explore how Voodoo really works. Transcript

item.title: Pterosaurs: Not Flying Dinosaurs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Almost everything you know about pterosaurs is wrong. They weren’t birds, they weren’t flying dinosaurs and they weren’t all pterodactyls. Which makes this a great episode for you to learn some new and amazing stuff about terrifying prehistoric beasts! Transcript

item.title: Ballpoint pens? Heck yes, ballpoint pens! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Get ready, folks. The ballpoint pen is far more interesting than you could ever imagine. For real. Brilliant in its simplicity. Took the world by storm. We love our ballpoint pens and you should too. Listen in today! Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Electroconvulsive Therapy Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With the exception of lobotomies, no other psychological treatment has a worse reputation. But thanks to some thoughtful tweaks, ECT has lately emerged from the dark ages and toward the respectable forefront of treatment for major depression. Transcript

item.title: Who is The Man of the Hole? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 2018, there’s a man from a lost tribe still living deep in the jungles of Brazil who has been all alone since the mid 1990s. He’s referred to as the Man of the Hole, and has had no face-to-face with modern humans. Who is he? Transcript

item.title: How Board Breaking Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever seen someone break a stack of boards or concrete blocks with a single karate chop you know what it means to experience awe. Board breaking is indeed cool but there’s also a lot of physics to help it along. Learn all about this secret art. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Traffic Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Whether you’ve been stuck in a traffic jam or forced to merge and avoid road construction, everyone’s had a few bad experiences with traffic. Transcript

item.title: How Attila the Hun Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you go to the Internet you’ll see a few people championed as all-time greatest conquerors - Alexander the Great, Genghis Khan and Atilla the Hun. Listen in today as Josh and Chuck dive into number three on this list, Atilla the Hun. Transcript

item.title: How Search and Rescue Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are thankfully about as many ways to look for someone as there are ways to get lost. And the people who dedicate themselves to saving the lives of people who are missing take their job seriously. Learn about this fascinating world in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Miranda Rights Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in 1966, the Supreme Court decided that suspects in criminal cases had the right to be reminded that they didn’t have to talk to the fuzz if they didn’t want to, as stated in the 5th amendment. Transcript

item.title: How the U.S. Military Draft Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The U.S. military draft is far more interesting than you’d think. The process of conscription can get quite complicated, but we’re here to clear it up for you. We’ll also talk a bit about whether or not this could ever happen again. Transcript

item.title: How the Pony Express Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For as long a shadow as it casts across the history of the Old West, the Pony Express was a failed business venture, doomed from the start, that only lasted 18 months. But since the last rider headed out with his bag of mail, its legend has only grown. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How the Cannonball Run Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Cannon Ball Run is a cross-country car race famously portrayed in the campy 1981 movie “Cannon Ball Run.” But it isn’t fictional. Transcript

item.title: The Dyatlov Pass Mystery | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The incident at Dyatlov Pass is one of the more enduring wilderness mysteries of all time. Russian hikers found in various states of undress, frozen. What happened to them? Why were there weird internal injuries and no outward signs of distress? Transcript

item.title: Recycling Update: How’s It Going? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s been about a decade since Josh and Chuck last checked in on recycling and since then a lot has changed. A global commodities market dealing in recyclables has developed and recently crashed. Jump back into the fascinating world of recycling. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Foot Binding Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Once in a while, all the necessary factors converge to produce a peculiar nationalized sexual fetish. In China, that fetish was foot binding and over a millennia three billion Chinese women’s feet were brutally disfigured for men’s pleasure. Transcript

item.title: How Attorney-Client Privilege Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the oldest protected forms of speech comes from when a lawyer speaks with their client. Over centuries, this legal privilege has been protected and defined and still stands stronger than ever. Transcript

item.title: Jobs of Bygone Eras | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join Josh and Chuck today as they take a fun look at some of the strange jobs that our ancestors did. It’s a SYSK top 10, meaning there will only be eight or so. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Twinkies Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Twinkies have a reputation for being so processed that they can last for years and years, but they’re not as hardy as you’d expect. Uncover the sweet story of Twinkies in this classic SYSK. Transcript

item.title: Gerrymandering: How to Stifle Democracy | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description No matter which side of the political spectrum you fall on, you should be outraged about the practice of gerrymandering. Redrawing voter district maps to ensure political dominance is about as undemocratic as it gets. Transcript

item.title: The Disappearance of the Yuba County Five | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1978, five friends set out for home from a basketball game. The next day, their car was discovered in a lonely mountain road. The next spring, their bodies began to turn up. What happened that night remains a mystery to this day. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Did Reagan's Star Wars program win the Cold War? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description While Reagan’s “Star Wars” program was derided at home and abroad, historians are beginning to wonder if it didn’t help win the Cold War after all. Transcript

item.title: How the Stanford Prison Experiment Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The infamous Stanford Prison Experiment wasn’t really much of an experiment as it turns out. It was more like a poorly thought out exercise conducted by a professor who didn’t dot the i’s and cross the t’s. Transcript

item.title: How Diabetes Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Diabetes is one of the biggest killers of people on the planet. And yet, it also seems to be tied to diet and exercise, which makes it preventable. Learn about the fascinating mechanisms that can make your body go haywire and lead to this disease. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Ponzi Schemes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ponzi schemes. How do they work? And who’s Ponzi? Join Josh and Chuck in this classic episode to discover how an Italian immigrant created a classic con that’s still fleecing investors today. Transcript

item.title: Narwhals: Unicorns of the Sea | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Narwhals are the unicorns of the sea. They’re also whales with tusks. The tusks are really long tooths. Are you confused? Let us guide you! Transcript

item.title: Can Anarchism Work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Teenage punks going through a phase probably come to mind when you think of anarchists, but anarchism is a legitimate political philosophy based on the idea that governments are unnecessary and do more harm than good. Could we actually live without them? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Condoms Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The earliest depiction of a condom is found in a 15,000-year-old cave painting. Ever since humans realized sex led to children, we’ve been using condoms to prevent pregnancy. Transcript

item.title: Genghis Khan: Madman or Genius? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Depending on who you talk to, Genghis Khan was either a sadistic madman or one of the great leaders in world history. One thing is sure, he was one of the most advanced military minds of all time. Transcript

item.title: How The Pill Changed the World | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When the birth control pill hit the market in 1960 it landed like a social bomb. Almost overnight, women gained the ability to separate sex from pregnancy and everything from feminism to patients’ rights centered on it. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Bullfighting Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Today matadors get paid $100,000 and perform in front of 50,000 fans. But is bullfighting an antiquated, abusive relic or a cultural tradition above reproach? Transcript

item.title: Skyscrapers: 'Scuse me while I kiss the sky | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Skyscrapers are much more than tall buildings. They’re world wonders as far as we’re concerned. From design to construction, these babies are beautifully simplistic in all the best ways. Listen in today! Transcript

item.title: How Tsunamis Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tsunamis are amazingly devastating natural disasters. They’re miles tall and wide, travel as fast as a commercial airliner and can wipe out entire coastal towns. And if the last couple decades are any indication, they seem to be getting worse. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How The Hum Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a mysterious droning sound often described as like a diesel engine idling that is severely impacting the quality of life of 2 percent of people in places around the world. Transcript

item.title: Frida Kahlo: Painter, Icon, Genius | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Frida Kahlo was a painter who transcended her own work to became an icon. Learn all about her fascinating and inspiring life and work in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: The Max Headroom Incident | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1987, a very strange broadcast intrusion occurred in the city of Chicago. For just a couple of minutes, the odd TV character Max Headroom appeared onscreen in the middle of an episode of Dr. Who. He spoke in garbled tones, brandished a marital aid… Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Was there a real King Arthur? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The legend of King Arthur is very old and very established. By the time the king who saved Britain and united it was first written about, his story was already hundreds of years old. Transcript

item.title: Is the Pied Piper About a Real Historic Tragedy? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the German town of Hameln a tragedy that took place on a specific date in 1284 and befell specifically 130 children is commemorated every year. Aside from those two details, the event is cloaked in mystery… Transcript

item.title: How Drug Courts Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you aren’t in the know, you may think drug courts are set up to quickly prosecute drug users and get them into prison in short order. Turns out it’s just the opposite… Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Pinball Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pinball was actually illegal until the 1970s in NY and other cities, hidden in the backs of pornography shops. The game was finally legalized, thanks to a Babe Ruth-style shot by the best player in the world. Transcript

item.title: How Occam's Razor Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know the rule that says the simplest explanation is probably the correct one? That’s called a razor and it’s meant to guide logic. But over time it’s become a broadsword used to disprove opposing arguments. Learn how to spot a faux skeptic in this ep. Transcript

item.title: A List Of Games You Would Surely Lose to a Computer | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We live in a time where computers can beat the best humans in the world at chess, checkers, poker and video games. But these games are really just demonstrations of how intelligent our machines are growing. They’re growing more intelligent by the hour. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Is brain size related to intelligence? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Modern investigation into how the brain works suggests there’s a lot more to take into account when comparing brain biology to intellect. Transcript

item.title: The Collar Bomb Heist | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The collar bomb heist is the crime caper that keeps on giving. Every time the story seemed like it was figured out, another layer appeared. Tune in today to hear Josh and Chuck detail this very odd and twisty story. Transcript

item.title: What's a quinceañera anyway? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A quinceañera is the celebration of a girl of Hispanic heritage becoming a young woman on her 15th birthday. It involves family, friends, music and a lot of great food. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Cremation Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuckers take a detailed look at cremation’s history, practices and controversies in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Drowning Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Hundreds of thousands of people drown around the world every year, and yet it can be easily prevented and is widely misunderstood – like how you can officially drown but live to tell the tale, or how you can drown but die days later. Transcript

item.title: PT Barnum: More Complicated Than You've Heard | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When your life is as outsized as the World’s Greatest Showman PT Barnum it’s pretty easy to - you know - gloss over the grimmer aspects when you turn it into an uplifting musical movie. But the way to understand a person is to look at them, warts and all. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Are there undiscovered people? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this classic episode, Josh and Chuck discuss whether there are any truly “undiscovered” groups of people left on the planet, the definition of undiscovered – and why groups might want to avoid modern civilization. Transcript

item.title: North Korea: What's the Deal? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For almost 70 years, North Korea has been the bane of South Korea, Japan and the US or has stood as the sole defenders of the Korean homeland from the American hordes, depending on who you ask. Transcript

item.title: Nepotism: When Hiring the Best Just Won't Do | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Nepotism is something that is very hard to avoid, and very hard to resist, even if you know it may be the wrong thing to do. We all love helping out families get ahead, but you’re also costing someone else an opportunity when you play ball. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Who killed JFK? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck delve into the killing, the investigations and the conspiracy theories to get to the bottom of an enduring national question. Transcript

item.title: Does Pyromania Actually Exist? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A fascination with fire is part of every kid’s childhood, but it’s meant to be passing. For some people, fire becomes the central focus of life, and the urge to set a fire becomes an irresistible impulse. We think. Transcript

item.title: Emojis: A New Language? Nah. | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Believe it or not, there’s a lot more to Emojis than meets the eye. Turns out their history is pretty interesting stuff. Join Josh and Chuck today as they tell the tale of the little faces that we all love to hate. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Mirrors Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Whether using polished metal surfaces or clear glass, human beings have enjoyed admiring their reflections for centuries. In this episode, Josh and Chuck reflect on the types, mind-melting physics, superstitions and rather interesting history of mirrors. Transcript

item.title: Two Times In the 70s When People Buried Ferraris | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Not once, but twice in the 1970s people buried amazingly valuable Ferraris, arguably the greatest sports cars ever built. One was dug up after being secretly buried; the other was put in the ground forever. These are their stories. Transcript

item.title: The Unabomber: Misguided to say the least | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Unabomber was one of the most notorious and longest lasting cases in the history of the FBI. Just because the manifesto reads like he was a fortune teller doesn’t make his actions any less deplorable. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: What happens in the brain during an orgasm? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this classic episode, Chuck and Josh test the limits of their decorum as they explore the physiology of an orgasm. Learn all about this inexplicably taboo subject (including how even women who are paralyzed can experience orgasms). Transcript

item.title: How Paramedics Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Paramedics are not EMTs. Or fire fighters. Or cops. But they do ride around in ambulances (and drive) to help to save lives. It’s a stressful job and we’re here to shine a light on this noble profession. Transcript

item.title: Why Landmines Are The Deadliest Legacy Of War | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the worst legacies of war are the millions of landmines left behind. They hide for decades after a conflict is over, exploding beneath unsuspecting civilians and children. To many, removing mines and banning new ones is of paramount importance. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Sherpas: Warm, Friendly Living | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What exactly is a Sherpa? Tune in and learn more as Chuck and Josh explore the culture of the Sherpa people. Transcript

item.title: Project Azorian: The CIA's Super 70s Mission To Steal A Sunken Soviet Sub | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1974 the CIA undertook one of its most brazen operations – secretly raising a sunken Soviet submarine lost in the middle of the Pacific Ocean right under the noses of the Russian Navy. With the help of billionaire recluse Howard Hughes, obviously. Transcript

item.title: When Words Take on New Meanings | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Historical words often morph and change to take on new meanings. Today on the podcast, Josh and Chuck sit down and talk about a handful of them, their original meanings, and how they changed over the years… Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Guide Dogs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know how when you see a guide dog leading a blind person to their destination and you think, “There goes a truly great dog?” It turns out you are absolutely correct. Guide dogs are about as special as dogs can get and it’s through years of hard work. Transcript

item.title: What are false positives? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When getting a medical diagnosis, it’s important to understand the terms. Negative is good, positive is bad, false positive is great in a way, but false negative is the worst. Learn all about false positives, when your tests indicate you have a disease… Transcript

item.title: How Meals on Wheels Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Meals on Wheels is one of the great charitable organizations in the world, providing much-needed nutrition for elderly people in need. It also has a pretty interesting backstory, starting in multiple places in different countries almost simultaneously. Le Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Subways: HUH! What are they good for? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As ubiquitous as they’ve become, it’s easy to overlook the marvels of engineering that are subways. Chuck and Josh go boring as they explore these systems of tubes that must circumnavigate rock, rivers, cables and more to get you where you’re going. Transcript

item.title: How the Framingham Heart Study Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 1940s, a tiny town outside Boston volunteered to be test subjects in a study that would become one of the longest and broadest in the history of medicine. Originally designed to study heart disease, it’s revealed things about plenty else too: every Transcript

item.title: How the New England Vampire Panics Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 19th century, in isolated villages and godforsaken towns in rural New England, people began to suspect their deceased family members had become undead. Thus began everything we know today about killing vampires. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Trickle-Down Economics Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The concept of trickle-down economics is tied to Ronald Reagan, but the idea’s been around and in use since the 20s. It’s simple: Give more money to the wealthy and they can use it to rev up an economy. But is the whole thing just a scam? Transcript

item.title: Is Vaping Really Bad For You? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description E-cigs, vapes, whatever you call them they have been touted as a safer alternative to tobacco and even a way for people to quit smoking. But recent studies have found that perhaps they’re not so harmless after all. So who’s right? Transcript

item.title: The Huggable, Lovable Walrus | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When it comes to the animal kingdom, SYSK has covered a wide range. This week, the guys dive into the frigid waters of the Arctic to delight in everything that is the huggable, lovable walrus. From their tendency to sticking together in tough times, to th Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: How Cockroaches Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You’ve seen them in your home and probably squealed in terror, but now it’s time to learn all about cockroaches. From their ability to run incredibly fast to the appendage that alerts them when you’re about to whack them with your shoe, cockroaches are fa Transcript

item.title: Why Do People Believe In Faith Healing? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since a 1906 revival in Los Angeles, people around the world say they’ve been cured by the Holy Spirit after preachers with the Gift of Healing laid their hands on them. Skeptics scoff, but science’s explanations are kind of vague. So what’s going on here Transcript

item.title: The Strange Story of Sea Monkeys | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Anyone who ever picked up a comic book as a kid probably marveled at the ads for the mysterious Sea Monkeys. In reality, they are just brine shrimp, not fantastical beings with magical powers. But the story behind the invention of the Sea Monkey is tale a Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Is there treasure on Oak Island? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Off Nova Scotia, the tiny spit of land called Oak Island has been host to waves of treasure hunters for more than 200 years. Some of them lost their lives in the search for a treasure reputedly buried in a deep pit. But is anything really there? Transcript

item.title: SYSK Live: Back When Ford Pintos Were Flaming Deathtraps | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For this special live benefit episode recorded in Atlanta, Josh and Chuck go back to the 70s and look at the decidedly ungroovy course of events that led to Ford recalling its Pinto after people started burning up in them. Transcript

item.title: Knife Throwing: Super Cool | Stuff You Should Know

item.description: Podcast Description It’s pretty obvious something’s gone wrong when you get a sunburn, but did you know a tan means you’ve damaged your DNA? Dive into the three Ss of summer and learn all about how to protect yourself from the sun. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, famed aviator Amelia Earhart’s disappearance in 1937 is a mystery that endures to this day. Why don’t we know what happened to her? In this episode, Josh and Chuck examine the facts and evidence behind the famous case. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Net neutrality is the idea that the internet is a public good and that everyone should have equal, unfettered access to it. Though the FCC strongly supported it with new rules in 2015, today’s FCC is under new leadership and has other ideas. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Once in a while a movie comes along that’s so forward-thinking it changes the way that horror is done. A new subgenre is spawned, new tropes are established, and audiences are more terrified than ever. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description The word stoic has taken on its own meaning apart from the philosophical movement which gave it life. Learn all about the early stoics, what the philosophy is all about and where the movement stands today. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Selects: Why isn't the U.S. on the metric system? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, the U.S. stands proudly defiant and the world looks at Americans as dopes for the U.S.’s stubborn refusal to go metric. item.title: SYSK Selects: Scooby Dooby Doo, Where Are You? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, for decades, Scooby Doo has captivated children across the world. item.description: Podcast Description In the early days of World War II, there was a secret training program in Canada that taught Allied saboteurs everything from espionage and bridge blowing to karate chops to the neck of an enemy. item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever been to an international airport, you’ve probably seen one of the keenest spotters of illegal contraband - The Beagle Brigade! item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, yes, your brain may have just flash-dried from boredom at the thought of learning about maps, but it turns out they are a lot more than just tools for navigation. item.description: Podcast Description For millennia, mass strandings of whales have confounded us. Why should dozens or more whales come onto shore only to die a terrible and lengthy death? Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Coelacanths are incredibly interesting as far as fish go. For one, they were thought to have gone the way of the dinosaur, along with the dinosaur. item.title: SYSK Selects: What's the deal with Rasputin's death? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, Grigori Rasputin, the Russian charismatic cleric and political adviser to the ruling Romanovs, is said to have been poisoned, shot, shot again, bludgeoned and drowned. item.title: The Stories Behind A Few Food Fads | Stuff You Should Know

item.description: Podcast Description Are laws that are meant to protect the sanctity of the polling place in reality designed to make it harder for groups that traditionally vote Democrat to cast their ballots? Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, at long last, Josh and Chuck take on perhaps their most important topic ever. Learn about the history of beer, how it’s made – the whole shebang, basically – in this watershed episode of Stuff You Should Know. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Schoolhouse Rock is possibly the best children’s program of all time. Join Josh and Chuck as they tell the story of SR, featuring an interview with Pavement’s Bob Nastanovich, contributor to the ’90s Schoolhouse Rock tribute record. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description “Head transplant” is a bit of a misnomer, because it’s more like a body transplant. item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, for thousands of years, humans have used hallucinogenic mushrooms for spiritual reasons. item.description: Podcast Description It wasn’t too long ago that humans thought the polar lights were signs from the afterlife. Thanks to a 19th century Norwegian, we now understand that they are a fascinating interplay with Earth’s magnetic field and wind from the sun. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Sure we can all agree that champagne is probably the greatest thing humans have or ever will invent, but how much do we understand how it’s made? Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, about 30-40 percent of humans suffer from some sort of allergy. item.title: How Charismatic Megafauna Work | Stuff You Should Know

item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, in a desert in Texas a 200-feet-tall clock is being constructed deep inside a mountain. item.description: Podcast Description When the immune system mistakes the tissue covering neural connections as foreign invaders, the result can devastate the body. There is hope, however, in a new radical treatment that resets the immune system. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Sure, we’re doing an episode on corsets. Why do you ask? Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Until recently, volcanologists thought supervolcanoes were simply massive volcanoes. But further research has revealed that they are far different - and far more dangerous - than previously imagined. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Being nominated as a Supreme Court Justice is no small thing, and it doesn’t always go as planned. With this week’s confirmation of Justice Gorsuch, Josh and Chuck take a look at the process of getting named to America’s highest court. Transcript

item.title: Composting: Nature's Most Interesting Process | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You may think composting is just a bunch of old banana peels rotting away into dirt but, friend, you’re not looking closely enough. Inside that compost pile is a microcosmic universe doing some magical stuff. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s SYSK Select episode, although lots of people incorrectly believe the filibuster was an intentional rule created by the founders of the U.S., this ancient method of stalling legislation was actually brought about in America by accident. item.description: Podcast Description The Shroud of Turin is no ordinary bed sheet. Some think it’s the burial cloth of Jesus. Others think it’s an amazing piece of artwork. The truth is, we’ll probably never know what it really is. The mystery of the Shroud of Turin awaits you… Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In our continuing exploration of crime and punishment, we take a look at the practice of solitary confinement. To be sure, it has its place in prisons, sometimes for protection of the inmates themselves. However, leaving people in solitary for weeks, mont Transcript

item.title: Southerners Aren’t Lazy and Dumb, They Just Had Hookworm | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There was a time when the lower classes of the American South were considered lazy and dimwitted, a stereotype that still somewhat survives today. But this stereotype was rooted in fact. Hookworms, it turns out, were sapping Southerners’ life force. Transcript

item.title: Live from San Francisco: How Malls Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this show recorded live on January 5, 2017 at San Francisco’s Castro Theatre, Josh and Chuck delve into the history and the heyday of the church of consumerism and what it means for local communities and our capitalist society at large when malls die. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description In the not too distant future, sex may not involve being in the same room as your partner. In fact, your partner may not even have to be a human. item.title: Elastics: Where God and Science Smooch | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You could be forgiven for thinking the story behind elastics was boring. You’d still be wrong, though. The story of what’s holding up your underwear is a global drama, replete with war, industrial espionage, colonialism, destitute inventors – everything! Transcript

item.title: How Pacifism Works (And Could It?) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is deep disagreement over whether humans are essentially peaceful or essentially warlike. Depending on your view you may see pacifism as either hopelessly naïve or the unsung response to conflict that’s kept us from wiping ourselves out. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description There are many types of dictators, from so called “benevolent” ones to the kind who rule with an iron fist. item.title: How Soylent Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Soylent is a meal replacement drink, but not really. So what is it? Total sustenance in a glass? Some say so. Is it made from humans? No, that’s just a movie. Learn all about this odd concoction in today’s episode. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Artificial sweeteners have gotten a bad rap in the press for as long as they’ve been in use. item.description: Podcast Description Unless you happen to be standing on a hilltop or swimming in the ocean right now, you are on a watershed. These unsung wonders of topography and hydrology are an important contributor to the rain cycle and yet we humans tend to abuse them. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Baby Boomers are probably the most talked about generation in American history. But who are these people and how did they help shape the country we know today? Find out all about the big boom in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Feeding Babies Works: The Bottle | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The decision to bottle feed a baby instead of breast-feeding is a weighty one these days, fraught with supposed developmental pitfalls and very real social implications. But is bottle feeding a bad thing? And are benefits of breast-feeding overestimated? Transcript

item.title: How Feeding Babies Works: The Breast | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Breast milk is considered a perfect food for infants, so much so that for the first four to six months of life, a baby can subsist on mother’s milk alone. Learn all about the most fascinating milk around and the science behind it in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Human Blockheads: A Real Thing | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Human blockheads are performers who hammer nails and things into their noses. Yup. That’s a thing. And it isn’t a trick either - anyone can do it. Just please don’t try to. Transcript

item.title: Can you live without a bank account? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Seems like it would be nearly impossible to live without a bank account these days. But it is possible! Learn all about banking and personal finance in today’s riveting episode. Transcript

item.title: The Stuff You Should Know 2016 Christmas Extravaganza in 3-D! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the most wonderful time of year again! Time for Josh and Chuck to take you on a cozy, hall-decked ride full of glad tidings right into the heart of the holiday spirit! Transcript

item.title: The Golden Age of Grave Robbing: Stuff You Should Know Live in London | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There was a brief period in the US, UK and Ireland when a dead body could fetch a pretty penny for a person willing to dig it up and sell it to surgeons for dissection. It turns out that there was no shortage of ghoulish types willing to do just that. Transcript

item.title: How Porta-Potties Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Despite our lengthy history of evacuating our bowels and bladders, it wasn’t until the relatively recent 1940s that we began to construct portable, self-contained toilets to accept our waste. Dive into the world of porta-potties in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Will We Find Evidence of Aliens by Their Engineering Projects? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1960 physicist Freeman Dyson suggested that in the hunt for alien life, we should search for evidence of massive engineering projects that encapsulate stars with solar arrays to harness their energy. Could we humans ever make one ourselves? Transcript

item.title: Is computer addiction a thing? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Computer addiction is really an umbrella term for the various addictions that can come along with the computer. We’re talking video games, porn, gambling and the like. We dive deep into the world of digital addiction in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Horoscopes: Written in the Stars? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A lot of people read their daily horoscopes, but does anyone really take stock in them? Turns out the answer is yes, even though there is no evidence of their accuracy. Learn all about horoscopes today. Transcript

item.title: How a Flea Circus Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever seen a flea circus, then count yourself among the few. It’s a dying art, but back in the day they thrilled and delighted young and old alike. Learn all about the tiny big tops in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Frostbite: Yeeeow! | Stuff You Should Know

item.title: Should Advertising to Kids Be Banned? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description As kids’ buying power in America has exploded in recent decades, so too has the amount companies spend advertising to them. But because of a quirk of brain development, kids aren’t equipped to understand ads are manipulating them. Should they be banned? Transcript

item.title: The Kitty Genovese Story | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Most people have heard of the story of Kitty Genovese. She was murdered near her apartment in 1964 and her neighbors didn’t do much to help. It caused a nationwide outcry, but the story has often been misrepresented. We’ll set the record straight. Transcript

item.title: What's the Deal with Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Concussions are bad enough for football players, but research has found all of those smaller hits can add up to massive brain trauma later in life too, leading to a condition called chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a condition the NFL sought to cover up. Transcript

item.title: How Fireplaces Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They are dirty, harmful to your health, bad for the environment and utterly charming. Wood-burning fireplaces have been with us for centuries and, despite their many drawbacks, are sticking around. Learn more than you thought possible about the fireplace. Transcript

item.title: How Monty Python Worked: SYSK Live from LA Podfest | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Things get awesome when Josh and Chuck do a live show on Monty Python at the LA Podcast Festival. Hang out as the duo dives into the “Beatles of Comedy,” what made them tick, what made them so funny, the whole bit. Plus, Kevin Pollak crashes the stage. Transcript

item.title: Do sin taxes work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Taxing things like alcohol, tobacco and gambling is big money and has been for a long time. But are these “sin taxes” keeping people from indulging or are they simply a way to raise revenue? Learn all about sin taxes in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: A Partial History of Action Figures | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Action figures have a long and glorious history. From GI Joes to Star Wars figures, these offshoots of dolls came along at just the right time to capture the hearts and minds of children everywhere. Learn all about the partial history of action figures ri Transcript

item.title: Ham Radio and the Hams Who Use Them | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you thought that Ham Radio enthusiasts were (mostly) men and boys who sit alone late at night in order to scan frequencies searching for a human connection then you’re absolutely correct. But it’s much more than that. Transcript

item.title: SYSK The Podcast: Special Halloween Bonus Episode 2016, The Sequel – From Hell | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Lock your doors and grab something heavy to defend yourself, like a candlestick or something, because Josh and Chuck are going to scare the wits out of you, courtesy of a story from The Grabster and listeners who submitted two-sentence horror. Scary! Transcript

item.title: The Hinterkaifeck Axe Murders | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1922, a little farm in the woods of Bavaria became the site of what would become Germany’s most famous unsolved murder, when six people were brutally killed with a pick axe. What led up to it and followed is nothing short of bizarre. Transcript

item.title: How Sleep Paralysis Works, or The Worst Thing That Can Happen While You're Sleeping | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For as long as people have been sleeping, about half of us have probably suffered from sleep paralysis. Thanks to an unusual fluke in the sleep cycle, the sufferer feels paralyzed and consumed by fear as something on their chest tries to kill them. Transcript

item.title: Living Underground in Beijing | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chairman Mao’s paranoia of a Soviet invasion led to hundreds of thousands of Beijing residents put to work for a decade building an 85-square-km underground city to serve as a massive bomb shelter. Instead it’s illegal underground housing today. Transcript

item.title: What's the What with Fish Fraud? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Fish fraud, misrepresenting a fish as a more expensive one, costs Americans $25 billion a year. And because less than 100 inspectors check for fraud in the US and everyone from wholesalers to sushi restaurants are free to rip off their customers. Transcript

item.title: How the Census Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Counting humans has been happening for a long, long time. It usually had to do with taxing them, but now census data can reveal a lot about a population and help satisfy its needs. Count us in for this episode. Transcript

item.title: Hibernation: Not a Snooze | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When animals are faced with scarce food in the winter, they have two choices to stay alive: migrate or hibernate. For hibernators, their bodies undergo some mind-boggling physiological changes in the coldest months. Could humans ever do it too? Transcript

item.title: Why Did Easter Island's Civilization Collapse? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When the first Europeans landed on Rapa Nui, which they renamed Easter Island, they were puzzled by what happened there. Only a few thousand people lived there but there were signs of a massive civilization that once flourished. What happened there? Transcript

item.title: The Amazing History of Soda | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The soda we get instantly mixed at a fast-food joint owes a lot to a rich history going back to the Roman baths, that features drugs, diseases and explosions. Learn all about soda and soda fountains in this surprisingly interesting episode. Transcript

item.title: How Polar Bears Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Polar bears are more than just lovable creatures that roam the ice in search of food. They’re one of the most fascinating animals on planet Earth. Sadly, as ice shrinks, so does their habitat. Learn all about these huggable beasts in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Ice Ages Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Believe it or not, we live in an ice age. The polar glaciers give it away. Those glaciers used to come clear down to New York. We now know the traces they left are everywhere if you know what to look for; it just took some Swiss peasants to figure it out. Transcript

item.title: All we know about Zika so far... | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Zika is all over the news these days, yet in America, people don’t seem to be too concerned just yet. Some say it’s a case of the media crying wolf. Others say it’s because the risk factors for zika are limited. Learn all about the latest virus to take ce Transcript

item.title: How Cerebral Palsy Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Cerebral palsy isn’t a disease, but an umbrella term for conditions arising from brain damage suffered in the womb or shortly after birth. The factors involved are so divergent no two cases of CP are alike, making it – and people who have CP – fascinating Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with Stradivarius violins? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Strad violin is noted for its tonal qualities and superior craftsmanship. And for its price tag. There are many theories why the Strad sounds so great, from the wood to the lacquer, to the simple fact that Antonio Stradivari was really good at what he Transcript

item.title: Alexander Hamilton: Most Influential American? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Alexander Hamilton, the “ten dollar founding father,” is more than the toast of Broadway. In fact, he just may be the most influential American in history. A brash genius, Hamilton wasn’t much of a politician. He was all about policy. Learn all about Hami Transcript

item.title: Do Animals Have Natural Rights? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Animals have had legal protection from unnecessary harm since the 19th century. Yet what harm is necessary is open to interpretation and animals continue to suffer and die for science and commerce. Should they have the right to freedom from humans? Transcript

item.title: How Animal Testing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The use of animals for commercial and scientific testing is a quietly controversial topic. That we humans have advanced as a species because we use animals as literal and figurative guinea pigs is undeniable. But do we have the right to do that? Transcript

item.title: How the Negro Leagues Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A decade before the U.S. officially segregated in 1896, baseball banned black players. A decade before the US integrated, baseball broke the color barrier. Between, the Negro Leagues produced some of the finest players to ever take the field. Transcript

item.title: How Food Tasters Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Some people might think that tasting food for a living is the best job in the whole wide world. But think again! The reality is, it can be a tedious, grueling job that destroys your very love of food. Transcript

item.title: This Custom of Customs | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Customs may be a pain when you’re traveling, but it’s a necessary instrument the government uses to regulate trade. And it has a very fascinating history. Your passport please? Transcript

item.title: Jellyfish: Even Cooler than Octopi? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Jellyfish are among the most adaptable, competitive organisms on the planet. They can grow back into their juvenile stage when resources are scarce, reproduce in massive groups and kill an adult human, among lots of other neat stuff. Learn all about em! Transcript

item.title: The Delightful History of Steam Technology | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description One of the coolest things humans have ever figured out is how to use steam as power. It made the Industrial Revolution possible and even today, 88% of America’s electricty comes from steam turbines. Transcript

item.title: How Woolly Mammoths Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It was only 11000 years ago that the last true woolly mammoths died out, close enough to the modern age that humans lived alongside them. But were humans the cause of mammoths’ sudden extinction or was climate change to blame? Transcript

item.title: Evel Knievel Part II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In today’s episode, we cover part two of our Evel Knievel suite. The man, the myth, the legend. Check in and listen to the latter stages of Evel’s career as the world’s most legendary daredevil. Transcript

item.title: Evel Knievel Part I | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Evel Knievel was perhaps the world’s most legendary daredevil. He came along at a time when the world ate up this kind of entertainment, partially in hopes that he crashed. And crash he did. A lot. Learn all about this icon in this special two part episod Transcript

item.title: Mermaids: Not a real thing | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Mermaids aren’t real. That much we know. But the history and lore of these magical and sometimes menacing creatures of the sea is pretty interesting stuff. Learn all about these half women/half fish today. Transcript

item.title: How Night Terrors Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Night terrors, an uncommon sleep disorder, happen when the brain doesn’t transition correctly to deep sleep. The result is terrifying, with the sufferer genuinely terrified, swatting at invisible attackers, and screaming for help - all while sound asleep. Transcript

item.title: What is exploding head syndrome? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Exploding head syndrome isn’t nearly as weird as it sounds, and there are no brain parts being damaged. But if you suffer from it, you will definitely be freaked out. The good news is, despite its name, it’s not dangerous at all. Transcript

item.title: How Triage Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Triage is a system that provides immediate attention and categorization for medical emergencies that hopefully will never be a big part of your life. Unless you work in an ER. Learn all about the interesting history and current methods for this life savin Transcript

item.title: How the Moonwalk Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When Michael Jackson debuted the moonwalk in 1983 the world was enrapt. The dance goes back farther, to the 1930s, and pops up again in the 50s, before reappearing via mimes and West Coast poppers in the 70s. Follow the circuitous route of an iconic move. Transcript

item.title: How Chaos Theory Changed the Universe | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since the age of Descartes, science has put all of its eggs in the basket of determinism, the idea that with accurate enough measurements any aspect of the universe could be predicted. But the universe, it turns out, is not so tidy. Transcript

item.title: The Gettysburg Address: Short and Sweet | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Gettysburg Address is one of the most famous speeches in political history, despite only being a few hundred words long. What was so special about this commemoration? We’ll give you the skinny right here and now. Transcript

item.title: How Radiation Sickness Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Fortunately, science has very few instances where humans have been exposed to acute radiation poisoning to study for clues to treating radiation sickness. They have found, though, that those few instances have been grave. Transcript

item.title: What's with this "Internet of Things"? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You may have heard about the Internet of Things and not known what the term meant. It’s basically a collection of object conected to your life and the internet. We’re talking everything from your smart phone to your fitness tracker. Cool stuff, but fraugh Transcript

item.title: Research tips from SYSK | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description People often ask us how we do our research. We’re not going to disclose all of our secrets, but we’ll give you some tips on how to root out the bad studies from the good ones. Learn all about shady studies and reporting right now! Transcript

item.title: How Lighthouses Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description People have been burning fires on cliffs as long as other people have used boats, but after the Age of Exploration, lighthouses took their unmistakable form and the great stories of the people who kept the lights around the world began. Transcript

item.title: How Underground Mining Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description People used to use deer antlers to beat the minerals out of rock hidden in the earth. Luckily, they got better at it, and now modern mining is a mind-boggling process for efficiently removing stuff we want from inside the planet. Transcript

item.title: What's the misery index? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Economists love their data because somewhere in the numbers lies the answer to the ills of the country. They also love to frame data in a way people can relate to. Such is the case with the famous “misery index.” Transcript

item.title: How Space Stations Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It seems like we largely take it for granted these days, but the fact that we have humans living in space is the realization of a scientific dream a century old. Visit the space stations orbiting Earth past, present and future in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Steadicams Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There have been many inventions that have advanced filmmaking, but maybe none as important as the steadicam. Invented in the mid-70s, it literally changed the way movie making happened, and made the impossible possible. Learn about the fascinating history Transcript

item.title: Why Are So Many Disembodied Feet Washing Ashore In British Columbia? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Between 2007 and 2016, 17 disembodied feet - still wearing shoes - have washed ashore between Washington and British Columbia. What’s behind the sudden influx of Vancouver’s mystery feet? Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with controlled burns? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Starting a fire to prevent fire seems counterintuitive, but it makes a lot of sense once you understand it. But controlled burns aren’t just to help prevent forest fires. They’re also a vital part of keeping the local ecosystem healthy and thriving. Learn Transcript

item.title: How Motion Sickness Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Motion sickness is the worst and hits about 25 to 40 percent of humans when they ride in cars, boats, or simply watch the wrong 3-D movie. Join us as we break down the science behind this nausea-inducing affliction. Transcript

item.title: How Gene Editing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With the discovery of a surprising immune response in E coli bacteria, we are facing a new era of freedom from genetic mutations that lead to disease by simply and precisely editing our genes. But there is also a potential dark side to gene editing. Transcript

item.title: How SuperBalls Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You can thank Wham-O’s SuperBall for inspiring the name of the NFL’s Big Game (buh) and you can thank the fear and the Soviet launch of Sputnik aroused in America for the invention of SuperBall! Learn the history and physics of this bouncy legend. Transcript

item.title: How Crumple Zones Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever been in a bad accident in a newer car, you probably have crumple zones to thank for your life. Much more interesting than you think, these zones are designed to break apart and absorb impact, so you don’t have to. Transcript

item.title: Chiggers: The Phantom Menace | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chiggers are tiny little mites capable of making your life miserable. Worse than mosquitoes? Maybe. But they aren’t insects - mites are actually part of the arachnid family and behave a little like ticks. Learn all about these nearly invisible pests in to Transcript

item.title: The Unsolved Mystery Disappearance of the Sodder Children | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1945 a house fire took the lives of five children - except that no trace of their bodies was ever found. Dive into the longstanding mystery of the odd circumstances surrounding the disappearance of the Sodder children. Transcript

item.title: How Bonsai Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For thousands of years people have been taking normal trees and forcing them into miniature. Learn all about the history and art of this strangely engrossing pastime. Transcript

item.title: True stories of survival cannibalism! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Cannibalism is the macabre practice of eating other humans. But sometimes, people have no choice if they want to survive. It’s called survival cannibalism and it tastes like chicken. Transcript

item.title: How Snake Handlers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Snake handling ranges from professional snake milkers for antivenin to religious handlers who tend to get bitten and sometimes die from it. Either way, it can be a dangerous business. Learn all about snake handling right here, right now. Transcript

item.title: How LSD Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1943 Swiss chemist Albert Hofman discovered he’d created what may be the most potent hallucinogen known to humankind. Then he took a bike ride. Learn about the chemistry, neurology, history and cultural impact of LSD-25. Transcript

item.title: How Megalodon Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Between 2 to 20 million years ago, the biggest shark with perhaps the most devastating bite of any animal ever ruled the oceans with an iron jaw. Despite its fierceness, megalodon went extinct while other species that swam with it survive today. Why? Transcript

item.title: What was Operation Plowshare? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description America had already used two nuclear bombs to devastating effect when researchers thought “maybe we can use these bombs to dig big holes instead.” That’s right, atom bombs to replace bulldozers. And it worked great. Transcript

item.title: Myths and Truths About Tornadoes | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tornadoes can make mincemeat out of houses, people, cars, you name it. So do you know what to do - and what not to do - when there’s one headed your way? Transcript

item.title: Does Kin Selection Explain Altruism? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a curious puzzle unanswered by the theory of evolution: why do some animals give up their chance to reproduce to help others reproduce instead? For decades biologists have suggested family was the reason, but that has recently been challenged. Transcript
