item.title: What Makes Lead So Poisonous? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The people of Flint, MI were horrified to find their drinking water was poisoned with lead. As we learn more about lead’s effects and realize how persistent it is, the more worrying it becomes. What makes lead so toxic? Transcript

item.title: How Big Bang Theory Works, with Neil deGrasse Tyson | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are a number of theories for how the universe evolved but none are more widely accepted than the Big Bang theory. Learn about the mind-boggling details of the early universe and hear Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson talk about what it will take for us to kno Transcript

item.title: How the Gender Pay Gap Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The gender pay gap is the amount of time into the next year a woman must work to earn as much as a man did the previous year. And it’s narrowing at a snail’s pace. Transcript

item.title: How Labor Strikes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Labor strikes are the last resort of a workforce frustrated with low pay or dangerous working conditions. A big part of winning a wage war is having the public in your side. Learn all about strikes in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Our cats episode - right here, right meow | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Cats are the most popular pet in the United States, despite the fact that we’ve only been keeping them indoors for 50-60 years. Learn about more cat facts in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Nostalgia is not the most toxic impulse | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Nostalgia is a funny thing. It’s not home sickness, it’s more connected to emotions and a time in your life. But is nostalgia worthwhile? Nascent science says it just might be. Transcript

item.title: What Was the Deal With the Hatfields and McCoys? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It was America’s most famous family feud, but the history of the Hatfields vs the McCoys is fraught with bias and inaccuracies. Dig into a disagreement in 19th-century Appalachia that became a very big deal around the world. Transcript

item.title: How TED Talks Work: Featuring Roman Mars | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description TED Talks have been around longer than you think. They became really popular once YouTube came along to bring their often inspirational messages to the world, 18 minutes at a time. In this episode, we interview an actual TED talker, the host of the 99% In Transcript

item.title: Who Gets to Name Continents? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description America is named after Amerigo Vespucci, right? Maybe not. And who named Australia? Find out the unusually uncertain origins of the continents and other interesting stuff in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Makeup Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Humans have been wearing makeup for a few thousand years now and yet, here in the US the chemicals used in them are still not understood and not really regulated. Delve into the history of makeup and the psychology and feminist theory around it. Transcript

item.title: Some Really Interesting Cases of Mass Hysteria | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Around the world and across time, people have fallen victim to one of the strongest contagions of all - the power of suggestion. Here are just a few examples of these bizarre cases. Transcript

item.title: How Dark Money Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since the Supreme Court ruled in 2010 in the Citizens United case that political contributions are speech and should be protected, the floodgates of anonymous political contributions have opened. But does absolute funding corrupt absolutely? Transcript

item.title: How The Iditarod Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Each year hundreds of dogs haul humans in sleds as part of the 1,100 plus mile Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race. It’s grueling and not without controversy but one thing is for sure, these are some amazing dogs. Transcript

item.title: How Freak Shows Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Not too long ago, people would pay money to gawk and stare at a performer with a physical disformity. They were called freakshows and they began in large part thanks to P.T. Barnum, whose circus we still enjoy today. Sounds awful, but some of these perfor Transcript

item.title: How El Nino Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description El Nino may mean “the little boy” or “Christ Child” in Spanish, but this weather phenomenon really means crazy things for Planet Earth. We’re talking rain where it’s typically dry and drought where it’s usually wet. Learn why today. Transcript

item.title: (Approximately) 10 Things That Vanished Mysteriously | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes things - like dentures, airplanes or even people - go missing. And when they never turn up again they become enduring, and engrossing, mysteries. Transcript

item.title: The Future of Renewable Energy, Featuring Bill Gates | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Renewable energy could be the key to ensuring the future prosperity and health of Planet Earth and humankind. In this very special episode, we sit down and discuss the possibilities with Bill Gates. Transcript

item.title: How Nitrous Oxide Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For about 175 years people have been huffing nitrous oxide for everything from vision quests to anesthetic to get plain old high. And after all that time we are only now beginning to understand how it works on our brains. Transcript

item.title: How Jackhammers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s likely that without the invention of the pneumatic jackhammer, the Industrial Revolution wouldn’t have hummed along quite so smoothly. Certainly a lot more trains would go around mountains than through them. Learn about this essential tool here. Transcript

item.title: What's the Deal With Poop? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We are going to get down and dirty with all things poop in this episode: What a healthy poop looks like, how to poop your best, the history of using poop to survive in the Canadian wild and lots more interesting stuff. Transcript

item.title: How Rabies Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rabies may have gotten a lot of attention in the U.S. in the 70s and 80s, but it’s still an issue in developing countries. Learn all about this nasty virus in today’s episode. And stay away from racoons and bats. Transcript

item.title: How Land Diving Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On Pentacost Island the ritual that preceded bungee jumping is alive and well. Just why do these tribesmen risk life and limb? To ensure a hearty yam harvest. Great reason. Transcript

item.title: Operation Mincemeat: How A Corpse Fooled the Nazis | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In World War II, a secret department of British ‘corkscrew thinkers’ hatched a plan to use the cadaver of an unclaimed homeless man to turn the tide of the war in the Allies’ favor. It worked. Transcript

item.title: Does Whole-Body Cryotherapy Work? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Forty years after a Japanese doctor began using whole body cryotherapy to treat patients with arthritis; the technique has made its ways to med-spas and locker rooms throughout the West. But does it actually do anything? Transcript

item.title: How Personalized Medicine Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Hippocrates realized that it is even more important to understand the patient than to understand the disease and now, 2000 years later, we are coming back to that way of thinking with personalized medicine. ? Transcript

item.title: Timber! How Timber Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Throughout much of the world, the forests are being managed through sustainable timber harvesting practices. This has come at the cost of much legal battling and a century of practice. ? Transcript

item.title: Sir Isaac Newton: Greatest Scientist of All Time? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There have been a lot of great scientist throughout history, but Sir Isaac Newton might just take the cake. But while he was a certified genius, he was also a little screwy. Dive into the life of this fascinating chap in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: The Duality of Caffeine | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Caffeine is a heck of a drug - at the same time it’s both good and bad for you. Learn the good, bad and ugly about this everyday stimulant in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Futurology Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Science fiction writers have made some amazingly accurate predictions over the years, but in 1945 the pace of technological change created a field that spun off of sci-fi forecasting, futurology. Transcript

item.title: Body Language! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Body language is how you communicate without words. Some say it bears more impact in communication than speaking words. Learn about how you say what you say could mean more than you think. Transcript

item.title: The "Satanic Panic" of the 1980s | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the late 1980s, the United States experienced a “Satanic Panic,” leading parents to fear for the safety of their children. But were there any real examples of Satanic ritual abuse? Find out this and more in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Lizzie Borden Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Everybody knows how many whacks Lizzie Borden gave her mother and father with that axe, but there is plenty about the infamous double homicide that remains unresolved, like who actually did it. Travel into the mystery of Lizzie Borden in this episode. Transcript

item.title: The Great Wall of China Episode | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Great Wall of China is one of the most visited tourist desinations in the world. How’d it get built? How old is it? What’s the current condition? Learn this and more in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: The Stuff You Should Know 2015 Jolly Christmas Extravaganza | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the most wonderful time of year again! Join Chuck and Josh as they explore Christmas traditions around the world, tidbits about Elf, holiday foods and lots more joyous stuff in this glad tidings-packed episode. Transcript

item.title: How Gossip Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know what I heard? That Josh and Chuck hate each other and they’re just faking being friends for the show. That’s called gossip, folks and it can do serious damage. Learn all about it in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: The Star Wars Holiday Special of 1978 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Long ago, in a galaxy not so far away, George Lucas allowed the Star Wars Holiday Special to be made. What happened on the night of November 17, 1978 can never be fully explained, but we make our best effort in a very special edition of SYSK. May the forc Transcript

item.title: How the Antikythera Mechanism Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1900 sponge divers found the wreck of a 2000 year-old treasure ship that contained within it a machine that should not exist. Learn of the device that reveals an understanding of the cosmos far more sophisticated than anyone knew the Greeks possessed. Transcript

item.title: How Reverse Psychology Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You have very likely used reverse psychology before, trying to persuade someone to do something you want by suggesting they do the opposite. What’s behind the bizarre reaction this elicits? Transcript

item.title: Carl Sagan: American Hero | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Carl Sagan was the world’s first mainstream media super scientist, capapble of breaking down complex ideas for the common folk. But what made him tick? Billions and billions of great ideas. Transcript

item.title: How HIV/AIDS Works, Part II | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In part two of the series on HIV/AIDS, Chuck and Josh explore how the battle against the disease is being fought and won thanks to new treatments and possible cures. Transcript

item.title: How HIV/AIDS Works, Part I | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description AIDS is one of the most well-known and most misunderstood diseases humans are susceptible to. In part one of this two-part series, Josh and Chuck explain how the disease is contracted and how it works. Transcript

item.title: Live in Chicago: How Public Relations Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After a year of taking it on the road, Josh and Chuck are releasing their show on public relations. Learn all about the ways you’re manipulated on a daily basis and the man who invented it in this fascinating live episode. Transcript

item.title: The Lowdown on Anonymous | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Anonymous is an amorphous group of hacktivists with no single leader or power structure. Some call them heroes, others call them criminals. Can they be both? Transcript

item.title: How Dementia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The number of people suffering from dementia is expected to explode in the coming decades and, in a pleasant surprise, countries around the world are taking steps to plan for the increase in friendly, caring ways. Transcript

item.title: How Rodney Dangerfield Worked, Live From LA | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Other comedians cry on the inside, but Rodney Dangerfield built his entire act around his sad life. Get to know this legendary comic who was nearing 50 when he got his break. Transcript

item.title: What's the Deal With Staring? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Gazing too long upon another person is almost universally viewed as anywhere from impolite to hostile, which is odd considering science isn’t fully certain why we stare - and why we’re so good at knowing when we’re being stared at. Transcript

item.title: How The Voynich Manuscript Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since its re-discovery in the early 20th century, the Medieval codex the Voynich Manuscript has thoroughly puzzled anyone who has tried to unlock its secret language and bizarre drawings. Will it ever give up its secrets? Transcript

item.title: Maggots: Good For Healing Wounds, Turns Out | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Cultures around the world over the years have been inspired by, then repulsed, then inspired by maggots’ ability to heal persistent wounds. We are in an inspired-by phase right now. Transcript

item.title: How Grimm's Fairy Tales Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Unless you were raised alone in a basement (in which case you may be the subject of one), you probably grew up on fairy tales. That’s appropriate because they may be humanity’s greatest psychic projection screen. Transcript

item.title: The Dark Origins of Fairy Tales | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Fairy tales are for kids right? Well not at first they weren’t. They were dark tales of murder, rape, incest, cannibalism and mayhem geared toward adults. What changed? Chuck and Josh will drop that knowledge and more in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Josh N Chuck's Hallowe'en Spooky Scarefest | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Each year, Chuck and Josh read a couple of scary stories and this year they have a pair of truly frightful tales about a haunted bog and a terrifying spider exhibit. Transcript

item.title: How Passports Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The concept of passports - that people should enjoy protected freedom of movement - is an ancient one. It wasn’t until WWI that they became universal. Learn all about this overlooked, important document. Transcript

item.title: Vocal Fry and Other Speech Trends | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You’ve heard lots of complaints about vocal fry, mostly from older white men. But it’s not exclusive to the Kardashians. Learn all about vocal fry, upspeak and other quirky speech trends in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Please Listen to How Plasma Waste Converters Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a way to not only sustainably get rid our household waste, but also produce enough energy from it to power the process and even create electricity for the grid. The future is here! Transcript

item.title: How Wine Fraud Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Wine fraud may be a case of rich con artists tricking wealthy people into parting with money, but it’s still a crime. Learn all about this weird, widespread practice in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Vestigial Organs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Darwin asserted that seemingly useless organs and behaviors are left over from our evolutionary history. But as more are found to have a function, the idea has become a flashpoint for the battle between science and religion. Transcript

item.title: What was the Philadelphia Experiment? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Philadelphia Experiment is a bad movie from the 1980s, and also the conspiracy theory that refuses to die, despite virtually zero evidence of its occurrence. Learn all about this strange non-event in today’s show. Transcript

item.title: How Lobbying Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Lobbying is an entrenched part of American politics and one that many people think is breaking government. But petitioning the government is protected in the Constitution. How can this system be fixed? Transcript

item.title: How PEZ Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description PEZ began in Vienna as a mint meant to help people quit smoking. But once American kids got ahold of it, the candy took off and a symbol of childhood - and healthy secondary market among collectors - was born. Transcript

item.title: Chuck and Josh Make It Through Female Puberty | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In part two of the SYSK puberty saga, Josh and Chuck venture into new territory as they explore all of the amazing changes girls face when they come of age. Transcript

item.title: Geothermal Energy: Earth's Gift to Mankind | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Green energy is good for all, and it doesn’t get much greener than using the Earth’s own heat to warm your home or office. Learn all about geothermal energy in today’s new episode. Transcript

item.title: How Cult Deprogramming Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The fear of cults in the 1970s drove Americans to look the other way on kidnappings, abuse and torture of cult members by deprogrammers - but did it even work? Transcript

item.title: The Great Nuclear Winter Debate of 1983 | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description At the height of the Cold War, a group of concerned scientists promoted their findings on the horrific aftereffects of nuclear war and were accused of fearmongering. But were they right after all? Transcript

item.title: How Publicists Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Some people call them flacks. Other people call them liars. But if you’re in the public eye and suddenly have an image problem, you’ll call them your best friend. Transcript

item.title: How Chili Peppers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Born and raised in South America, chilis were the earliest crop domesticated in the continent and among the first items brought back to Europe by Columbus. Today people are really, really into them. Transcript

item.title: How Police Dogs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Police dogs have been used since the 19th century - one WWI German defector became a major movie star. But in the US the post-9/11 era has seen a K9 unit boom and questions and concerns have increased as well. Transcript

item.title: How Alcoholism Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the US, 17 million people are alcoholics. Not merely abusing alcohol, these sufferers become physically dependent on it, forming a chronic disease. Learn about the effects on the body, the brain, and the life of an alcoholic and ways to get help. Transcript

item.title: How to Donate Your Body to Science | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Donating your whole body to further science and medicine is probably the best thing you could do with your corpse. Which is why the industry that handles those gifts need regulating. Transcript

item.title: Nirvana: Not The Band | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Hinduism and Buddhism are closely related in a number of ways, including their vision of what comes after we exit this mortal coil. Learn about the religions’ interesting interpretation of the state of existence outside space-time. Transcript

item.title: How Hot Air Balloons Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Arguably the most beautiful objects in the entire world, hot air balloons take advantage of some interesting physics and have a long history of killing their occupants. Find out more. Transcript

item.title: How Umami Works! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For millennia humans have recognized four tastes, but in the 1980s a fifth taste first isolated in Japan gained worldwide acceptance - and took off like a rocket! Learn about meaty, musty, savory umami in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Pigeons: Homing, Passenger, Carrier and Otherwise | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pigeons can get a little confusing. Passengers, messengers, carriers, homing - the list goes on. But when it comes down to it, they’re all variations of the same smart bird with a knack for getting home to roost. Learn about these clever creatures in toda Transcript

item.title: Hula-Hoops: The Toy That's A Shape | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve covered our fair share of pop-culture icons and here is another - Hula-Hoops. They’ve been around since ancient time in some form or another, but made their name in during the Hoop Boom of the 1950s. Learn all about this popular fad and more. Transcript

item.title: How Auto-Tune Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What began as a challenge to an oil engineer to make a terrible singer into a pitch-perfect one, Auto-Tune has become a ubiquitous (and, to many, obnoxious) part of the musical soundscape. Transcript

item.title: How Droughts Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Droughts can be an inevitable feature of a local climate or a catastrophic result of human meddling. Learn the ins and outs of droughts including the American mother of them all, the Dust Bowl. Transcript

item.title: How Earth-Like Planets Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since the Kepler telescope went online, astronomers have found there may be an estimate 40 billion planets like Earth in the Milky Way galaxy alone. What does it take for a planet to be considered Earth-like? Transcript

item.title: How Bats Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They are creepy, sure, but they are also useful, cute and in great danger of extinction. Get a new lease on life from a new view of bats in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Profiling Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description At its base, criminal profiling is a legitimate investigatory tool. The Supreme Court has drawn a clear line that bans profiling when it includes race. So why do we still do it? Transcript

item.title: Road Rage: GRRRR!!! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description About half of all people experience rage on a daily basis when they get behind the wheel. What is it about driving that ticks us off so badly? Transcript

item.title: How Citizen's Arrests Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In some states, it is not only your right but your duty to arrest someone you see committing a crime. Learn all about why you should basically never do that in this episode. Transcript

item.title: The Time Nazis Invaded Florida | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description During World War II, Nazis invaded the United States with saboteurs bent on fomenting chaos. Three times. Transcript

item.title: How the Terracotta Army Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1974, Chinese farmers discovered the first of what would number 7,000 terracotta soldiers meant to protect China’s first emperor in the afterlife. Transcript

item.title: How Brickfilm Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What began as a pair of teens who made a film for their grandparents has exploded into its own art form. Learn all about how stop-motion Lego films are made. Transcript

item.title: How Egypt's Pyramids Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pyramids can be found in ruins around the world, but no civilization perfected the feat of engineering like Pharaonic Egypt. Learn about the mysteries that still surround these giants. Transcript

item.title: How Circus Families Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Don’t be confused - this one is about actual circus acts made of family members, not the controversial comic strip. Transcript

item.title: How Audience Testing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know some of our most beloved movies originally had different, sometimes better, endings? That is until they were tested in front of focus groups. Transcript

item.title: Mosquitoes: The Worst | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sun Tzu said know your enemy, and so it is in this spirit that we present this episode on one of the worst airborne pests in the world. Transcript

item.title: How Landfills Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Well-planned landfills have only recently come into widespread use. Recently, waste managers have found that they work a little too well and now the landfill is being reinvented. Transcript

item.title: Are You My Mother?: How Animal Imprinting Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What do little baby ducklings have to do with Nazis? A lot actually. Find out about animal imprinting experiments and the debate over their ethics. Transcript

item.title: How BASE Jumping Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You should never BASE Jump. It is one of the most genuinely dangerous sports on the planet. But with that out of the way, you should definitely learn all about this pastime where people jump from tall structures and outcroppings for fun and thrills. Transcript

item.title: Bridges: Nature Abhors Them | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description From prehistoric logs across streams to the 102-mile Kunshan Grand Bridge, nature works ceaselessly to take down spans. Learn about the fascinating ins and outs of bridge design and building and the mind-boggling challenges structural engineers face. Transcript

item.title: How the Wow! Signal Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1977, Ohio State astronomers discovered a radio transmission from space that was 30 times louder than the cosmic background noise. Since then every explanation of what it was has fallen short and the Wow! Signal remains possible evidence of alien life. Transcript

item.title: How Ocean Currents Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s easy to overlook the importance of ocean currents - they move along out at sea, while we stay mostly on land. But we are globally affected by them every day. Currents form the base of the food chain, drive weather and keep life as we know it going. Transcript

item.title: How Street Gangs Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The street gang problem in America peaked in the 1990s, but recent FBI reports find that gang membership doubled from 2006-2011. What’s driving this increase, and gangs in general? Wander into gang territory with Josh and Chuck in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Tupperware Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tupperware won immediate design acclaim when it was released in 1947, but it took a pioneering female executive to make a line of plastic food storage into an icon of the American postwar boom. Learn about the surprisingly intriguing history of Tupperware Transcript

item.title: How Junk Food Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Junk food is literally that, empty calories of energy that provide little nutritional value and usually are stored as fat. Yet junk food is irresistible and for good reason - companies spend tens of millions engineering it to be that way. Transcript

item.title: How Color Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Science doesn’t have a good explanation for why we sense color, yet it is everywhere and affecting us all the time. But why should minutely different wavelengths of light have such an impact on our moods and motivations? Transcript

item.title: How Internet Censorship Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Some of it seems innocuous enough: protecting kids from unseemly sites or intellectual property from piracy. But the tools to protect these things are the same that governments can also use to censor ideas and quell dissent. Transcript

item.title: How Pinewood Derbies Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Tens of millions of Scouts, and their parents, have taken standard blocks of wood and turned them into cars that zip along at up to 20 mph. Learn about the origin, physics and more of Pinewood Derbies in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Does the FDA Protect Americans? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The FDA was the first consumer protection agency in the US. Since 1906, it’s been issuing regulations meant to protect Americans from tainted food, ineffective drugs and pacemakers that don’t work. But is the FDA too cozy with industries it regulates? Transcript

item.title: Josh and Chuck Make It Through Male Puberty | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Around ages 9 or 10 a boy will begin to undergo a magical, surprising, weird, amazing, totally bonkers transformation from childhood to adulthood. To separate fact from myth, Chuck and Josh take on the role of gym teachers and wade into male puberty. Transcript

item.title: How Therapeutic Hypothermia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Physicians noticed centuries ago that people exposed to cold temperatures often have amazing recoveries from serious medical emergencies. Now medicine is learning how to purposefully induce hypothermia in order to buy time to fix otherwise fatal trauma. Transcript

item.title: How Spiders Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Spiders are second only to snakes in the dread departemnt, but they’re actually very helpful arachnids who are only deadly to humans under the worst case scenario. Of the more than 40,000 species, very few spiders are even venomous to humans. Learn everyt Transcript

item.title: How Water Slides Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Water slides have been around in one form or another since the Romans. But back then they didn’t know what they had on their hands. With the birth of the waterpark in the 1970s, these rides have only gotten more extreme, leading up to the birth of today’s Transcript

item.title: Oh No, Snakes! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you think snakes are legless reptile carnivores, then you are exactly right. If you think snakes are here to kill you then you are exactly wrong. Learn more about these fascinating and undeservedly condemned animals in today’s podcast episode. Transcript

item.title: How Clowns Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Jesters of some sort have been around since ancient Egypt and China. Our modern clown was invented around 1800 and ever since they have been getting steadily creepier. Transcript

item.title: How Zero Population Growth Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1968, Paul Erlich published The Population Bomb, predicting coming famine and mass death. Erlich’s predictions didn’t pan out but his ideas launched a debate still raging today. Transcript

item.title: How Slinky Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It has been called a “glorified spring”, but Slinky is one of the best selling toys of all time. From accidental origins to an unlikely resurrection, Slinky has a pretty great back story. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with blood types? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Blood types have one of the more interesting backstories in medical history. But as much as we’ve figured out about them and how they work, we still don’t know much about why we even have different blood types. Listen in for a truly fascinating look at yo Transcript

item.title: Polyamory: When two just won't do | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode of Stuff You Should Know, Josh and Chuck dive into the world of polyamory. Turns out polyamorists aren’t weirdos and deviants, they’re just regular folks looking for love from more than one person. Learn all you ever needed to know about t Transcript

item.title: Thanks, Easter Bunny! Bock Bock! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Easter from Stuff You Should Know! Learn all about Easter, from its humble beginnings as a pagan holiday to the multi-billion dollar industry it is today. We’ll cover the Biblical and religious aspects, along with the origins of some of Easter’s gre Transcript

item.title: Does the body replace itself? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Does the human body really replace itself every few years? The answer is yes, but different parts of the body do so at different rates. Learn all about which parts of your body are the speediest, and which take the longest to regenerate. Transcript

item.title: How Desalination Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Why would people want to remove salt from water? To solve the world’s water problem, that’s why. Learn all about the efforts to desalinate H2O in cheaper and more efficient ways. Transcript

item.title: 10 Bizarre Medical Treatments | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Medical science has a long and storied history of trying out cures and procedures that later strike us as wacky. And they’re still at it today! Learn about bizarre treatments, from opium for children to tobacco smoke enemas in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Earwax: Live With It | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Despite tons of people using cotton swabs each day to clean the earwax from their ears, cerumen (as earwax is clinically known) is actually quite beneficial to the health of your ears - and even kind of ingenious as your body’s defense goes. Transcript

item.title: How Anesthesia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The use of general anesthesia is less than 200 years old. Before doctors were able to cause unconsciousness in patients, surgery was brutal for all involved. But despite this advancement in medicine, science still has no idea how it works. Transcript

item.title: How Tea Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Legend has it that tea was discovered by a curious Chinese emperor after leaves blew into his boiled water. Now tea is the second only to water in popularity worldwide. And despite the varieties of tea, they all come from a single species of plant. Transcript

item.title: How Fleas Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Fleas are the bane of the existence of pet owners. From their eggs to their lifespan to their feeding habits, fleas are practically designed to be a nuisance. They are parasites, after all. Get down on flea level with Josh and Chuck in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Stonehenge Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Even as far back as the Roman invaders, people have had absolutely no idea just what the massive monument complex in England known as Stonehenge was built for. Join Josh and Chuck as they try to get to the bottom of this Neolithic mystery. Transcript

item.title: How ESP Works(?) | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Even though almost half of Americans believe in it, ESP usually is treated as a load of bull by skeptics. But some respected researchers have dared to apply the scientific method to investigate ESP and a few have found some surprising results. Transcript

item.title: Some Movies That Changed Filmmaking | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description An estimated 50,000 films were made worldwide in 2009 alone. Many are surely clunkers, but in this episode Chuck and Josh talk about the ones that emerged throughout cinema history to change the course of all movies that followed. Get your popcorn. Transcript

item.title: Why Do Lefties Exist? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For at least the last 200,000 years, between 10-15% of the human population are left-handed and this fact has utterly left science baffled. In searching to explain handedness, all sorts of contradictory evidence has emerged, creating a fascinating mystery Transcript

item.title: How Perfume Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Women consistently rate scent as the most important factor in a man’s attractiveness and men have been manipulating that for centuries with scents of all sorts. Learn about the fascinating history – and, well, art – of making perfumes in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Is there treasure on Oak Island? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Off Nova Scotia, the tiny spit of land called Oak Island has been host to waves of treasure hunters for more than 200 years. Some of them lost their lives in the search for a treasure reputedly buried in a deep pit. But is anything really there? Transcript

item.title: What is folklore? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What is folklore? Turns out it’s just about anything you can think of that’s shared by more than two people. Art, literature, stories, dance, music, traditions, even those family heirlooms qualify. Turns out folklore is pretty neat. Learn all about it in Transcript

item.title: How Feng Shui Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Feng Shui is an Asian concept that strives to unlock your chi by how your home or office is arranged. Or at least that’s the simplified “Western” version. It’s a little more complicated than that in reality. We’ll unlock your chi by explaining how feng sh Transcript

item.title: How Ice Cream Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We all scream for ice cream, sure, but did you know we’re all technically screaming about a colloidal foam? Prepare for deep cravings that will surely emerge as you learn the history of ice cream, how to make it yourself and lots more. Transcript

item.title: Rainbows: Delighting humanity since forever | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rainbows seem to defy nature, but they’re really pretty simple when it comes down to it. Turns out it’s just light reacting to water droplets in the air. But they sure do look cool. Learn all about how rainbows are formed in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: How Hot Wheels Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you’re an American who had a childhood, you probably have some nostalgia for Hot Wheels. Get your engines revved for this trip down memory lane as we discuss these fun and iconic toys. Transcript

item.title: How Poison Ivy Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Poison ivy, oak and sumac are all variations of the same plant and they all can make you itch… if you’re susceptible that is. In this episode, you’ll learn just about all there is to know about this itch-causing plant, including how to best avoid it. Transcript

item.title: Nostradamus: Predictor of the future? Not so much. | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Nostradamus delighted us all in grade school, but it turns out the real guy wasn’t quite as prescient as we were led to believe. In truth, he wrote a lot of purposefully confusing riddles that people have twisted into meaning exactly what they want them t Transcript

item.title: How the March on Washington Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description 1963 was a huge year of conflict and progress for the American Civil Rights Movement and the March On Washington was the high water mark of that eventful year. Join Josh and Chuck as they get into the story behind the story we learned in school. Transcript

item.title: Juggling: What the Heck | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a lot - A LOT - to juggling and Chuck and Josh go over the lion’s share of it. Delve into the deep history, physics, how-tos and different types of juggling in this surprisingly sweeping look at a putatively innocuous pastime. Transcript

item.title: How the Scientific Method Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It evolved over centuries to become the gold standard for conducting scientific inquiry. Yet many people - including some scientists - don’t fully understand it. Learn about the basis of how we explore our world in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Online Gambling Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pretty much immediately after the Internet was opened to the world online gambling sites sprang up. Over the last couple decades, U.S. law and online gambling have had an unusual and complicated relationship. Learn the ins and outs of this grey area. Transcript

item.title: How Jim Henson Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve already recorded an episode on The Muppets, but Jim Henson was such a neat guy we delved into him even further. Learn all about the man behind the Muppets who was so much more than just a master puppeteer in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK Live: How Bars Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Join Josh and Chuck live from Vancouver as they dive in to the ins and outs of one of the oldest businesses in the world - the bar! Learn about the history of bars, cocktails and the good people who put them together in new and amazing ways. Transcript

item.title: How Sea Monsters Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Legends of sea monsters are as old as humanity, and some ancient cultures even credited with creating the universe. Even today when the sea washes something odd ashore we see monsters - we understand there’s much more than appears above the surface. Transcript

item.title: Josh and Chuck's 2014 Christmas Extravaganza! | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s that time of year again! Time to get cozy and tuck in with Josh and Chuck as they spread glad tidings and warm Christmas cheer. Tune in to hear about Letters to Santa, A Christmas Story, mulled wine and more neat stuff. Transcript

item.title: How the GED Test Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The GED test was once part of a non-profit organization. That all changed in 2014, when it was privatized, made more expensive and more difficult to pass. But that also brought about a couple of more testing options. Learn all about how high school dropou Transcript

item.title: How Cinnamon Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In another commodities edition of SYSK, Josh and Chuck dive into the world of cinnamon, once the world’s most prized and pricey spice. But did you know it was really just dried up tree bark? Transcript

item.title: Boomerangs: Magic Sticks of Physics | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The physics behind returning boomerangs literally may be the most difficult concept to understand in the entire body of science. Join Josh and Chuck as they try their absolute best to describe how boomerangs work - and maybe even pull it off! Transcript

item.title: Homeschooling: Not Just For Hippies and Religious People Anymore | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in the 1970s, homeschooling was illegal in the U.S., but after activists of all stripes lobbied lawmakers, schooling kids at home has become a viable option for parents. And as more and more have chosen it, it’s become more mainstream. Transcript

item.title: How The Hum Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a mysterious droning sound often described as like a diesel engine idling that is severely impacting the quality of life of 2 percent of people in places around the world. The thing is, no one knows what’s causing it - or if it actually exists. Transcript

item.title: How X-Rays Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Like many huge discoveries, X-rays were accidentally stumbled upon. That serendipity led to a medical breakthrough still in use today. Learn about how X-rays are created and why they make such delightful images of our bones. Transcript

item.title: How Leper Colonies Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Leprosy, also known as Hansen’s disease, used to mean a one-way ticket to banishment. But once medicine trained its sights on wiping out what might be the most ancient disease to afflict humans, it has become treatable and even accepted. Transcript

item.title: How Terraforming Will Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A lot of great thinkers are warning that if humans are to survive as a species we are going to have to find another planet to live on. Terraforming, or engineering a planet to maintain all of the ingredients to sustain life, seems to be the answer. Transcript

item.title: How Kickstarter Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With billions of dollars raised, Kickstarter has singled itself out as the go-to site for creative crowdfunding. But not without some controversy along the way. Learn all about how this artistic business model operates in today’s episode. Transcript

item.title: What is Collective Hysteria? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Throughout the history of the world, there have been many cases of what is known as collective hysteria - groups of people, usually young women, who all exhibit the same physical symptoms of non-existent conditions. Is it psychosomatic? Is it group think? Transcript

item.title: How the Enlightenment Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The Enlightenment stands as the moment the West withdrew from superstition and found its faith in reason. Did it shift too far? Learn about this massive shift in thinking which we are still sorting through and coming to understand today. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with crop circles? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For a while in the 1980s, people were fascinated and confused about what exactly crop circles were. Now we know that they aren’t signs left from aliens, but art made by humans. Learn all about these stunning, large form art installations in today’s episod Transcript

item.title: How Patents Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What was originally designed to encourage innovation by rewarding the people who create technological advances, the U.S. patent system has become a big mess. Wade into this surprisingly interesting mire to learn how to save this important institution. Transcript

item.title: How Limousines Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The first limousines weren’t even cars! Learn all about the history of limousines, how they’re made and some of the most creative and expensive amenities you can find inside them in this episode with Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: Can Nuclear Fusion Reactors Save The World? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The world’s energy consumption is ruining the planet but for decades physicists have been working on what could solve the world’s energy and climate change woes for centuries to come - nuclear fusion. Learn about building stars on Earth in this episode. Transcript

item.title: SYSK's Halloween Scare Fest | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Get ready to be creeped out and join Chuck and Josh as they read you with two spooky classic horror stories, The Striding Place and The Pale Man in this special bonus Halloween episode. Transcript

item.title: How Haunted House Attractions Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever since the Egyptians, humans have been evolving toward haunted house attractions. The level of sophistication in the scares and gore effects continues to rise over time, but the purpose remains the same: to scare the pants off you. Transcript

item.title: Is there a disease that kills by preventing sleep? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The strange disease of fatal familial insomnia was first recorded in the 18th century. Its victims lose their ability to sleep, slip into coma and die. The more we understand about FFI, the more mysterious it becomes. Transcript

item.title: How Animal Camouflage Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The wild kingdom is filled with examples of animals that can camouflage themselves into their environment, but the means and the methods are also wildly varied. Learn about the ins and outs of blending in through this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Extinction Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Scientists believe that 99% of the estimated 50 billion species that have ever lived on Earth have disappeared through extinction. This is a natural process typically, but it can also be cataclysmic and it’s becoming clear we are amid a massive one. Transcript

item.title: How The Great Train Robbery Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In 1963, 15 men got together in England to pull off one of the most daring heists in history. The Great Train Robbery was the crime of the century, capturing the public’s attention and leaving them torn on who to root for - the cops or the robbers. Learn Transcript

item.title: Virus Talk with Josh and Chuck | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Viruses are big jerks that invade regular cells and hold them hostage, making you sick while they’re doing it. Learn everything you ever needed to know about viruses, including how the common cold works. Transcript

item.title: How Skywriting Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in the 1920s, skywriting was invented to communicate with troops, but it quickly found its footing as a popular way for companies to advertise. Learn all about the aerial acrobatics and mental skill it takes to write mile-high letters backwards. Transcript

item.title: How Karate Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Karate, meaning “open” and “hand”, was developed in Okinawa before being exported to Japan and then the rest of the world. It is one of the most widely practiced martial arts and one of the most difficult to master. Learn about it in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Panic Attacks Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Almost three percent of Americans suffer from a debilitating disorder that causes them to suffer intense fear seemingly without reason and science hasn’t yet figured out what causes it. Join Josh and Chuck as they get to the bottom of panic attacks. Transcript

item.title: How Rogue Waves Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Rogue waves come out of nowhere and tower as much as 100 feet over hapless ships they encounter, breaking across the boat and frequently breaking the boat and its inhabitants. Investigate the mystery of rouge waves in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Animal Domestication Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s strange to hear, but the transition from hunting-gathering to agriculture, including the domestication of wild animals, is the single biggest thing to ever happen to humanity. You can thank it for everything from kingdoms to Ebola. Transcript

item.title: How Police Interrogation Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Every year, police across the U.S. get thousands of criminals to confess to their crimes. The trouble is, the procedure that almost all departments use is grounded in bad science and can produce false confessions. Learn about ways of making you talk. Transcript

item.title: How Currency Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Even if you entirely eschew the concept of money, we’ll bet you’d be hard pressed not to trade in some form of currency. Learn how everything from cows to cacao beans to tiny shells from Maldives have served as currency at some time or another. Transcript

item.title: How Socialism Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In America it’s virtually a dirty word, but after being dragged through the mud for a century, socialism is still a part of the U.S.’s national character. Learn about this foil and complement to capitalism and why it might not be so bad. Transcript

item.title: How Stem Cells Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since scientists realized there is a type of cell that can grow into any other type, they have worked to use them to heal human conditions like Parkinson’s and immune disorders. But because stem cells often come from embryos they remain controversial. Transcript

item.title: How TV Ratings Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Ever wonder why some great shows go off the air after a season or less? Blame it on the Nielsen company, which has for more than 60 years been the almost exclusive decider of what goes and what stays on TV. Transcript

item.title: How Pinball Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Pinball was actually illegal until the 1970s in NY and other cities, hidden in the backs of pornography shops. The game was finally legalized, thanks to a Babe Ruth-style shot by the best player in the world. Learn all about it with Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: How Blimps Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description After newsreels captured the Hindenburg erupting in fire in 1937, the promising development of airship aviation was cut short. Today companies and militaries are taking another look at blimps and the unique qualities that may revive them. Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with headstones? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Headstones have quite an interesting history. From the beginnings of marking graves with simple wood carvings to the elaborate tombstones that would come in the Victorian era, Chuck and Josh break down the deal with all things headstone in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How the Berlin Wall Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s hard to believe now, but just over 25 years ago there was a giant concrete wall separating East and West Germany. In this episode, Chuck and Josh get into the fascinating story of the Berlin Wall. Transcript

item.title: Going Up: Elevators | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Elevators are way more interesting than you might think. In this week’s episode, Chuck and Josh board the lift to enlighten everyone as to the ins and outs, and ups and downs, of these handy people movers. Transcript

item.title: How Ebola Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A disease that was discovered and contained to Central Africa in the 1970s has revived and spread in 2014. Now there is an Ebola outbreak that has moved across borders and science still has no cure for it. Transcript

item.title: How the NSA Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Chuck and Josh dive into the secret world of the National Security Agency, from the origins of the snooping outfit, to the recent revelations from whistleblower Edward Snowden. Transcript

item.title: What is a Numbers Station? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you think secretly coded messages sent via short wave radio is Cold War relic, think again. Chuck and Josh are here to dispel that myth, along with many others relating to numbers stations, including why they might still be operational. Transcript

item.title: How Play-Doh Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Do you love Play-Doh? Chuck and Josh certainly love to talk about it, from its interesting history as a wall cleaner, to its more scientific chemical properties. It’s everything you ever wanted to know about the pliable children’s toy. Transcript

item.title: How Morgellons Disease Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There is a condition that can cause people to feel bugs crawling beneath their skin so acutely that they will use tweezers to pluck them from their eyeballs. It’s a terrible disorder made worse by medicine’s insistence it is all in sufferers’ heads. Transcript

item.title: Is there a dark side of the moon? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Josh and Chuck explore the old notion that there’s a dark side of the moon. There is, but it turns out it’s not always the same side. And yes, there’s a side we never see, but it’s not always dark. Make sense? It will in this episode. Transcript

item.title: The Skinny on Probiotics | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You can find probiotics - bacteria thought to have healthful benefits for humans - in everything from pills to yogurt. But does any of it work? Listen as Josh and Chuck get to the bottom of the science (and need for it) of probiotics and health. Transcript

item.title: How Trickle-Down Economics Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The concept of trickle-down economics is tied to Ronald Reagan, but the idea’s been around and in use since the 20s. It’s simple: Give more money to the wealthy and they can use it to rev up an economy. But is the whole thing just a scam? Transcript

item.title: How In Vitro Fertlization Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the U.S. alone, more than 6 million people are affected by infertility and science has taken up the mantle of helping them to conceive. Learn about the clever, though intuitive, methods of assisting infertile couples to have a child. Transcript

item.title: How Sushi Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sushi grew out of a way to ferment fish a couple thousand years ago and in the late 20th century began to take the world by storm. What began as traditional, rigid food has come to evolve with new delicious innovations being added to the original canon. Transcript

item.title: How Grass Works? Yes, How Grass Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There’s nothing more boring than watching grass grow, which is why Josh and Chuck aren’t asking you to do that. Instead, you can learn about all sorts of neat things about grass - like how America became obsessed with perfect lawns - in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Is brain size related to intelligence? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The idea that the larger the brain, the higher the intelligence is an old one, but it’s pretty much utterly false. Modern investigation into how the brain works suggests there’s a lot more to take into account when comparing brain biology to intellect. Transcript

item.title: How Monopoly Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since more than 1 billion people have played it, you’re probably familiar with the board game Monopoly, but we bet you don’t know its secret origins as a left-wing socialist teaching tool. Learn about the history, rules and cultural impact of Monopoly. Transcript

item.title: How The Louvre Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The most famous museum in the world, France’s Louvre, has been the seat of high art and culture for several centuries. Its history goes back farther than that, beginning in the 1200s as a fort and prison. Tour the Louvre and its collections in this episod Transcript

item.title: How the MPAA Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You may be surprised to learn those ubiquitous ratings, from G to NC-17, put on movies in America are actually handed down by anonymous employees of a secretive organization that serves as a lobbying firm for Hollywood’s six biggest studios. Transcript

item.title: How the La Brea Tar Pits Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It’s surprising that a few 12-feet-deep pools of asphalt have proven to be one of the most significant troves of Pleistocene fossils, but the La Brea Tar Pits, located in the heart of Los Angeles, are giving science a clear picture of a puzzling time. Transcript

item.title: How Soccer Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Maybe you hail from a soccer crazed country - or from the U.S. Either way, there’s lots to discuss about “the beautiful game”, from its prehistory, rules and strategy to, of course, the World Cup. Join Josh and Chuck as they wade into football, aka soccer Transcript

item.title: Is your employer spying on you? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Your employer may be secretly reading your emails, watching what websites you visit and tracking your whereabouts through your phone. And because of how the courts have ruled, there’s nothing you can do about it. Learn all about employer spying here. Transcript

item.title: Sugar: It Powers the Earth | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since sugar spread from Polynesia a few thousand years ago, the world has been crazy for it. Insanely high prices, wars and even slavery couldn’t undo world’s need for a sugar fix. Today that fix is responsible for the obesity epidemic facing the West. Transcript

item.title: How the Placebo Effect Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For centuries, doctors have prescribed drugs they knew weren’t real - but that still somehow worked. It wasn’t until the 1980s that the placebo effect, the phenomenon where an inert substance can have a genuine impact on a patient’s recovery, was studied. Transcript

item.title: How the Space Race Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description In the 1950s and 60s, the United States and the Soviet Union battled it out to see who would dominate the race for outer space. The Soviets got out to an early lead, but the U.S. would ultimately win. Learn all about the Space Race in this week’s episode. Transcript

item.title: Why is Venice so wet? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Venice, Italy has a problem. It’s sinking, and the water around it is rising. Thankfully, some engineers are working hard on the MOSE project - huge gates that keep high tide from happening. Learn all about Venice in this episode. Transcript

item.title: Archaeology in a Nutshell | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If you thought Indiana Jones was the model archaeologist, you’re pretty much right. Archaeologists are one part scientist, one part scholar, and one part adventurer. In this episode, learn all you need to know this fascinating field. Transcript

item.title: How Temper Tantrums Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description When your kid boils over in the grocery store, it can be tough to stay calm and ignore it, but that’s precisely what experts prescribe parents do to deal with temper tantrums. Learn about the anatomy of a tantrum and the best way to deal in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Avalanches Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Each year, as snow builds on peaks across the world’s mountain ranges, the potential for avalanches builds. Learn about the science of how these natural disasters develop and are triggered - and how to survive one if you ever find yourself trapped. Transcript

item.title: 8 Reasons Why Your Body Is So Gross | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Your body right now is home to a liter of mucous, countless fat-loving mites, acid that can dissolve metal and plenty of other gross and interesting stuff. Learn all about your body and its functions here. Transcript

item.title: How the Paleo Diet Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You may have heard of the Paleo Diet, also known as the Caveman Diet, but do you know the science it’s based on? And did you know that the saturated fat it and other diets avoid may be healthier than you were taught in school? Transcript

item.title: How the Human Microbiome Project Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description If it was possible to take a full scan of all of the DNA of every cell in and on your body the results would be startling: Only 1 percent would be human. The other 99 percent comprises all of the bacteria, fungi, viruses and other microbes you literally c Transcript

item.title: How Bipolar Disorder Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Suffering from bipolar disorder means a lot more than your garden variety mood swings. Bouts of mania and depression are just the headlines. There are also theories that there’s a link between bipolarism and creativity. Learn all about this disruptive, ye Transcript

item.title: How Gypsies Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Gypsies were called that because they were long ago mistaken as Egyptians. Even their more appropriate name, Roma, is a misnomer since they’re not from Romania. Find out about the mysterious history of this nomadic and genuinely misunderstood ethnic group Transcript

item.title: How Marijuana Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description For millennia people used marijuana for fun and medicine. Not until the 20th century that was it vilified, unfairly say many. Weed has done lots of good things, from alleviating cancer symptoms to unlocking secrets of the brain. Learn all about pot here. Transcript

item.title: How the ACLU Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Being a card-carrying member of the ACLU is tantamount to being a super liberal to some, but the ACLU ultimately displays no allegiance to any political philosophy, only to whomever’s Constitutional rights are being infringed upon, from Nazis to the NAACP Transcript

item.title: Halitosis: Worst Smell Ever? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Occasional bad breath is one thing, halitosis is another. Or is it? From its odd origins as a marketing ploy to modern weight loss diets that can induce this embarrassing condition, you can learn all about bad breath here. Transcript

item.title: How Mars Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Sure today Mars would kill you with its thin, toxic atmosphere and cold desert temperature swings of 100 degrees, but early on it and Earth were practically twins. Find out how the two planets diverged and if there might be life on the Red Planet. Transcript

item.title: How Burlesque Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description What’s old is new again as far as burlesque is concerned. Come explore what was an old-timey outlet for empowering women that later gave rise to the striptease once men started running the show. Now, women have reclaimed the art and it is benefiting. Transcript

item.title: How Dissociative Identity Disorder Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Dissociative Identity Disorder was known as multiple personality disorder until a case of mass hysteria brought on by the movie-mad public and unscrupulous psychiatrists led to a stigma over the term. Now psychiatry has gotten serious about the condition. Transcript

item.title: How Natural Selection Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description While evolution gets all the spotlight for moving species into better versions of themselves, but really it’s natural selection that is the engine driving the process. Learn all about this elegant scientific observation that forms the basis of life. Transcript

item.title: How Charles Darwin Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Charles Darwin wasn’t the first or only scientist to grasp the theory of evolution through natural selection, but he became its father and icon. Learn about the man who reluctantly but bravely became the source of the divide between religion and science. Transcript

item.title: How Income Taxes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description They are among the more reviled concepts of modern life, and yet they are as inevitable as death. Join Josh and Chuck as they look into the history and the basis of income taxes in the U.S. in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How 3D Printing Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With 3D printing you can print not just pictures and words, but actual objects from files. And as costs come down, the list of things you can print expand: from food, to organs, to guns. Transcript

item.title: How Landslides Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Landslides are a form of mass movement of the Earth, and with the amount of death and destruction they wreak on the people and towns they cover, their toll can be massive. Learn all about landslides in this episode with Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: How Amnesia Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Those movies where someone gets hit on the head and can’t remember who they are anymore? They’re actually not too far off from the reality of amnesia. Learn everything about this bizarre and life-robbing condition with Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: How Electricity Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It is literally all around you (and even inside you) - electricity makes up the basis of modern life. But what exactly is electricity and how does it work? Josh and Chuck chase away the darkness and explain electricity in their usual electrifying way. Transcript

item.title: Tattoos: Not Just For Dirtbags Anymore | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Most Europeans first encountered tattoos after sailors visiting the South Pacific returned covered in them. From then on, with a few notable exceptions, tattoos have been associated with fringe dwellers in the West. Learn all about tats in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Black Boxes Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Black boxes are designed to be the only survivor of plane crashes so they can live to tell the tale of what went wrong to prevent future accidents. Learn about how these grim devices are made, how they’re tested and the tales they’ve told. Transcript

item.title: How Skateboarding Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Skateboarding started out as something bored surfers did when the waves weren’t breaking, but after a few improvements to the design, it took off like a rocket to become its own cultural phenomenon. Come gleam the cube with Josh and Chuck. Transcript

item.title: How Online Dating Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description No longer weird, possibly still desperate and approaching normal, online dating’s been around almost as long as the Internet itself. So what exactly is the best way to find love online if one were so inclined to do so? Josh and Chuck hook you up. Transcript

item.title: How the Spanish Inquisition Worked | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description The idea of pious monks imbued with unbridled power and with a penchant for dealing torture and death is a scary one indeed, and one both Spain and the Catholic Church have tried to reconcile since the Spanish Inquisition ended in the 19th century. Transcript

item.title: What happened at Kent State? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description On May 4, 1970, four days of anti-war protests at Kent State University in Ohio culminated in the unthinkable when Ohio guardsmen opened fire on protesters, killing four students. How could this tragedy take place? Transcript

item.title: Termites: They Bore But They Aren't Boring | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Their soft white bodies look creepy and, to be sure, they are, but termites are pretty amazing bugs. They build ventilation systems into their mounds, poop on their enemies and grow mushrooms. Learn all the neat stuff you didn’t know about termites here. Transcript

item.title: How Amputation Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Amputation is one of the oldest surgeries and an even older punishment for crime, but it wasn’t until the American Civil War and its 50,000 amputations that the procedure began to hit its stride. Learn about amputation and who it attracts in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Salt Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description A Roman senator once said, “Mankind can live without gold, but not without salt.” Right he was. The human body needs salt so much we have developed a taste for it specifically. But too much salt can be toxic. Learn about salt’s role in human history and h Transcript

item.title: How Cave Dwellers Work | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description You know the cavemen, a race of human cousins who lived exclusively in caves? They didn’t exist. Sure prehistoric hominids used caves sometimes but they lived in other places too. Luckily the time they spent in caves has given us a glance at their culture Transcript

item.title: Do objects or experiences make us happier? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Since Sartre classified things that make us happy into the categories of having and doing, science took up the investigation into materialism and experientialism. The results have been in for a while: experiences win by a wide margin, but why exactly? Transcript

item.title: How Sign Language Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description It wasn’t until the was developed and despite its co-existence alongside English, a user would be hard-pressed to sign with a British person. Find out about the independent evolution of sign language in the U.S. and how intuitively sensible it is. Transcript

item.title: Will computers replace doctors? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description With savvy and health-conscious people taking control of their wellbeing through apps and sites, technology is meeting the desire for individuals’ responsibility for their health. But is the day coming soon when doctors will be obsolete, replaced by compu Transcript

item.title: What are crystal skulls? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Back in the early 20th-century mysterious skulls made from polished crystals began to enter the collections of private enthusiasts of the occult. Discovered by adventurers raiding sacred areas of the ancient world, these skulls were said to possess unusua Transcript

item.title: What's the deal with the debt ceiling? | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Lately it’s been common news fodder that Congress uses its ability to raise the debt ceiling to hold the executive branch hostage to its demands, but exactly how does that work, and what does the debt ceiling do? Learn about it in this fascinating episode Transcript

item.title: How the Deep Web Works | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description Perhaps you didn’t realize that when you search the web you’re only skimming the surface. In fact, the types of web pages that turn up in your search engine results represent only a mere fraction of the total web. Immerse yourself in the Deep web and its Transcript

item.title: Chuck and Josh Bust a Few Everyday Myths | Stuff You Should Know
item.description: Podcast Description There are lots of common “facts” that everyone knows, but it turns out a lot of them are actually false. Join Josh and Chuck as they put on their berets and suspenders and take the hot air out of some common everyday myths to make this a slightly smarter Transcript

item.title: How Pet Psychics Work | Stuff You Should Know
